2020-10-04.abstract: A point against Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City felt like a victory for Leeds. But for Bielsa and his many admirers, the journey always says more than the scoreboard.
2020-10-04.snippet: A point against Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City felt like a victory for Leeds. But for Bielsa and his many admirers, the journey always says more than the scoreboard.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: LEEDS, England — The spot where they filmed the scene in “The Damned United” is a wasteland now, and it has been for some time: a patch of land in the lee of Elland Road, long earmarked for some development or other. Before it was sealed off behind security fencing, a couple of excavators standing as idle sentries, it was a parking lot, and before that, it was Leeds United’s training center.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Results, Respect and Marcelo Bielsa

2020-10-04.abstract: Remembering the people who died from the coronavirus — through those who loved them.
2020-10-04.snippet: Remembering the people who died from the coronavirus — through those who loved them.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: When we began this episode, we imagined an audio obituary — a celebration of the one million lives that we’ve lost to the coronavirus. But then, we picked up the phones. We called the friends and family who loved these people in the ugly, messy, tender way that love works. The phone calls were breathy and raw. Quiet. There was laughing, crying, heaving and sobbing.
2020-10-04.headline_main: One Million Lives

2020-10-04.abstract: It’s important to cook, wherever you are, and whatever you’re experiencing. Here are a few recipes to help.
2020-10-04.snippet: It’s important to cook, wherever you are, and whatever you’re experiencing. Here are a few recipes to help.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: The West is still on fire, and coronavirus continues to stalk the nation, particularly the Upper Midwest. Political tension vibrates in advance of the coming election. Everywhere the effects of systemic racism have been laid bare. Social isolation, meanwhile, has led to increases in overdoses, to declines in mental health, to loneliness so intense as to be personified: a new roommate, silent and angry. So many are out of work.
2020-10-04.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2020-10-04.abstract: Josh Allen and the Buffalo Bills have their best start to the season since 2008.
2020-10-04.snippet: Josh Allen and the Buffalo Bills have their best start to the season since 2008.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: The idea of “tests” in the N.F.L. is usually a figurative one — how will Team X respond to the test of So-and-So’s defense? Until this week, pro football had been blissfully unencumbered by the scrambling and rescheduling to deal with positive coronavirus tests that other leagues have dealt with.
2020-10-04.headline_main: N.F.L. Week 4: Bills Go to 4-0 With Win Over Raiders

2020-10-04.abstract: The Nashville singer and songwriter learned from the genre’s past and carved his own path.
2020-10-04.snippet: The Nashville singer and songwriter learned from the genre’s past and carved his own path.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Luke Combs has put out two albums in the last three years — both remained firmly entrenched in the Top 5 of the Billboard country album chart since their release. His stranglehold makes him the most promising and influential new country star of the last five years, something he’s achieved by learning from the sins of the genre’s recent past.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Luke Combs’s Country Stardom and the Remaking of the Bro

2020-10-04.abstract: The federal tax code aligns the interests of the middle class with the ultrawealthy. But the alliance may be breaking up.
2020-10-04.snippet: The federal tax code aligns the interests of the middle class with the ultrawealthy. But the alliance may be breaking up.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Much of the commentary on the fresh revelations about President Trump’s tax returns has focused on how they illustrate the vulnerability of the federal tax system to exploitation by the ultrarich. This is for good reason: Mr. Trump aggressively used a set of tax breaks popular with real estate developers to pay no taxes in 11 out of the previous 18 years, and just $750 for both 2016 and 2017.
2020-10-04.headline_main: The American Dream Is Tax Reform’s Biggest Obstacle

2020-10-04.abstract: Speed and scale may matter more than absolute effectiveness when it comes to tests, masks, treatments and vaccines.
2020-10-04.snippet: Speed and scale may matter more than absolute effectiveness when it comes to tests, masks, treatments and vaccines.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: It is a basic instinct of infectious diseases clinicians and researchers to seek and prescribe prophylactics or treatments that are almost guaranteed to benefit the patients who entrust us with their care.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Against Covid-19, Imperfect Measures Do the Most Good

2020-10-04.abstract: Eighty years after Londoners rallied in the face of the deadly German Blitz, many are flouting the rules aimed at preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus.
2020-10-04.snippet: Eighty years after Londoners rallied in the face of the deadly German Blitz, many are flouting the rules aimed at preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: LONDON — During a recent visit to a private London hospital, I was horrified to encounter a delivery man wheeling in a load of supplies without wearing a face mask. An orderly in blue scrubs stood inside the elevator, three feet from me, with his mask draped around his chin.
2020-10-04.headline_main: ‘Keep Calm and Carry On’ May Not Work in a Time of Pandemic

2020-10-04.abstract: Diplomatic ties with the U.A.E. and Bahrain could create new opportunities. But many say they are loath to undercut the Palestinian cause.
2020-10-04.snippet: Diplomatic ties with the U.A.E. and Bahrain could create new opportunities. But many say they are loath to undercut the Palestinian cause.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — For Israel’s Arab citizens, the normalization deals that Israel struck with the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain will mean newfound freedom to stroll through Dubai’s cavernous malls, take lucrative jobs in Abu Dhabi or solicit investments from wealthy Emiratis or Bahrainis.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Bright Lights of Dubai Beckon Israel’s Arabs but Pose a Quandary

2020-10-04.abstract: Nikol Pashinyan, Armenia’s prime minister, said he was promised a call with President Trump over Turkey’s role in the intensifying conflict in Nagorno-Karabakh. Then Mr. Trump fell ill.
2020-10-04.snippet: Nikol Pashinyan, Armenia’s prime minister, said he was promised a call with President Trump over Turkey’s role in the intensifying conflict in Nagorno-Karabakh. Then Mr. Trump fell ill.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: When Nikol Pashinyan, Armenia’s prime minister, spoke by telephone on Thursday with President Trump’s national security adviser, he raised a delicate issue: Why is nothing being done to stop a longtime United States ally, Turkey, from using American-made F-16 jets against ethnic Armenians in a disputed mountain region?
2020-10-04.headline_main: Armenia’s Leader Makes Plea to U.S. as Conflict Rages With Azerbaijan

2020-10-04.abstract: In “Loretta Little Looks Back,” a novel in monologues, Andrea Davis Pinkney invites young readers to “go tell it” by reciting along with the characters.
2020-10-04.snippet: In “Loretta Little Looks Back,” a novel in monologues, Andrea Davis Pinkney invites young readers to “go tell it” by reciting along with the characters.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: LORETTA LITTLE LOOKS BACKThree Voices Go Tell ItBy Andrea Davis PinkneyIllustrated by Brian Pinkney
2020-10-04.headline_main: From Sharecropping to the Voting Booth in 3 Generations

2020-10-04.abstract: Activists armed with millions of dollars from donors like Michael Bloomberg and LeBron James are canvassing in Florida to help former felons register to vote before a deadline on Monday.
2020-10-04.snippet: Activists armed with millions of dollars from donors like Michael Bloomberg and LeBron James are canvassing in Florida to help former felons register to vote before a deadline on Monday.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — For Lucas Melton and his team of field organizers, their all-out campaign to register former felons to vote in Florida before the Monday deadline begins with informing them that they are eligible in the first place.
2020-10-04.headline_main: ‘Real Change’: A Race Is On to Register Ex-Felons in Florida

2020-10-04.abstract: In “Black Heroes of the Wild West,” James Otis Smith introduces a new audience to Stagecoach Mary, Bass Reeves and Bob Lemmons.
2020-10-04.snippet: In “Black Heroes of the Wild West,” James Otis Smith introduces a new audience to Stagecoach Mary, Bass Reeves and Bob Lemmons.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: BLACK HEROES OF THE WILD WESTBy James Otis SmithIntroduction by Kadir Nelson
2020-10-04.headline_main: Comics That Dismantle the White Cowboy Myth

2020-10-04.abstract: Readers offer strong views of a recent column by David Brooks.
2020-10-04.snippet: Readers offer strong views of a recent column by David Brooks.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2020-10-04.headline_main: Can We Reconcile Faith and Politics?

2020-10-04.abstract: Dives for loose balls. Flops to draw fouls. Soaked facial hair. They all lead to sweat on the court, and that’s a problem when N.B.A. players are running up and down the floor.
2020-10-04.snippet: Dives for loose balls. Flops to draw fouls. Soaked facial hair. They all lead to sweat on the court, and that’s a problem when N.B.A. players are running up and down the floor.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. — In the opening game of the N.B.A. finals last week, LeBron James of the Los Angeles Lakers toppled to the court after drawing a foul. As soon as he went down, two people wielding large towels sprang into action from behind the basket. They had one job, and it was a vital one: mop up James’s sweat.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Fear the Beard Sweat: These N.B.A. Workers Keep the Court Dry

2020-10-04.abstract: “Today, unfortunately, is not a day for celebration,” the mayor said of rising virus rates. His plan would affect 20 neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Queens.
2020-10-04.snippet: “Today, unfortunately, is not a day for celebration,” the mayor said of rising virus rates. His plan would affect 20 neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Queens.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: [Update: Governor Cuomo said on Monday that he would not approve the closing of businesses in nine hard-hit parts of New York City.]
2020-10-04.headline_main: Fearing 2nd Wave, N.Y.C. Will Adopt Restrictions in Hard-Hit Areas

2020-10-04.abstract: A writer is aware of racism in medicine, but felt that volunteering was “the only way we will get out of this pandemic.” Also: In Japan, a step toward gender equality.
2020-10-04.snippet: A writer is aware of racism in medicine, but felt that volunteering was “the only way we will get out of this pandemic.” Also: In Japan, a step toward gender equality.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2020-10-04.headline_main: I’m Black, and I Joined a Vaccine Trial

2020-10-04.abstract: A new memoir and rarities collection show the powerhouse vocalist and songwriter’s evolution into a poised, boundary-blurring pop superstar.
2020-10-04.snippet: A new memoir and rarities collection show the powerhouse vocalist and songwriter’s evolution into a poised, boundary-blurring pop superstar.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: On the rainy night in the mid-1990s when Mariah Carey first kissed Derek Jeter — a tentative step away from her suffocating marriage to Tommy Mottola, the music mogul who had been crucial to building her career — the singer, drenched, returned to her waiting limo and turned on the radio. What she heard was the “grimy, dangerous, sexy-ass beat” of Mobb Deep’s “Shook Ones Pt. II,” one of the crucial New York rap statements of all time, the sort of desolate song that can drop the temperature 20 or 30 degrees in an instant.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Mariah Carey, Elusive No More

2020-10-04.abstract: All four series feature division rivals facing off, but the packed schedule means regular-season tactics might not cut it.
2020-10-04.snippet: All four series feature division rivals facing off, but the packed schedule means regular-season tactics might not cut it.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: One by one they disappeared from the playoffs, like naughty children on Willy Wonka’s factory tour. The Minnesota Twins plunged into the chocolate river. The Cleveland Indians turned into a blueberry. The Cincinnati Reds fell down a chute. The Chicago White Sox were shrunk on TV.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Division Series: Faces Are Familiar, but the Landscape Has Changed

2020-10-04.abstract: The possible addition of Judge Amy Coney Barrett could create “the Trump court,” pushing it rightward. Cases on the Affordable Care Act and religious objections to gay rights could offer early clues.
2020-10-04.snippet: The possible addition of Judge Amy Coney Barrett could create “the Trump court,” pushing it rightward. Cases on the Affordable Care Act and religious objections to gay rights could offer early clues.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A short-handed Supreme Court — driven from its courtroom by the pandemic, grieving over the loss of a colleague and awaiting the outcome of a divisive confirmation battle — will return to the virtual bench on Monday to start a term that will present Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. with a daunting test.
2020-10-04.headline_main: New Supreme Court Term Could End Roberts’s Dominant Role

2020-10-04.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York announced plans to close nonessential businesses, schools and day care centers in nine neighborhoods where the coronavirus testing positivity rates have been higher than 3 percent in the past 7 days.
2020-10-04.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York announced plans to close nonessential businesses, schools and day care centers in nine neighborhoods where the coronavirus testing positivity rates have been higher than 3 percent in the past 7 days.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York announced plans to close nonessential businesses, schools and day care centers in nine neighborhoods where the coronavirus testing positivity rates have been higher than 3 percent in the past 7 days.
2020-10-04.headline_main: New York to ‘Rewind’ Re-Opening in Hard-Hit Neighborhoods

2020-10-04.abstract: It’s not your imagination. This glut of sports events is kind of epic.
2020-10-04.snippet: It’s not your imagination. This glut of sports events is kind of epic.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Remember when all there was to watch was South Korean baseball and cherry-pit spitting?
2020-10-04.headline_main: Snooker, Handball, N.B.A.? It’s the Craziest Sports Calendar Ever

2020-10-04.abstract: The Republican Party’s slide from statewide power to irrelevance in Delaware mirrored its swerve from moderation to the fringe. Now a QAnon fan is running for the Senate.
2020-10-04.snippet: The Republican Party’s slide from statewide power to irrelevance in Delaware mirrored its swerve from moderation to the fringe. Now a QAnon fan is running for the Senate.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — Lauren Witzke, a dabbler in QAnon, a self-proclaimed “flat earther” and the Republican Party’s nominee in Delaware for the Senate, was exhorting her supporters last month to “Go get ’em — America First,” as they squared off against a handful of Black Lives Matter protesters.
2020-10-04.headline_main: In Biden’s Home State, Republican Centrism Gives Way to the Fringe

2020-10-04.abstract: With his political career, his business dealings and his reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now, though, he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
2020-10-04.snippet: With his political career, his business dealings and his reputation, the president has long bet that he can ride out difficulties. Now, though, he is facing an entirely unfamiliar threat.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: [Watch live VP debate and analysis.]
2020-10-04.headline_main: Trump Confronts a New Form of Risk, More Personal and Perilous

2020-10-04.abstract: After surviving some of the bloodiest combat in Afghanistan, the men of the Second Battalion, Seventh Marine Regiment stayed connected on social media for support at home as they grappled with the fallout of war.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: After surviving some of the bloodiest combat in Afghanistan, the men of the Second Battalion, Seventh Marine Regiment stayed connected on social media for support at home as they grappled with the fallout of war.
2020-10-04.headline_main: For veterans, toxic rhetoric and political polarization are a new source of division.

2020-10-04.abstract: The president is hospitalized. The public doesn’t need to know every detail, but they don’t deserve to be misled.
2020-10-04.snippet: The president is hospitalized. The public doesn’t need to know every detail, but they don’t deserve to be misled.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: The American people deserve better than to be misled about the health of the president.
2020-10-04.headline_main: The American People Need the Truth

2020-10-04.snippet: Over an unprecedented weekend, the hospitalized president relied on very familiar image-making.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: [Read our live updates on President Trump’s coronavirus diagnosis.]
2020-10-04.headline_main: Sick With Covid, Trump Tries to Paint the Picture of Health on TV

2020-10-04.abstract: Trump’s illness, US-India ties, Kenzo: Here’s what you need to know.
2020-10-04.snippet: Trump’s illness, US-India ties, Kenzo: Here’s what you need to know.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: In a video message from the Walter Reed military medical complex, President Trump said he was “starting to feel good” but acknowledged that the coming days would reveal the severity of his coronavirus infection.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Your Monday Briefing

2020-10-04.abstract: He planned to stay in Paris for six months but stayed 56 years, becoming known for bold, exuberant prints. He died of the novel coronavirus.
2020-10-04.snippet: He planned to stay in Paris for six months but stayed 56 years, becoming known for bold, exuberant prints. He died of the novel coronavirus.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Kenzo Takada, the designer whose exuberant prints helped bring Japanese fashion to the world, died on Sunday at a hospital in Paris. He was 81.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Kenzo Takada, Who Brought Japanese Fashion to the World, Dies at 81

2020-10-04.abstract: Almost exactly a year after a far-right extremist shocked Germany by attacking a synagogue during Yom Kippur, another assault targets a synagogue in Hamburg.
2020-10-04.snippet: Almost exactly a year after a far-right extremist shocked Germany by attacking a synagogue during Yom Kippur, another assault targets a synagogue in Hamburg.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A man wearing army fatigues and wielding a shovel attacked and badly injured a Jewish student coming out of a synagogue in Hamburg on Sunday, less than a year after an assault on a synagogue in the eastern city of Halle turned deadly.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Attack at German Synagogue During Sukkot Raises Anti-Semitism Fears

2020-10-04.abstract: Look closely at this image, stripped of its caption, and join the moderated conversation about what you and other students see.
2020-10-04.snippet: Look closely at this image, stripped of its caption, and join the moderated conversation about what you and other students see.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Update: Our next “WGOITP?” discussion will take place on Oct. 19, not Oct. 12.
2020-10-04.headline_main: What’s Going On in This Picture? | Oct. 5, 2020

2020-10-04.abstract: The project, commissioned by the University of Chicago, will let users virtually project thought-provoking quotes from its Core Curriculum onto their surroundings.
2020-10-04.snippet: The project, commissioned by the University of Chicago, will let users virtually project thought-provoking quotes from its Core Curriculum onto their surroundings.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: For decades, the artist Jenny Holzer has projected phrases — often borrowed sayings — on surfaces such as building facades, ocean waves and mountains. But her new project, called “You Be My Ally” after a line by Sappho, includes her first smartphone app designed to let users at home superimpose some loaded quotes on their own surroundings.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Jenny Holzer App to Bring ‘Great Books’ Home

2020-10-04.abstract: After losing to Jannik Sinner, Zverev said he “shouldn’t have played” and had a fever and difficulty breathing. Tournament officials said Zverev did not report his symptoms before the match.
2020-10-04.snippet: After losing to Jannik Sinner, Zverev said he “shouldn’t have played” and had a fever and difficulty breathing. Tournament officials said Zverev did not report his symptoms before the match.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Alexander Zverev lost in the fourth round of the French Open on Sunday, but it became quickly clear after the match that he likely should not have competed at all.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Alexander Zverev’s Illness Puts French Open Health Protocols in Focus

2020-10-04.abstract: Evan Mahnken whips up a toothsome Monday morsel.
2020-10-04.snippet: Evan Mahnken whips up a toothsome Monday morsel.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — There is a phenomenon known as the consummate Monday puzzle, one that is made for new solvers. It does not color outside the lines or demand that your Monday brain make unnecessary contortions. It is logical and simple, and the pieces fall into place with ease. This is what Evan Mahnken has delivered to us. Try it with the confidence that your week will kick off with at least one success assured.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Dish From a Crockpot

2020-10-04.abstract: Ken Paxton, one of the most prominent conservative attorneys general, is already under indictment. The allegations of impropriety raised in a recent letter draw intense new scrutiny.
2020-10-04.snippet: Ken Paxton, one of the most prominent conservative attorneys general, is already under indictment. The allegations of impropriety raised in a recent letter draw intense new scrutiny.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: Seven members of the staff of Ken Paxton, the Texas attorney general, including some of his top aides, wrote a letter that surfaced over the weekend saying he should be investigated in connection with offenses including improper influence, abuse of office, bribery and other potential criminal acts.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Texas Attorney General Is Accused by Top Aides of Abusing His Office

2020-10-04.abstract: As coronavirus cases rise in some neighborhoods, police officials warn officers that they could be disciplined if they fail to comply.
2020-10-04.snippet: As coronavirus cases rise in some neighborhoods, police officials warn officers that they could be disciplined if they fail to comply.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: New York City police officials instructed all officers to wear masks in public or risk discipline, as the department faces mounting criticism over officers’ failure to comply with a state mandate that people wear face coverings in public when social distancing is not possible.
2020-10-04.headline_main: N.Y.P.D. Warns Officers: Wear Your Masks

2020-10-04.abstract: “I had a commitment to his heart,” Manager Johnny Keane once said about sticking with Gibson in a Game 7 when he was pitching on two days’ rest and coming off a 10-inning complete game.
2020-10-04.snippet: “I had a commitment to his heart,” Manager Johnny Keane once said about sticking with Gibson in a Game 7 when he was pitching on two days’ rest and coming off a 10-inning complete game.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: It should have been as good as over: Bob Gibson on the mound in Game 7 of the World Series, facing the bottom of the Yankees’ order with a four-run lead in the ninth inning.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Cardinals’ Trust in Bob Gibson Went Beyond His Fastball and Slider

2020-10-04.abstract: Israel has become the first country to reimpose a full national lockdown. This one is nothing like the first.
2020-10-04.snippet: Israel has become the first country to reimpose a full national lockdown. This one is nothing like the first.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — When Israel imposed a coronavirus lockdown in March, I walked home after raiding the supermarket and was able to hear the birds chirping on Dizengoff Street, one of the busiest arteries here.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Lockdown Feels Pretty Different the Second Time Around

2020-10-04.abstract: The lessons from Boris Johnson’s bout with Covid.
2020-10-04.snippet: The lessons from Boris Johnson’s bout with Covid.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: America, we’ve been here before you. We know what it is like to have a country’s leader downplay the virus, ignore safety measures inside their work space, assume health restrictions are for the little people, and then become ill. We know what it’s like to be pitched into fearful political uncertainties; who’s making the decisions in a crisis, and what are the consequences for us if a leader is incapacitated?
2020-10-04.headline_main: America, We Know What You’re Going Through

2020-10-04.abstract: As a liberal in the Deep South, I am in the minority, but I persist.
2020-10-04.snippet: As a liberal in the Deep South, I am in the minority, but I persist.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: AUBURN, Ala. — Since August, I’ve been in charge of Senator Doug Jones’s campaign sign delivery for greater Lee County, which is in the eastern part of Alabama. I receive a list of people who have requested signs from the senator’s headquarters, in Birmingham. I then spend a lot of time on Google spreadsheets and Google maps, dividing the requests into routes and sending the routes to our stable of volunteers. The problem is that we have too many people who want to deliver signs and not enough people who want signs. There’s always a disappointed volunteer, someone who wasn’t fast enough on the draw.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Politics as an Act of Love

2020-10-04.abstract: President Trump, who has been hospitalized since Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, drove by and waved to supporters outside the facility. In a new video, he said he had “learned a lot about Covid.”
2020-10-04.snippet: President Trump, who has been hospitalized since Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, drove by and waved to supporters outside the facility. In a new video, he said he had “learned a lot about Covid.”
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: President Trump, who has been hospitalized since Friday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, drove by and waved to supporters outside the facility. In a new video, he said he had “learned a lot about Covid.”
2020-10-04.headline_main: Trump Waves to Supporters Outside Walter Reed Hospital

2020-10-04.abstract: Robert C. O’Brien, the national security adviser, said he warned his Russian counterpart there would be “no tolerance” for interference, but didn’t mention evidence of Moscow’s influence operations.
2020-10-04.snippet: Robert C. O’Brien, the national security adviser, said he warned his Russian counterpart there would be “no tolerance” for interference, but didn’t mention evidence of Moscow’s influence operations.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s national security adviser said on Sunday that he had warned his Russian counterpart last week that “there would be absolutely no tolerance for any interference” in the November election, but did not mention that American intelligence officials and a range of private firms had said they already saw evidence of Russian influence operations.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Russians ‘Have Committed’ to Not Interfering in Elections, Trump Aide Insists

2020-10-04.abstract: Many of the measures cited by his doctors are reserved for patients severely affected by the coronavirus.
2020-10-04.snippet: Many of the measures cited by his doctors are reserved for patients severely affected by the coronavirus.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s doctors offered rosy assessments of his condition on Sunday, but the few medical details they disclosed — including his fluctuating oxygen levels and a decision to begin treatment with a steroid drug — suggested to many infectious disease experts that he is suffering a more severe case of Covid-19 than the physicians acknowledged.
2020-10-04.headline_main: Use of Dexamethasone to Treat Trump Suggests Severe Covid-19, Experts Say

2020-10-04.abstract: The plane, “traveling rather fast along the water, skipped twice and hit the pier,” the New York fire commissioner said.
2020-10-04.snippet: The plane, “traveling rather fast along the water, skipped twice and hit the pier,” the New York fire commissioner said.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: One person was killed and two were seriously injured when a seaplane they were in crashed into a concrete pier in Whitestone, Queens, on Sunday, fire officials said.
2020-10-04.headline_main: 1 Dead and 2 Are Injured as Seaplane Slams Into Pier in Queens

2020-10-04.abstract: What is known so far about what happened leading up to and during the president’s hospitalization.
2020-10-04.snippet: What is known so far about what happened leading up to and during the president’s hospitalization.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: President Trump returned to the White House on Oct. 5, walking up the steps of the South Portico and removing his mask to pose for photos, after three days of hospitalization for Covid-19.
2020-10-04.headline_main: A Timeline of Trump’s Symptoms and Treatments

2020-10-04.abstract: With President Trump hospitalized, Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff, delivered no guidance to aides about how they were expected to behave in a moment of crisis.
2020-10-04.snippet: With President Trump hospitalized, Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff, delivered no guidance to aides about how they were expected to behave in a moment of crisis.
2020-10-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a memo to his senior staff on Friday morning, Marc Short, Vice President Mike Pence’s chief of staff, encouraged everyone to stay away from their offices in the Old Executive Office Building while contact tracing was going on. On Saturday, he held an all-staff conference call to discuss what the coming weeks would look like while President Trump remained under treatment for the coronavirus, and later reiterated the message that staff members were to work from home.
2020-10-04.headline_main: At the White House, an Eerie Quiet and Frustration With the Chief of Staff

2020-10-05.abstract: Odell Beckham Jr. ran right past the Cowboys, Joe Burrow got his first career win and Tom Brady turned back the clock.
2020-10-05.snippet: Odell Beckham Jr. ran right past the Cowboys, Joe Burrow got his first career win and Tom Brady turned back the clock.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: The two best matchups of the week were both rescheduled because of positive coronavirus tests — Patriots-Chiefs is expected to be played on Monday night and Steelers-Titans is rescheduled for Week 7 — but Sunday managed to pack in enough action to help distract a league that is doing its best to avert a crisis.
2020-10-05.headline_main: What We Learned From Week 4 of the N.F.L. Season

2020-10-05.abstract: With transparency on health newly significant in the presidential race, Joe Biden’s safety protocols have remained largely under wraps. But on Sunday evening, his campaign said he had again tested negative for the coronavirus.

2020-10-05.abstract: Dr. Sean P. Conley, who admitted that he had misled the public about the president’s treatment, has lost credibility with some colleagues.
2020-10-05.snippet: Dr. Sean P. Conley, who admitted that he had misled the public about the president’s treatment, has lost credibility with some colleagues.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: BETHESDA, Md. — When Dr. Sean P. Conley confessed that he had misled the public on Saturday about President Trump’s treatment for Covid-19 to reflect the “upbeat attitude” of the White House, he lost credibility with many colleagues in the medical world.

The measure will also affect most cafes, which in many cases serve alcohol, but little or no food. Restaurants will be able to remain open if they follow a strict health protocol.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Paris will close its bars and many cafes for at least two weeks starting on Tuesday.

He barked at the most famous player in the world and hauled the Miami Heat back from the brink. The only thing Butler did not do on Sunday night was set up a pop-up stand at midcourt and sell more of his $20 cups of coffee.

2020-10-05.abstract: Figuring out when and how to make the switch can be complicated. Here’s how to make this milestone easier for you and your child.
2020-10-05.snippet: Figuring out when and how to make the switch can be complicated. Here’s how to make this milestone easier for you and your child.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Early one morning through a fog of sleep, I heard a thump down the hall. I opened my eyes a few moments later to find my 3-year-old’s face smiling proudly a few inches from my own. The day had come. He had learned how to climb out of his crib, and it was time for a “big kid bed.”
2020-10-05.headline_main: Is Your Toddler Ready for a ‘Big Kid Bed’?

2020-10-05.abstract: A decades-long fascination with the much-loved Sichuan dish inspires research — and eventually a little experimentation.

2020-10-05.abstract: Maybe you’ve been recording the meals that make up this quarantine. If not, won’t you join us in doing so?
2020-10-05.snippet: Maybe you’ve been recording the meals that make up this quarantine. If not, won’t you join us in doing so?
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: One thing I wish I’d done back at the start of all this — when the lockdown began and I began to cook three meals a day, seven days a week — is to have recorded the meals in a notebook, kept track of them. It’d be great to look back on the months of experimentation and freestyle cooking, on the dishes that became standbys, on the once-in-a-blue-moon extravagances, the triumphs, the failures. I think that could have been the sort of thing to preserve, a piece of personal history, something to help remind me of the joys and frustrations of this extraordinary and difficult time.
2020-10-05.headline_main: What Have You Cooked?

2020-10-05.abstract: The demise of coal-fired power plants in Arizona and Kentucky shows how the president, despite promises to restore jobs, failed to counter the forces decimating the industry.

2020-10-05.abstract: Here are excerpts from a collection of documents that detail the failed effort by the Trump administration to save the largest coal-burning power plant in the West.

2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The story of Navajo Generating Station in rural Arizona, in a way, is a story about the United States: the extraordinary coal-fueled expansion of the country after World War II, the continued extraction of natural resources from Native American lands and then the rapid move in recent years away from coal to natural gas and renewable energy.

2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, N.Y. — On Sunday afternoon, faced with a new wave of infections in his virus-battered city, Mayor Bill de Blasio made a sobering decision to ask the state to roll back openings of businesses in virus hot spots in Brooklyn and Queens, pending approval from Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Cuomo Rejects N.Y.C.’s Shutdown Plan for Virus Spike, but May Offer Own

2020-10-05.abstract: Hackers are freezing information and demanding ransom. Who is behind this, and what can be done?
2020-10-05.snippet: Hackers are freezing information and demanding ransom. Who is behind this, and what can be done?
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

2020-10-05.abstract: The authorities said they had been looking for Charles Haeger since Friday, when his former girlfriend was fatally shot in her home in Scottsdale, Ariz.
2020-10-05.snippet: The authorities said they had been looking for Charles Haeger since Friday, when his former girlfriend was fatally shot in her home in Scottsdale, Ariz.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: A former major league pitcher was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound after he was identified by the authorities as a suspect in the killing of his former girlfriend in Arizona, the authorities said.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Former M.L.B. Pitcher Suspected of Killing Ex-Girlfriend Is Found Dead

2020-10-05.abstract: Humans will do figure eights to make facts suit their fictions. Laura Ingraham and Sean Hannity help the faithful do that.
2020-10-05.snippet: Humans will do figure eights to make facts suit their fictions. Laura Ingraham and Sean Hannity help the faithful do that.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Back in the 1950s, the psychologist Leon Festinger came up with cognitive dissonance theory, which can essentially be described as the very human desire to reconcile the irreconcilable. Our brains, he realized, will go to baroque lengths — do magic tricks, even — to preserve the integrity of our worldview, even when the facts inconveniently club us over the head with a two-by-four.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Why Fox News Is Still in a Coronavirus Bubble

2020-10-05.abstract: With “The Searcher,” French moves away from the Dublin Murder Squad and her usual Dublin setting to drink in the open landscapes of western Ireland.
2020-10-05.snippet: With “The Searcher,” French moves away from the Dublin Murder Squad and her usual Dublin setting to drink in the open landscapes of western Ireland.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: The west of Ireland looked good to Cal Hooper on the internet. But now that he’s living there, the rugged beauty of the region overwhelms him, as it will anyone reading Tana French’s “The Searcher,” an audacious departure for this immensely talented author. It’s not about the Dublin Murder Squad. Its main character is American. All this stand-alone shares with her other work is the nonstop malaise that feels like “light flashing on a river, with who knows what underneath.”
2020-10-05.headline_main: Tana French’s Irish Western Features a Retired Lawman and a Missing Boy

2020-10-05.abstract: Ms. Rovner, the former president of Warner Bros. Television, joins the executive team being put together by Mark Lazarus.
2020-10-05.snippet: Ms. Rovner, the former president of Warner Bros. Television, joins the executive team being put together by Mark Lazarus.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: As part of a restructuring, NBCUniversal named Susan Rovner on Monday as its chairman of entertainment content, a job that gives her creative control over the company’s TV and streaming properties.
2020-10-05.headline_main: NBCU Names Susan Rovner as New Head of TV and Streaming Content

2020-10-05.abstract: Winners of the 2020 prizes in the sciences, literature, peace and economics.
2020-10-05.snippet: Winners of the 2020 prizes in the sciences, literature, peace and economics.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Nobel Prize season begins every October as committees in Sweden and Norway name laureates in a variety of prizes in the sciences, literature and economics, as well as peace work. The announcements started last week with the awarding of the prize in Physiology or Medicine. They wrapped up on Monday, when the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel was announced.
2020-10-05.headline_main: 2020 Nobel Prize Winners: Full List

2020-10-05.abstract: Nearly 16,000 people who tested positive for the coronavirus disappeared from the records, another embarrassing failure for a much-criticized effort.
2020-10-05.snippet: Nearly 16,000 people who tested positive for the coronavirus disappeared from the records, another embarrassing failure for a much-criticized effort.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s “world beating” test-and-trace program has been dogged by technical glitches, overburdened laboratories and poorly trained contact tracers. Now, add to that a data-entry error more likely to trip up an amateur bookkeeper than the public health service of the world’s sixth-largest economy.
2020-10-05.headline_main: In U.K.’s Test and Trace: Now You See ’em, Now You Don’t

2020-10-05.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court announced it would not hear the case, leaving in place an appeals court ruling that the band did not copy part of a 1968 song by Spirit.

2020-10-05.abstract: Dave Keith scouted Gerrit Cole and Kyle Higashioka as amateurs in 2008 and immediately envisioned them as a battery in pinstripes. This year, it finally happened.
2020-10-05.snippet: Dave Keith scouted Gerrit Cole and Kyle Higashioka as amateurs in 2008 and immediately envisioned them as a battery in pinstripes. This year, it finally happened.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — Dave Keith, a Yankees amateur scout, was on a road trip in Utah last month when he received a text message from Kyle Higashioka, the Yankees’ backup catcher. Higashioka wanted to know if Keith had received anything in the mail. Keith told him that he was on a scouting trip, but would give him a heads up when he got home.
2020-10-05.headline_main: After 12 Years, a Yankees Scout’s Dream Pairing Comes to Fruition

2020-10-05.abstract: At least three correspondents have tested positive for the coronavirus, along with the press secretary and two of her deputies.
2020-10-05.snippet: At least three correspondents have tested positive for the coronavirus, along with the press secretary and two of her deputies.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Visitors to the White House will notice a makeshift sign taped to the door of the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room, entry point for the reportorial corps that regularly covers President Trump and his administration. “Masks Required Beyond This Point,” it reads. “Please wear masks over both your nose and mouth at all times.”
2020-10-05.headline_main: As Virus Invades West Wing, White House Reporters Face Heightened Risks

2020-10-05.abstract: Las Vegas could lose the W.N.B.A. finals to the Seattle Storm on Tuesday. A return to bruising defense and attacking drives may save its season.
2020-10-05.snippet: Las Vegas could lose the W.N.B.A. finals to the Seattle Storm on Tuesday. A return to bruising defense and attacking drives may save its season.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: The Las Vegas Aces battled and bruised other teams en route to the top seed this W.N.B.A. season. A’ja Wilson dominated the block on both sides of the court, and Angel McCoughtry sliced through defenders with ease. Driving to the basket, getting to the foul line and pushing the pace were what made the Aces championship contenders.
2020-10-05.headline_main: The Aces Got to the Top With Physical Play. What Happened?

2020-10-05.abstract: Ilhan Omar calls the president’s tweet ‘an evil thing to say,’ and others decry the implicit suggestion that those who die from the virus are weak.
2020-10-05.snippet: Ilhan Omar calls the president’s tweet ‘an evil thing to say,’ and others decry the implicit suggestion that those who die from the virus are weak.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s exhortation “Don’t be afraid of Covid” was denounced by Democrats and others who criticized him for taking a dismissive tone about a disease that has killed more than 200,000 Americans, sickened more than 7.4 million and upended daily life across the country.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Trump’s ‘Don’t be afraid of Covid’ exhortation is denounced by Democrats and disease experts.

2020-10-05.abstract: At the time, the fictional story of Facebook’s founding seemed overdramatic; now it underscores how our connections have changed, especially in the Covid era.
2020-10-05.snippet: At the time, the fictional story of Facebook’s founding seemed overdramatic; now it underscores how our connections have changed, especially in the Covid era.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Ten years ago, the director David Fincher and screenwriter Aaron Sorkin gave us a deliciously scored origin myth to one of the defining online institutions of this generation — and the man (portrayed by Jesse Eisenberg as a fast-talking, sandal-wearing incel) behind it. Seen now, “The Social Network,” about the founding of Facebook and the lawsuits that followed, feels grimly prescient and perhaps representative of how the past few years since the movie premiered — and the past few months of the pandemic — have changed our relationship to social media and each other.
2020-10-05.headline_main: ‘The Social Network’ 10 Years Later: A Grim Online Life Foretold

2020-10-05.abstract: After removing guidance from its website acknowledging “airborne” transmission, the agency cited evidence that indoor air can carry virus-laden particles.
2020-10-05.snippet: After removing guidance from its website acknowledging “airborne” transmission, the agency cited evidence that indoor air can carry virus-laden particles.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Two weeks after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention took down a statement about airborne transmission of the coronavirus, the agency on Monday replaced it with language citing new evidence that the virus can spread beyond six feet indoors.
2020-10-05.headline_main: The Coronavirus May Be Adrift in Indoor Air, C.D.C. Acknowledges

2020-10-05.abstract: To be a faster, more creative cook, take a cue from restaurant chefs, J. Kenji López-Alt suggests, and rely on culinary building blocks.
2020-10-05.snippet: To be a faster, more creative cook, take a cue from restaurant chefs, J. Kenji López-Alt suggests, and rely on culinary building blocks.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: When cooking for my family at home, I rarely use recipes. Instead, I’ll pull from a collection of what I refer to as culinary building blocks. And I’m not talking about a mental library of recipes and techniques (though those can help). I’m talking about actual, physical things.
2020-10-05.headline_main: How to Build a Better Dinner

2020-10-05.abstract: Mr. Pearlstine came out of retirement two years ago to steady the newspaper, one of the country’s largest, after years of turmoil under its previous owner.
2020-10-05.snippet: Mr. Pearlstine came out of retirement two years ago to steady the newspaper, one of the country’s largest, after years of turmoil under its previous owner.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: The veteran editor Norman Pearlstine came out of retirement a little more than two years ago to bring stability to The Los Angeles Times. On Monday, less than two weeks after the paper published an article headlined “L.A. Times shaken by a summer of turmoil and scandals,” he told the staff that he was stepping down.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Top Editor at Los Angeles Times, Norman Pearlstine, Steps Aside

2020-10-05.abstract: Joaquín Salvador Lavado drew the comic strip of the six-year-old Argentine girl, who was curious about the world and finely attuned to its injustices.
2020-10-05.snippet: Joaquín Salvador Lavado drew the comic strip of the six-year-old Argentine girl, who was curious about the world and finely attuned to its injustices.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — Joaquín Salvador Lavado, the Argentine cartoonist known as Quino who created a comic strip about an irreverent girl named Mafalda whose unique view of daily life and politics made her beloved across Spanish-speaking countries, died on Sept. 30 at his home in Luján de Cuyo, Argentina. He was 88.
2020-10-05.headline_main: Quino, Creator of Beloved ‘Mafalda’ Cartoon, Dies at 88

2020-10-05.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic has sent the soccer industry reeling, but money still flows to Mendes, one of the world’s most powerful agents. He just wrapped up another extremely profitable summer.
2020-10-05.snippet: The coronavirus pandemic has sent the soccer industry reeling, but money still flows to Mendes, one of the world’s most powerful agents. He just wrapped up another extremely profitable summer.
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: The soccer economy is reeling. Every week there appears to be a new, dizzying figure highlighting the financial crunch the industry is facing as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. More than $115 million in losses at Barcelona alone. Hundreds of millions more in rebates to television rights holders. Across Europe, losses are expected to climb as high as $4.5 billion.
2020-10-05.headline_main: The Big Winner at the Transfer Window Was Jorge Mendes. Again.

2020-10-05.abstract: An excerpt from “Dear Child,” by Romy Hausmann
2020-10-05.snippet: An excerpt from “Dear Child,” by Romy Hausmann
2020-10-05.lead_paragraph: Munich (LR)—The Munich police are searching for clues relating to the whereabouts of Lena Beck, 23, from Munich-Haidhausen. According to eyewitnesses, the student was at a party on Tuesday night in the Maxvorstadt district until around 5 a.m. On the way home she telephoned a friend. Her cell phone has been switched off ever since. A police search of Munich on Friday produced no leads. Lena Beck is 5 feet tall, petite, and has blonde, shoulder-length hair. She was last seen wearing a silver top, black jeans, black boots and a dark blue coat.
2020-10-05.headline_main: ‘Dear Child,’ by Romy Hausmann: An Excerpt

2020-10-05.abstract: Central to the job is a willingness to say yes to the president no matter what he asks. Now, that means subjecting an agent’s health to the whims of a contagious president.

She ranked sixth in speaking time at that November 2019 debate; she dropped out of the race two weeks later.

2020-10-06.abstract: Kotti Berliner Döner Kebab, with several locations in Brooklyn, now sells its sandwiches as kits, to feed three to six.
2020-10-06.snippet: Kotti Berliner Döner Kebab, with several locations in Brooklyn, now sells its sandwiches as kits, to feed three to six.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Erkan Emre, from Berlin, settled in New York in 1997 and became an architect. But he missed a taste of home, specifically doner kebab, a Turkish sandwich filled with chicken roasted on a vertical spit, with salad and condiments. There are hundreds of doner kebab stands in Berlin. Though he was born in Germany, his father emigrated from Turkey in 1972. Four years ago, Mr. Emre decided to do something about New York’s shortage of doner kebab and opened Kotti Berliner Döner Kebab, first in Smorgasburg and then in Industry City and DeKalb Market Hall in Brooklyn. In November, he will open a location in the Essex Market on the Lower East Side. And he has just added a family-style package to serve six at home. Moist, well-seasoned marinated chicken, tofu and root vegetables, all needing a reheat, come with salads, condiments and thick, puffy triangles of bread that are more like focaccia than pita.
2020-10-06.headline_main: A Taste of Berlin in Your Home

2020-10-06.abstract: After President Trump arrived at the White House from the hospital on Monday, he climbed stairs to a balcony and took off his mask.
2020-10-06.snippet: After President Trump arrived at the White House from the hospital on Monday, he climbed stairs to a balcony and took off his mask.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: After President Trump arrived at the White House from the hospital on Monday, he climbed stairs to a balcony and took off his mask.

2020-10-06.abstract: Café D’Alsace on the Upper East Side of Manhattan has added salmon in sorrel sauce to its menu, along with other dishes made famous by the French chef, who died last month.
2020-10-06.snippet: Café D’Alsace on the Upper East Side of Manhattan has added salmon in sorrel sauce to its menu, along with other dishes made famous by the French chef, who died last month.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Philippe Roussel, the executive chef at Café D’Alsace on the Upper East Side, worked for several years at Le Frères Troisgros, a restaurant in Roanne, France with three Michelin stars. Now, to commemorate Pierre Troisgros, who died at 92 on Sept. 23, Mr. Roussel has added a number of the signature dishes from the restaurant to his à la carte menu. They include appetizers of raw salmon with dill; roasted pheasant salad with chanterelles; and a salade gourmande, made with lobster, foie gras and a truffle vinaigrette, a dish that was widely copied in the days of nouvelle cuisine. Highlighting the main courses is the Mr. Troisgros’s famous salmon in sorrel sauce.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Paying Tribute to Pierre Troisgros

2020-10-06.abstract: Lyre’s latest nonalcoholic spirit is Italian Spritz, which shines with a splash of soda and an orange slice.
2020-10-06.snippet: Lyre’s latest nonalcoholic spirit is Italian Spritz, which shines with a splash of soda and an orange slice.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Lyre’s, an Australian company that produces a range of nonalcoholic spirits, introduced its handsome bottles of faux gin, rum, whiskey, aperitifs and liqueurs to the American market last spring. Distillation figures in the company’s manufacture, but the two main ingredients are water and sugar. For me, they fell short, with the most acceptable being those that mimicked Italian aperitivos. Now to that subset, the company has added Italian Spritz, a bright ruby bittersweet concoction which, when poured over ice with a splash of soda and an orange slice, makes for an appealing drink. Orders are accepted now for delivery in December.
2020-10-06.headline_main: An Italian Spritz Without the Buzz

2020-10-06.abstract: The TriBeCa restaurant sells a small line of baked goods, from sourdough to chocolate chip cookies.
2020-10-06.snippet: The TriBeCa restaurant sells a small line of baked goods, from sourdough to chocolate chip cookies.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Markus Glocker, the executive chef and partner at Bâtard in TriBeCa, offers a concise assortment of baked goods, made by his baker, Luis Cordero. There’s a crusty oval sourdough loaf; another excellent sourdough bread, studded with chunks of blood sausage; a compact brioche loaf, threaded throughout with wild mushroom and shallot purée; generous palmiers; fat chocolate chip cookies; and little baked marzipan slabs paved with almonds.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Sourdough Is Just the Beginning at Bâtard

2020-10-06.abstract: Table Mountain sells four flavors of rich caramel from its farm near Boulder, Colo.
2020-10-06.snippet: Table Mountain sells four flavors of rich caramel from its farm near Boulder, Colo.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Amanda Adare went from a job at the World Health Organization to running a nonprofit called Dairy in Developing Countries, to help small farmers in places like Kenya and Nicaragua. In 2011, she and her husband, Andrew Adare, bought their own farm, Table Mountain, near Boulder, Colo. A couple of years ago,Ms. Adare began making goat milk caramel sauces to give to friends, then started selling them in farmers’ markets, and now has made them available nationwide online. The sauces are rich without being cloying, and have a thick but drizzle-able consistency. There are four flavors: vanilla, vanilla-cinnamon, salted dark chocolate, and the newest, whiskey.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Goat Milk Caramel to Swirl Over Ice Cream or Into Coffee

My mail-in ballot is here, waiting until I have five minutes to read the instructions thoroughly, but let’s not talk politics just now. Let’s have some crossword fun with this crisp, clean and amusing puzzle from the veteran constructor Andrea Carla Michaels and a member of her corps of collaborators, Alan Massengill.

2020-10-06.abstract: The pandemic is a new setback for women in academia who already faced obstacles on the path to advancing their research and careers.
2020-10-06.snippet: The pandemic is a new setback for women in academia who already faced obstacles on the path to advancing their research and careers.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Whatever big plans Lisa Warner had for the year, the pandemic scrambled them. It forced online the biochemistry classes she taught as an assistant professor at Boise State University in Idaho, and it temporarily shut down her laboratory. Her 4-year-old son’s day care closed, and Dr. Warner felt her productivity wane. She feared for her chances of receiving tenure, the long-term job security that most early-career academics ardently pursue, by the 2024 deadline in her contract.
2020-10-06.headline_main: The Virus Moved Female Faculty to the Brink. Will Universities Help?

2020-10-06.abstract: It all began with an endless gray tunnel. And ended with a vision of how to rebuild our lives.
2020-10-06.snippet: It all began with an endless gray tunnel. And ended with a vision of how to rebuild our lives.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: I stood on the edge of a tunnel. I could look down it in both directions. It didn’t end, so far as I could tell. It was wide enough for two big trucks to pass abreast. The color was a uniform misty gray. The light never changed. There was never a breeze. There were only two things there. They stood across from my vantage point, near the opposite wall. Both appeared to be packages, though neither had any logo or label. One was a squat cylinder that might have held a half-dozen dinner plates. The other was a tall rectangle about the size of an old-fashioned stereo speaker. They, too, were gray.
2020-10-06.headline_main: I Hallucinated When I Had Covid-19. Here’s What I Saw.

2020-10-06.abstract: Garrett Bradley has made a documentary, “Time,” that stubbornly resists all the easy ways of thinking about incarceration in America.
2020-10-06.snippet: Garrett Bradley has made a documentary, “Time,” that stubbornly resists all the easy ways of thinking about incarceration in America.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: When I first watched “Time,” Garrett Bradley’s feature documentary debut, I found myself confused at what exactly I was audience to. Was this, in fact, a documentary? Or an art film? Or a drama? “Time” follows Sibil Richardson, known as Fox Rich, a mother of six and a formerly incarcerated woman, as she works to free her husband, Rob, from the infamous Louisiana State Penitentiary, where he’s in the midst of a mind-boggling 60-year sentence for an armed robbery where no one was hurt. The first images we see are not Bradley’s but Fox Rich’s: a riot of black-and-white home recordings that stutter-step through time. One moment Fox Rich addresses the audience, vowing that she and her family will survive despite her husband’s sentence. As proof, she offers her pregnant belly — she’s carrying twins. Time speeds up, and we see her eldest son, Remington, as a toddler, grinning hugely before diving into a pool. Then time retreats as Fox Rich reminisces about how Rob’s smile snared her heart. We feel her enormous longing.
2020-10-06.headline_main: A Filmmaker Who Sees Prison Life With Love and Complexity

2020-10-06.abstract: An excerpt from “War: How Conflict Shaped Us,” by Margaret MacMillan
2020-10-06.snippet: An excerpt from “War: How Conflict Shaped Us,” by Margaret MacMillan
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: War. The word alone raises a range of emotions from horror to admiration. Some of us choose to avert our eyes as if the very act of remembering and thinking about war somehow brings it closer. Others of us are fascinated by it and can find in war excitement and glamour. As a historian I firmly believe that we have to include war in our study of human history if we are to make any sense of the past. War’s effects have been so profound that to leave it out is to ignore one of the great forces, along with geography, resources, economics, ideas, and social and political changes, which have shaped human development and changed history. If the Persians had defeated the Greek city-states in the fifth century b.c.; if the Incas had crushed Pizarro’s expedition in the sixteenth century; or if Hitler had won the Second World War, would the world have been different? We know that it would although we can only guess by how much.
2020-10-06.headline_main: ‘War: How Conflict Shaped Us,’ by Margaret MacMillan: An Excerpt

2020-10-06.abstract: The prize was awarded half to Roger Penrose for showing how black holes could form and half to Reinhard Genzel and Andrea Ghez for discovering a supermassive object at the Milky Way’s center.
2020-10-06.snippet: The prize was awarded half to Roger Penrose for showing how black holes could form and half to Reinhard Genzel and Andrea Ghez for discovering a supermassive object at the Milky Way’s center.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to three astrophysicists Tuesday for work that was literally out of the world, and indeed the universe. They are Roger Penrose, an Englishman, Reinhard Genzel, a German, and Andrea Ghez, an American. They were recognized for their work on the gateways to eternity known as black holes, massive objects that swallow light and everything else forever that falls in their unsparing maws.

2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Mayfair and St. James’s, the districts where most of London’s high-end art trading businesses are concentrated, have been eerily quiet. This week’s canceled Frieze London and Frieze Masters fairs have turned into “might click” rather than “must attend” events. Global gallery sales are estimated to be down an average of 36 percent.
2020-10-06.headline_main: In Some Fancy London Houses, a New Model for the Art World

2020-10-06.abstract: Per Se reopens; the chef behind the Awkward Scone shifts gears with a new cafe; and more restaurant news.
2020-10-06.snippet: Per Se reopens; the chef behind the Awkward Scone shifts gears with a new cafe; and more restaurant news.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: With the pandemic has come a host of chefs and owners reinventing their restaurants. There are revised menus, different themes and even new locations, as some restaurants close and are replaced by others needing more space. Marco Moreira, the owner of the decades-old Tocqueville, and 15 East, the Japanese restaurant next door, has consolidated the two. They are now both in the Tocqueville space, which has been redecorated in monochromatic gray, and now has a sushi bar installed. Mr. Moreira has created five- and six-course tasting menus, $145 and $165, that incorporate sushi and sashimi, along with dishes like foie gras custard, sea urchin and angel hair carbonara, hay-smoked duck breast and venison. There are also some à la carte and sushi omakase options. He said he was able to rehire about half of his staff so far. And, with an eye to year-round outdoor dining, he has created an all-weather outside area, seating 120, with planters, a generous overhang and heaters. Inside, there is socially distant seating for 30. “The idea is to bring the indoor restaurant outside,” Mr. Moreira said. “It cost me $250,000, but I really spent the money to stay alive.”
2020-10-06.headline_main: 15 East at Tocqueville Merges Two Union Square Restaurants

2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: It was a “missed connection” that could have only happened in 2020. Posted in July in a Bay Area Facebook parenting group that usually focuses more on dentist recommendations and stroller advice, it read: “In search of the single dad who spoke at yesterday’s Zoom school board meeting. You have a child going into kindergarten. You sounded kind, caring, insightful and levelheaded. I’m a single woman with a sweet elementary school-aged child. Would love to meet up — masked and distanced appropriately — until we mutually agree to be part of one another’s bubble.”

2020-10-06.abstract: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2020-10-06.snippet: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, a pair of sparrows built a nest in our microwave vent. My husband evicted them. They rebuilt. My husband gave up. The squawking squatters now return every May to raise a family. We hear their peeping while eating our oatmeal and watch the couple fly around our yard, looking for food for their brood. In October, we know by the sudden quiet that they and their children have left. We take solace in their ability to rebuild each year, happy to provide them with a love nest in a Connecticut vent. — Beth Levine
2020-10-06.headline_main: Tiny Love Stories: ‘We Kissed Through Our Masks’

2020-10-06.abstract: Her actions have become legend in a small Czech town.
2020-10-06.snippet: Her actions have become legend in a small Czech town.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Decades after the Nazi occupation of what is today the Czech Republic, a plaque appeared on a house in the small town of Trebon in honor of a wartime nurse. Her name is unknown, and her existence is uncertain, but the story of her resistance continues to be passed down. In the short documentary above, Trebon’s residents speculate about the heroine’s life, building a portrait of a woman who fought the enemy in her own way.
2020-10-06.headline_main: One Woman’s Revenge Against the Nazis

2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, when Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia faced off against Mike Pence at the vice-presidential debate, the encounter put two drastically different debate styles on display: Mr. Pence came across as mild-mannered and more formal while Mr. Kaine, a litigator by training, was more of an attack dog, with a tendency to interrupt and talk over Mr. Pence. Even as Mr. Pence made little effort to directly rebut attacks against Donald Trump, Mr. Kaine tried at nearly every turn to offer praise for his running mate, Hillary Clinton.

Just below her on the screen, Alfre Woodard, in a gray hairpiece of her own, threw shade and spun tales from the old country — Sicily. Afterward, the two of them talked about the census. This was “The Golden Girls,” reimagined for the Zoom era and aiming to galvanize the citizenry in an unparalleled political season. You don’t even miss the laugh track.

2020-10-06.abstract: Dr. Rick Bright, who said he was demoted at the health department for blowing the whistle on a politicized coronavirus response, remains concerned about White House interference.
2020-10-06.snippet: Dr. Rick Bright, who said he was demoted at the health department for blowing the whistle on a politicized coronavirus response, remains concerned about White House interference.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rick Bright, a senior vaccine scientist who said he was demoted this spring for complaining about “cronyism” and political interference in science, resigned his final government post on Tuesday, saying he had been sidelined and left with nothing to do.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Whistle-Blowing Scientist Quits Government With Final Broadside

2020-10-06.abstract: The remarks by Prince Bandar bin Sultan, a senior member of the royal family, signaled an erosion of Saudi support for the Palestinian cause.
2020-10-06.snippet: The remarks by Prince Bandar bin Sultan, a senior member of the royal family, signaled an erosion of Saudi support for the Palestinian cause.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — In a surprising televised monologue, a senior member of the Saudi royal family and former ambassador to Washington accused Palestinian leaders of betraying their people, signaling an erosion of Saudi support for an issue long considered sacrosanct.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Saudi Prince Accuses Palestinian Leaders of Failing Palestinians

2020-10-06.abstract: They echo misinformation that the president has spread for much of the year, as he has sought to minimize the threat of the virus.

2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: ANNVILLE, Pa. — Entering Ted’s Bar and Grill on Monday, Tim Girvin briefly slid on a “Trump 2020” face mask, before whisking it off to join friends at a table for lunch.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Trump May Have Covid, but Many of His Supporters Still Scoff at Masks

2020-10-06.abstract: Timothée Chalamet and Elle Fanning attempt a madcap Manhattan adventure in this Woody Allen feature.
2020-10-06.snippet: Timothée Chalamet and Elle Fanning attempt a madcap Manhattan adventure in this Woody Allen feature.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Here’s an odd bit of personal 2020 trivia: The last movie I bought a ticket to see in a theater was “A Rainy Day in New York.” That was in January, when I squandered part of a wintry afternoon in Bologna, Italy, and dragged my blameless spouse to a matinee of what was then the latest Woody Allen film. (A newer one, “Rifkin’s Festival,” has since surfaced at the San Sebastián Film Festival.)
2020-10-06.headline_main: ‘A Rainy Day in New York’ Review: How to Ruin Your Weekend

2020-10-06.abstract: Even those who despise the Houston Astros for their cheating scandal have trouble disparaging Baker, who has earned unrivaled good will over five decades in the majors.
2020-10-06.snippet: Even those who despise the Houston Astros for their cheating scandal have trouble disparaging Baker, who has earned unrivaled good will over five decades in the majors.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Soon after the Houston Astros completed a two-game sweep of the Minnesota Twins in their first-round playoff series last week, Dusty Baker’s phone went into overdrive: Scores of congratulatory texts, emails and calls came pouring in from friends, family and many others around baseball.
2020-10-06.headline_main: Dusty Baker: The Beloved Manager Leading a Hated Team

2020-10-06.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, gave remarks in Gettysburg, Pa., on Tuesday, calling for national unity and reiterating that the November election was “a battle for a soul of the nation.”

2020-10-06.abstract: Underrepresented filmmakers contributed to “Welcome to the Blumhouse,” a horror anthology streaming on Amazon. Here’s your cheat sheet on each film.
2020-10-06.snippet: Underrepresented filmmakers contributed to “Welcome to the Blumhouse,” a horror anthology streaming on Amazon. Here’s your cheat sheet on each film.
2020-10-06.lead_paragraph: Blumhouse, the company best known for backing low-budget horror blockbusters like “Paranormal Activity,” “Insidious” and “Get Out,” has long had its eye on the small screen. Its TV division helped bring “The Purge” series, based on the horror movie franchise, to FX, and even had a hand in the HBO limited series “Sharp Objects.”
2020-10-06.headline_main: Emerging Directors, Re-emerging Horrors

2020-10-06.abstract: In “The 99% Invisible City,” Roman Mars and Kurt Kohlstedt delve into the everyday features of urban life that we take for granted.
