2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: In each installment of The Artists, T highlights a recent or little-shown work. This week, we’re looking at a previously unpublished photo of an untitled performance by David Hammons involving the Henry Ward Beecher Monument in Brooklyn, New York. Normally, the artist would offer a few words putting the work in context, but since Hammons does not, as a general rule, do interviews, the person with whom the artist shared this work, Daniel S. Palmer, a curator for New York’s Public Art Fund, takes us through the piece.

2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: I am the lone cauliflower eater in my house. Whenever I cook one, it’s all mine, from the tips of the fractal florets to the bottoms of the succulent stems. I’ve been known to devour an entire head in one sitting — in which case it’s not something I serve with dinner. It is dinner — and a satisfying one at that.

2020-10-09.abstract: Imagining what authors, from Kerouac to Baldwin, might do if they couldn’t leave their homes.
2020-10-09.snippet: Imagining what authors, from Kerouac to Baldwin, might do if they couldn’t leave their homes.
2020-10-09.headline_main: An Alternate Reality In Which Famous Writers Deal With Lockdown

2020-10-09.abstract: Pointing to President Trump as a cautionary tale, Democrats proposed naming a group of outside experts to advise Congress on when to invoke the 25th Amendment to forcibly revoke an impaired president’s powers.
2020-10-09.snippet: Pointing to President Trump as a cautionary tale, Democrats proposed naming a group of outside experts to advise Congress on when to invoke the 25th Amendment to forcibly revoke an impaired president’s powers.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Speaker Nancy Pelosi, amplifying questions about President Trump’s fitness for office less than a month before the election, introduced legislation on Friday that would create a standing bipartisan group of outside experts tasked with evaluating the president’s mental and physical health and advising Congress on whether the commander in chief’s powers should be forcibly removed under the 25th Amendment.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Democrats Zero In on President’s Fitness for Office as Election Looms

2020-10-09.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, said during his stop in Las Vegas that he must win the election “overwhelmingly” to counter President Trump’s effort to undermine trust in the election results.
2020-10-09.snippet: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, said during his stop in Las Vegas that he must win the election “overwhelmingly” to counter President Trump’s effort to undermine trust in the election results.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, said during his stop in Las Vegas that he must win the election “overwhelmingly” to counter President Trump’s effort to undermine trust in the election results.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Biden Says He’ll Have to Win Election ‘Overwhelmingly’

2020-10-09.abstract: When the rooms feel familiar, books open things up.
2020-10-09.snippet: When the rooms feel familiar, books open things up.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Welcome. The weekend, again, and with it, time, perhaps for escape. For some, car trips, screenless forays into spaces beyond home. For others, streaming: hit-or-miss Netflix originals, dependable procedurals, maybe some carefully portioned reality. A couple weeks back, I asked you what you were reading and, as usual, the responses were thoughtful and inspired. No surprise: Many of us are reading as refuge, to get outside of the head or the house. “Some books seem like a key to unfamiliar rooms in one’s own castle,” Kafka wrote. Now, when the rooms feel all too familiar, books can open things up.
2020-10-09.headline_main: What to Read This Weekend

2020-10-09.abstract: Mr. Pettus built a plumbing and heating business from scratch and grabbed opportunities to be a mentor and relief worker with his church. He died of Covid-19.
2020-10-09.snippet: Mr. Pettus built a plumbing and heating business from scratch and grabbed opportunities to be a mentor and relief worker with his church. He died of Covid-19.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Gary Pettus Dies at 70; Used Skills ‘To Bless the Lives of People’

2020-10-09.abstract: Van Halen obituaries, a Netflix indictment and a Proud Boys trolling campaign were the week’s most-engaged news stories on social media.
2020-10-09.snippet: Van Halen obituaries, a Netflix indictment and a Proud Boys trolling campaign were the week’s most-engaged news stories on social media.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Here at Daily Distortions, we try to debunk false and misleading information that has gone viral. We also want to give you a sense of how popular that misinformation is, in the overall context of what is being discussed on social media. Each Friday, we will feature a list of the 10 most-engaged stories of the week in the United States, as ranked by NewsWhip, a firm that compiles social media performance data. (NewsWhip tracks the number of reactions, shares and comments each story receives on Facebook, along with shares on Pinterest and by a group of influential users on Twitter.)
2020-10-09.headline_main: What Went Viral This Week

2020-10-09.abstract: China Central Television, a state-run network, stopped airing N.B.A. games after a team executive expressed support for pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong last fall.
2020-10-09.snippet: China Central Television, a state-run network, stopped airing N.B.A. games after a team executive expressed support for pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong last fall.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: China Central Television, the state-run TV network, announced Friday that it would televise an N.B.A. game for the first time since a dispute with the league began last fall after a team executive expressed support for pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Chinese State TV to Air N.B.A. for First Time Since Hong Kong Rift

2020-10-09.abstract: The unabashedly entertaining Apple TV+ series, which follows a young female operative in Iran, is a departure from the gritty, manly espionage dramas Israel is known for, like “Fauda.”
2020-10-09.snippet: The unabashedly entertaining Apple TV+ series, which follows a young female operative in Iran, is a departure from the gritty, manly espionage dramas Israel is known for, like “Fauda.”
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: This summer, as much of the world remained hunkered down at home amid the coronavirus pandemic, news of a series of mysterious explosions trickled out of Iran. The blasts, which took place at military or strategic locations across the Islamic Republic, including Iran’s Natanz nuclear complex, were attributed by many foreign policy experts to covert Israeli operatives participating in the continuing shadow war between Israel and Iran.
2020-10-09.headline_main: ‘Tehran’ Is the Latest Israeli Thriller, Emphasis on Thrills

2020-10-09.abstract: Nevada health officials had found that two rapid tests had led to a high number of false positives in nursing home residents.
2020-10-09.snippet: Nevada health officials had found that two rapid tests had led to a high number of false positives in nursing home residents.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The leader of the nation’s coronavirus testing efforts condemned Nevada’s health department on Friday for ordering nursing homes to discontinue two brands of government-issued rapid coronavirus tests that the state had found to be inaccurate.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Federal Official Threatens Nevada for Halting Rapid Tests in Nursing Homes

2020-10-09.abstract: Charles M. Lieber, the chair of Harvard’s chemistry department, claimed in the lawsuit that the university turned its back on a “dedicated faculty member.”
2020-10-09.snippet: Charles M. Lieber, the chair of Harvard’s chemistry department, claimed in the lawsuit that the university turned its back on a “dedicated faculty member.”
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Charles M. Lieber, a prominent scientist, filed a lawsuit against Harvard on Friday, asserting that the university abandoned him, in a breach of contract, after the Justice Department charged Dr. Lieber with concealing research funds he had received from a Chinese state-run initiative.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Scientist Accused of Hiding Chinese Funds Sues Harvard, Saying It Abandoned Him

2020-10-09.abstract: Supporters are donating to the legal defense of Kyle Rittenhouse, who prosecutors say killed two protesters of a police shooting in Kenosha, Wis.
2020-10-09.snippet: Supporters are donating to the legal defense of Kyle Rittenhouse, who prosecutors say killed two protesters of a police shooting in Kenosha, Wis.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Kyle Rittenhouse, a 17-year-old accused in the fatal shootings of two protesters during demonstrations in Kenosha, Wis., has become a cause célèbre for conservatives who insist he acted in self-defense. Hundreds of thousands of dollars from strangers have poured into his legal fund. And on Friday, his lawyer successfully delayed a typically routine extradition from his home state of Illinois, arguing that Mr. Rittenhouse should remain in a facility there for his own safety rather than be transferred to Wisconsin where he is to face charges in the deaths.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Some Conservatives Rally Behind Teenager Charged in Protesters’ Deaths

2020-10-09.abstract: We check in with Pancho, Maria and Abel to hear how they’ve been doing since we recorded Tuesday’s episode.
2020-10-09.snippet: We check in with Pancho, Maria and Abel to hear how they’ve been doing since we recorded Tuesday’s episode.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: This week, The Daily aired an episode about my local bar. Since March, I had followed the staff of the Hatch, a laid-back hideaway in downtown Oakland, Calif., to understand the economic and emotional impact of the coronavirus shutdowns.
2020-10-09.headline_main: A Bar’s Struggle to Survive the Virus

2020-10-09.abstract: Her sprawling studio, Steps on Broadway, has been a mecca for professionals, celebrities, children and just everyday people who want to dance.
2020-10-09.snippet: Her sprawling studio, Steps on Broadway, has been a mecca for professionals, celebrities, children and just everyday people who want to dance.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Carol Paumgarten, the co-founder and longtime artistic director of Steps on Broadway, a dance studio that became a sweaty New York institution that indiscriminately welcomes elite ballerinas, children in leotards and everyday New Yorkers with “Flashdance” fantasies, died on Sept. 24 at a hospital in Glen Cove, N.Y. She was 76.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Carol Paumgarten, ‘Den Mother’ to a Dance Scene, Dies at 76

2020-10-09.abstract: The campaign’s focus on Election Day operations has intensified, with aggressive plans for poll monitoring and other tactics that Democrats say are efforts at vote suppression.
2020-10-09.snippet: The campaign’s focus on Election Day operations has intensified, with aggressive plans for poll monitoring and other tactics that Democrats say are efforts at vote suppression.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: When President Trump used the prime-time debate last week to urge his supporters to “go into the polls and watch very carefully,” he wasn’t just issuing a call for a grass-roots movement or raising the prospect of intimidation tactics at voting sites. He was also nodding to an extensive behind-the-scenes effort led by the lawyers and operatives on his campaign.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Trump Told Supporters to ‘Watch’ Voting. His Staff Is More Than Watching.

2020-10-09.abstract: The Heat forced a sixth game in the best-of-seven N.B.A. finals. The Lakers lead the series, 3-2.
2020-10-09.snippet: The Heat forced a sixth game in the best-of-seven N.B.A. finals. The Lakers lead the series, 3-2.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The Miami Heat were not in the mood for a coronation Friday night. They pulled off yet another surprising win in Game 5 of the N.B.A. finals, beating the Lakers in a thriller, 111-108. They pushed the series to a Game 6 on Sunday. The Lakers lead the series, 3-2.
2020-10-09.headline_main: The Miami Heat Hold On to Beat the Lakers in Game 5

2020-10-09.abstract: Ford was a mainstay on a series of dominant teams in the 1950s and ’60s, collecting nearly every record for World Series longevity along the way.
2020-10-09.snippet: Ford was a mainstay on a series of dominant teams in the 1950s and ’60s, collecting nearly every record for World Series longevity along the way.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Exactly 60 years before he died on Thursday night at age 91, Whitey Ford pitched a shutout in the World Series. It was the start of a scoreless streak that stretched 33⅔ innings, topping Babe Ruth for the longest in World Series history.
2020-10-09.headline_main: In a Golden Era for the Yankees, the Mound Belonged to Whitey Ford

2020-10-09.abstract: The president raised the drug’s company’s profile by calling its drug a miraculous cure — but also sowed suspicion about whether the treatment really works.
2020-10-09.snippet: The president raised the drug’s company’s profile by calling its drug a miraculous cure — but also sowed suspicion about whether the treatment really works.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: When President Trump promoted an experimental drug as a “cure” for Covid-19 in a video on Wednesday, it might have seemed that he was at it again: touting a questionable fix for a deadly pandemic, not unlike his earlier enthusiasm for the malaria drug hydroxychloroquine or even, at one point, disinfectant.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Trump’s Testimonial Is a Double-Edged Sword for Regeneron

2020-10-09.abstract: The order would have mandated that both passengers and employees wear face coverings on planes, trains, buses and subways and in airports, stations and depots.
2020-10-09.snippet: The order would have mandated that both passengers and employees wear face coverings on planes, trains, buses and subways and in airports, stations and depots.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention drafted a sweeping order last month requiring all passengers and employees to wear masks on all forms of public and commercial transportation in the United States, but it was blocked by the White House, according to two federal health officials.
2020-10-09.headline_main: White House Blocked C.D.C. From Requiring Masks on Public Transportation

2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The owner of an animal park featured in the Netflix documentary “Tiger King: Murder, Mayhem and Madness” has been charged with wildlife trafficking in connection with lion cubs moved between Virginia and South Carolina, prosecutors announced on Friday.

2020-10-09.abstract: After ending stimulus talks via Twitter on Tuesday, the president reversed course, proposing a plan his own party may reject, and giving Democrats fresh leverage to dictate the terms of a deal.
2020-10-09.snippet: After ending stimulus talks via Twitter on Tuesday, the president reversed course, proposing a plan his own party may reject, and giving Democrats fresh leverage to dictate the terms of a deal.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House moved aggressively on Friday to revive stimulus talks that President Trump had called off just days earlier, putting forward its largest offer for economic relief yet as administration officials and embattled Republican lawmakers scrambled to avoid being blamed by voters for failing to deliver needed aid ahead of the election.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Trump Raises Stimulus Offer to $1.8 Trillion Days After Halting Negotiations

2020-10-09.abstract: President Trump has refused to participate in a virtual event, so next week’s debate is off. Instead, there may be dueling town halls on the same night, as the president ramps up plans for resuming his rallies.
2020-10-09.snippet: President Trump has refused to participate in a virtual event, so next week’s debate is off. Instead, there may be dueling town halls on the same night, as the president ramps up plans for resuming his rallies.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The second presidential debate was formally canceled late Friday after President Trump refused to participate in a virtual event, the latest sign of the upheaval that the coronavirus has wrought on the 2020 campaign.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Second Debate Canceled as Biden Condemns Trump for ‘Reckless’ Conduct

2020-10-09.abstract: With its fervent gun culture and its gaping differences between urban and rural populations, Michigan has seen its divisions grow ever wider since at least the 1990s.
2020-10-09.snippet: With its fervent gun culture and its gaping differences between urban and rural populations, Michigan has seen its divisions grow ever wider since at least the 1990s.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: For the past decade, gun owners dressed in flak jackets and camouflage fatigues have brought their rifles into the Michigan Legislature at least twice every year, asserting their vehement support for gun rights by displaying weapons in the hallways.

2020-10-09.abstract: Portrait of a virus.
2020-10-09.snippet: Portrait of a virus.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: The first pictures of the coronavirus, taken just seven months ago, resembled barely discernible smudges. But scientists have since captured the virus and its structures in intimate, atomic detail, offering crucial insights into how it functions.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

2020-10-09.abstract: Channing Dungey, a vice president of original series at Netflix, is leaving the streaming service after less than two years, the company said on Friday.

2020-10-09.abstract: Former department officials from both parties have warned that under Attorney General William P. Barr, the department is slipping into a partisan morass it had long sought to avoid.

2020-10-09.abstract: Fortnite’s parent company, Epic Games, had broken its contract with Apple, a federal judge found. The case goes to trial next year.
2020-10-09.snippet: Fortnite’s parent company, Epic Games, had broken its contract with Apple, a federal judge found. The case goes to trial next year.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A federal judge ruled on Friday that Apple did not need to reinstate the popular video game Fortnite in its App Store, in a blow to Fortnite’s parent company, Epic Games, which is locked in an antitrust battle with the tech giant over its app store fees and rules.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Apple Does Not Need to Return Fortnite to App Store, Judge Rules

2020-10-09.abstract: The nation needs another round of federal aid. President Trump and Congress need to rise to the moment.
2020-10-09.snippet: The nation needs another round of federal aid. President Trump and Congress need to rise to the moment.
2020-10-09.lead_paragraph: Economic growth is sputtering as the coronavirus continues to spread. Workers laid off temporarily in the spring or summer are discovering that their jobs are gone forever. Small businesses are guttering out like so many candles in a rainstorm. State and local governments are cutting services. Millions of children are hungry; millions of families can’t pay their rent.
2020-10-09.headline_main: Let’s Make a Deal

2020-10-10.abstract: How politicians cave in an age of absolutist moral judgments.
2020-10-10.snippet: How politicians cave in an age of absolutist moral judgments.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Robert Mackey of The Intercept tweeted this week: “I give up. It’s pointless to report on anything other than the president of the United States having a personal social media feed that reveals he’s a lunatic.”
2020-10-10.headline_main: A.O.C.’s Mistake in Pulling Out of a Rabin Memorial

2020-10-10.abstract: Storm surge rose more than seven feet on Friday in some areas of Louisiana, where Hurricane Delta made landfall as a Category 2 storm. It struck 20 miles east of Hurricane Laura’s landfall six weeks earlier.
2020-10-10.snippet: Storm surge rose more than seven feet on Friday in some areas of Louisiana, where Hurricane Delta made landfall as a Category 2 storm. It struck 20 miles east of Hurricane Laura’s landfall six weeks earlier.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Storm surge rose more than seven feet on Friday in some areas of Louisiana, where Hurricane Delta made landfall as a Category 2 storm. It struck 20 miles east of Hurricane Laura’s landfall six weeks earlier.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Hurricane Delta Brings High Winds and Rain to Louisiana’s Coast

2020-10-10.abstract: The secretary of state said he would make Hillary Clinton’s emails public, handing the president a weapon to attack his political foes as the attorney general resisted his overtures to prosecute them.
2020-10-10.snippet: The secretary of state said he would make Hillary Clinton’s emails public, handing the president a weapon to attack his political foes as the attorney general resisted his overtures to prosecute them.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump forced the State Department on Friday to commit to releasing at least some of Hillary Clinton’s emails before next month’s election, resurrecting a four-year-old issue in hopes that it would prove as helpful to his political prospects as it was when he defeated her in 2016.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Election Less Than a Month Away, Trump Leans on Barr and Pompeo for a Lift

2020-10-10.abstract: Journalism does better when it writes the first rough draft of history, not the last word on it.
2020-10-10.snippet: Journalism does better when it writes the first rough draft of history, not the last word on it.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: If there’s one word admirers and critics alike can agree on when it comes to The New York Times’s award-winning 1619 Project, it’s ambition. Ambition to reframe America’s conversation about race. Ambition to reframe our understanding of history. Ambition to move from news pages to classrooms. Ambition to move from scholarly debate to national consciousness.
2020-10-10.headline_main: The 1619 Chronicles

2020-10-10.abstract: Brian Thomas hits us squarely with a piercing Saturday puzzle.
2020-10-10.snippet: Brian Thomas hits us squarely with a piercing Saturday puzzle.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — This grid is really loopy and fun; it’s the fourth construction we’ve seen from Brian Thomas this year, the kind of statistic that honestly impresses the heck out of 2020 me. I wrestled with at least one entry in all four corners — tough trivia, a bemusing misdirect, an odd letter sequence and an unfamiliar term. There are lots of sparklers in between the stumpers, adding up to an entertaining solve.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Battle Cry

2020-10-10.abstract: Eric Ruch Jr.’s killing of Dennis Plowden, an unarmed Black man, after a high-speed chase was unjustified, a grand jury found.
2020-10-10.snippet: Eric Ruch Jr.’s killing of Dennis Plowden, an unarmed Black man, after a high-speed chase was unjustified, a grand jury found.

2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: An article on Friday about President Trump’s criticism of his top officials for not prosecuting or implicating his political enemies referred incorrectly to a video of the president speaking on the White House lawn. While on first inspection it appeared that the backdrop might have been on a loop, a deeper examination by The Times and by Catalin Grigoras, a director at the National Center for Media Forensics at the University of Colorado, Denver, indicated no evidence of manipulation.

2020-10-10.abstract: Clay-court events have been the last holdouts against electronic line calling, in large part because of how well the surface absorbs marks wherever a ball lands.
2020-10-10.snippet: Clay-court events have been the last holdouts against electronic line calling, in large part because of how well the surface absorbs marks wherever a ball lands.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: A ball lands close to a line. A call is made. A player expresses doubt. A chair umpire descends to inspect the ball mark on the red clay and renders final judgment, often with the umpire and the player both hunched over the evidence in the soil like archaeologists.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Will This Be the Last French Open With Only Human Eyes Minding the Lines?

And along the shores of Lake Superior, voters in Wisconsin’s liberal northwest corner still trust the Postal Service to deliver ballots.

2020-10-10.abstract: What difference does it make if an apartment is called 13P or 13D? A big one to many prospective renters, which is why brokers sometimes change those numbers.
2020-10-10.snippet: What difference does it make if an apartment is called 13P or 13D? A big one to many prospective renters, which is why brokers sometimes change those numbers.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Q: I live in a rental building on the Upper West Side and follow the building’s listings on StreetEasy. Like many buildings, it has had multiple listings that have been up for a long time. I now see that the brokers have changed the letters of the apartments so that they appear as new listings. For example, apartment 13D is now listed as 13P. (Our building only has apartments lettered A through K.) They have done this with a couple of apartments. Is this legal?
2020-10-10.headline_main: Can a Broker Change the Details to Make an Old Listing Look New?

2020-10-10.abstract: They’re messy. They’re forgiving. They’re the pastry form we need in 2020.

2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: After six months at home, I have no idea what I sound like on the page anymore. I’ve lost my voice to underuse — or that’s what it feels like. I don’t know what I look like either. It’s not that I’m sitting around in my pajamas. I’m getting as dressed as I ever did, even putting on perfume. But without daily immersion in society, my sense of the world’s outside-in gaze on me has attenuated.

It also dealt a demoralizing blow to a state still staggering its way back from one of the most powerful storms that it had ever endured.

Mann, a science and technology journalist; it concerns one of the great Mesoamerican civilizations, the Olmec, who lived in a greatly sophisticated culture before both the Mayas and the Aztecs.

2020-10-10.snippet: The pandemic has grounded rock tours and left clubs empty. So Pearl Jam is turning to the tools of modern politics to get out the vote.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Back in March, as the coronavirus first gripped the country, Pearl Jam made the difficult decision to postpone all its concert dates for the foreseeable future. In doing so, the band was canceling not just a fall tour, but also a trip through presidential battleground states like Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin that would have doubled as a get-out-the-vote campaign.

2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Three weeks from now, we will reach an end to speculation about what Donald Trump will do if he faces political defeat, whether he will leave power like a normal president or attempt some wild resistance. Reality will intrude, substantially if not definitively, into the argument over whether the president is a corrupt incompetent who postures as a strongman on Twitter or a threat to the Republic to whom words like “authoritarian” and even “autocrat” can be reasonably applied.

2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Under pressure from the federal government, Nevada health officials on Friday rescinded a statewide order directing nursing homes to halt the use of two government-issued rapid coronavirus tests that the state had deemed to be inaccurate.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Nevada Revokes Halt on Rapid Antigen Testing in Nursing Homes

2020-10-10.abstract: It will be named after Mellody Hobson and built where a college once bore Woodrow Wilson’s name. Princeton in June said the former president was a racist who segregated the Civil Service.
2020-10-10.snippet: It will be named after Mellody Hobson and built where a college once bore Woodrow Wilson’s name. Princeton in June said the former president was a racist who segregated the Civil Service.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: On the site of a residential college that for more than 50 years bore the name of Woodrow Wilson, the president who oversaw the segregation of the federal Civil Service, a new Princeton residential college will be built and named after Mellody Hobson, a prominent Black alumna, the university said.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Princeton to Name Residential College After Black Alumna

2020-10-10.abstract: The president continued to play down the threat of the virus, but the event that the White House had previewed as a huge “peaceful protest for law and order” was uncharacteristically brief.
2020-10-10.snippet: The president continued to play down the threat of the virus, but the event that the White House had previewed as a huge “peaceful protest for law and order” was uncharacteristically brief.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House had not made public the results of President Trump’s latest coronavirus test, which he claims he took on Friday. But Mr. Trump, eager to prove he had fully recovered a week after being hospitalized for Covid-19, appeared briefly on Saturday afternoon in front of hundreds of chanting supporters gathered at the White House.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Trump Makes First Public Appearance Since Leaving Walter Reed

2020-10-10.abstract: Even as Democrats held out for more concessions over funding and provisions, it was the deep divisions among Republicans that were standing in the way.
2020-10-10.snippet: Even as Democrats held out for more concessions over funding and provisions, it was the deep divisions among Republicans that were standing in the way.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republicans revolted on Saturday over President Trump’s efforts to resuscitate bipartisan stimulus talks with a $1.8 trillion offer to Democrats, balking at what they called an exorbitantly costly plan in the latest sign of steep obstacles to any deal before the election.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Senate Republicans Denounce White House’s Offer for Coronavirus Relief

2020-10-10.abstract: President Trump took a step even Richard M. Nixon avoided in his most desperate days: openly ordering direct, immediate government action against specific opponents, timed to serve his re-election campaign.
2020-10-10.snippet: President Trump took a step even Richard M. Nixon avoided in his most desperate days: openly ordering direct, immediate government action against specific opponents, timed to serve his re-election campaign.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s order to his secretary of state to declassify thousands of Hillary Clinton’s emails, along with his insistence that his attorney general issue indictments against Barack Obama and Joseph R. Biden Jr., takes his presidency into new territory — until now, occupied by leaders with names like Putin, Xi and Erdogan.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Taking Page From Authoritarians, Trump Turns Power of State Against Political Rivals

2020-10-10.abstract: Gary Larson’s Sunday puzzle makes us circle back and get square.
2020-10-10.snippet: Gary Larson’s Sunday puzzle makes us circle back and get square.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Today’s grid hangs on an interesting angle, one that you’ll miss if you don’t notice its title — πr² — or remember that this mathematical term describes the area of a circle (with a radius of r). Its constructor, Gary Larson, is a former cruise ship entertainer, not a cartoonist; this is only his fourth Times puzzle, but he’s prolific elsewhere, including The Los Angeles Times. This is also his Sunday debut with us; it’s heavy with theme and there are a lot of unusual entries to buoy the fill.
2020-10-10.headline_main: πr²

2020-10-10.abstract: Rafael Nadal has been essentially unstoppable on clay. Novak Djokovic, though, could be that stopper.
2020-10-10.snippet: Rafael Nadal has been essentially unstoppable on clay. Novak Djokovic, though, could be that stopper.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: Men’s tennis finally got a new Grand Slam champion in New York last month as Dominic Thiem, an Austrian in, of all things, his 20s won the United States Open.
2020-10-10.headline_main: It’s Djokovic-Nadal Yet Again. But This French Open Duel Is Not Like the Others.

2020-10-10.abstract: The shooting happened as opposing rallies by far-right and far-left activists were ending. A television news station reported that a private security guard it had hired was being detained by the police.
2020-10-10.snippet: The shooting happened as opposing rallies by far-right and far-left activists were ending. A television news station reported that a private security guard it had hired was being detained by the police.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: [Update: A private security guard hired by a local television news station is being held in connection with the shooting.]
2020-10-10.headline_main: Fatal Shooting in Denver Amid Dueling Protests, Police Say

2020-10-10.abstract: Residents received little information about the source of the health scare that halted activities at the outpost in Cuba.
2020-10-10.snippet: Residents received little information about the source of the health scare that halted activities at the outpost in Cuba.
2020-10-10.lead_paragraph: This article was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting.
2020-10-10.headline_main: Guantánamo Bay Navy Base Raises Health Alert and Closes Facilities

2020-10-11.abstract: Taking the time to sketch your belongings can help capture moments and memories.
2020-10-11.snippet: Taking the time to sketch your belongings can help capture moments and memories.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Find an old receipt in your wallet. Feel that thin paper on your fingers, and look at the inky machine type. Why is this telling you to have a nice day? Did you? Instead of throwing the receipt away, draw it. It’s not only a marker of money spent — a replacement for the cash that was once in its place — but of a real moment.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Draw Your Life, One Coffee Mug at a Time

2020-10-11.abstract: These shows are perfect for Halloween creeps and scares. Listen, if you dare.
2020-10-11.snippet: These shows are perfect for Halloween creeps and scares. Listen, if you dare.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: When it comes to horror, no C.G.I. monstrosity is quite as terrifying as what your mind can conjure. We’ve collected some of the most delightful frights and spooky scintillations in audio drama and non-fiction podcasting.
2020-10-11.headline_main: 4 Podcasts That Go Bump in the Night

2020-10-11.abstract: As the weather gets colder in many places, mom-and-pop establishments are under even more strain. You can take some simple steps to help them survive.
2020-10-11.snippet: As the weather gets colder in many places, mom-and-pop establishments are under even more strain. You can take some simple steps to help them survive.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Even with outdoor dining this summer, many restaurants across the country have closed or remain on the brink of disaster — especially smaller, independently owned neighborhood businesses. Loyal patrons have rallied to support their favorite local restaurants, but as the pandemic drags on, business owners have had to hustle hard to stay afloat.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Support Independent Restaurants

2020-10-11.abstract: Stretching and meditative movement like yoga before bed can improve the quality of your sleep and the amount you sleep. Here is a short and calming routine of 11 stretches and exercises.
2020-10-11.snippet: Stretching and meditative movement like yoga before bed can improve the quality of your sleep and the amount you sleep. Here is a short and calming routine of 11 stretches and exercises.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Sleep should be a welcome respite, but with our regular routines upended and an almost daily onslaught of anxiety-inducing news, many people are tossing and turning. A study published in June by the journal Sleep Medicine found a 37 percent increase in the rates of clinical insomnia among adults in China from before the peak of the pandemic.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Rest Better With Light Exercises

2020-10-11.abstract: Enjoy a reading from Marilynne Robinson’s new book, attend the opening night of a film fest and take the kids on a virtual tour of a museum for musical instruments.
2020-10-11.snippet: Enjoy a reading from Marilynne Robinson’s new book, attend the opening night of a film fest and take the kids on a virtual tour of a museum for musical instruments.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Here is a sampling of the week’s events and how to tune in (all times are Eastern). Note that events are subject to change after publication.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Discover the Culinary History of Witchcraft and Join a Digital Self-Care ‘Crawl’

2020-10-11.abstract: For many of the players, Nadal has given the most cleareyed view of a tournament held during a pandemic and a career chasing Grand Slam titles.
2020-10-11.snippet: For many of the players, Nadal has given the most cleareyed view of a tournament held during a pandemic and a career chasing Grand Slam titles.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Playing to his Paris audience, Rafael Nadal usually speaks in French for his on-court interviews at Roland Garros, where his astounding success on the red clay has afforded him abundant practice at polishing his sentences. But on Sunday, after winning his 13th French Open singles championship, Nadal, usually so unrelenting in his routine, dispensed with this particular habit.
2020-10-11.headline_main: At the French Open, Players Look to the Tao of Rafael Nadal

2020-10-11.abstract: As the U.S. conspiracy theory goes global, it has found fertile ground in the putsch fantasies and anti-Semitic tropes long popular on Germany’s far-right fringe. Counterterrorism officials worry.
2020-10-11.snippet: As the U.S. conspiracy theory goes global, it has found fertile ground in the putsch fantasies and anti-Semitic tropes long popular on Germany’s far-right fringe. Counterterrorism officials worry.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Early in the pandemic, as thousands of American troops began NATO maneuvers in Germany, Attila Hildmann did a quick YouTube search to see what it was all about. He quickly came across videos posted by German followers of QAnon.
2020-10-11.headline_main: QAnon Is Thriving in Germany. The Extreme Right Is Delighted.

2020-10-11.abstract: The women who organized the political campaign and the subsequent protests against President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko may ultimately be defeated. But society may never be the same.
2020-10-11.snippet: The women who organized the political campaign and the subsequent protests against President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko may ultimately be defeated. But society may never be the same.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: MINSK, Belarus — With masked riot police officers massing nearby, threatening to attack protesters like him with batons and fists, Aleksei D. Zulevsky felt safe for the first time in weeks of anti-government unrest in Belarus: He was surrounded by hundreds of women he knew would shield him.
2020-10-11.headline_main: In Belarus, Women Led the Protests and Shattered Stereotypes

2020-10-11.abstract: Two new books about the press urge young people to leave their social media feeds and read reliable news and information from many different sources.
2020-10-11.snippet: Two new books about the press urge young people to leave their social media feeds and read reliable news and information from many different sources.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: GUARDIANS OF LIBERTYFreedom of the Press and the Nature of NewsBy Linda Barrett Osborne
2020-10-11.headline_main: Training Tomorrow’s Newshounds

2020-10-11.abstract: “The Talk” and “This Is Your Brain on Stereotypes” offer two very different approaches to helping children understand and confront bias.
2020-10-11.snippet: “The Talk” and “This Is Your Brain on Stereotypes” offer two very different approaches to helping children understand and confront bias.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: THE TALKConversations About Race, Love & TruthEdited by Wade Hudson and Cheryl Willis Hudson
2020-10-11.headline_main: Black and White and Living Color

2020-10-11.abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Oct. 11, 2020.
2020-10-11.snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Oct. 11, 2020.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: A picture caption with an opinion article on Sept. 27 about blackface in film and television misidentified an actor. He is Mark Proksch, not Rainn Wilson.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Corrections: Oct. 11, 2020

2020-10-11.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, October 11, 2020.
2020-10-11.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, October 11, 2020.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: “As much as we want to believe we can operate independently of politics and it’s all about science, it took just a few months to hobble our ability to steer the course of this pandemic. So we can pretend that the politics don’t matter, but we have been kneecapped.”
2020-10-11.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: C.D.C.’s Director Is Challenged to ‘Stand Up to a Bully’

2020-10-11.abstract: A drink brings back childhood memories, a game goes on and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
2020-10-11.snippet: A drink brings back childhood memories, a game goes on and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2020-10-11.headline_main: ‘My First Piña Colada Was the Summer Before Seventh Grade’

2020-10-11.abstract: The race for mayor in Montevallo used to be low-key and nonpartisan. In the Trump era, one candidate learned the hard way that’s no longer the case.
2020-10-11.snippet: The race for mayor in Montevallo used to be low-key and nonpartisan. In the Trump era, one candidate learned the hard way that’s no longer the case.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: MONTEVALLO, Ala. — Perhaps no one was more surprised to learn that Joyce Jones wanted to defund the police than Joyce Jones herself.
2020-10-11.headline_main: In a Small Alabama Town, Suddenly All Politics Is National

2020-10-11.abstract: “Saturday Night Live” satirized Wednesday’s vice-presidential debate in an episode of comedy monologues guaranteed to press everyone’s buttons.
2020-10-11.snippet: “Saturday Night Live” satirized Wednesday’s vice-presidential debate in an episode of comedy monologues guaranteed to press everyone’s buttons.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: From the moment that an errant fly touched down on Vice President Mike Pence during Wednesday’s vice-presidential debate, “Saturday Night Live” viewers started imploring the show to recreate the awkward moment. And “S.N.L.” did just that — at some extravagant length — in this weekend’s opening sketch, leading off an episode full of comedy monologues that were certain to offend almost every sensibility and political viewpoint.
2020-10-11.headline_main: ‘S.N.L.’ Has a Theory About the Fly That Landed on Mike Pence’s Head

2020-10-11.abstract: Hispanic evangelicals identify as religious first and foremost. That’s why, despite his harsh rhetoric on immigration, many back President Trump.
2020-10-11.snippet: Hispanic evangelicals identify as religious first and foremost. That’s why, despite his harsh rhetoric on immigration, many back President Trump.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — At the Church of God of Prophecy, hundreds come each Sunday for two hours of worship in Spanish. They share passages from the Bible, sing and embrace each other tightly. The evangelical congregation, led for nearly 25 years by Pastor Jose Rivera, is nearly all Latino, the vast majority with roots in Mexico.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Latino, Evangelical and Politically Homeless

2020-10-11.abstract: The comedy site, a conservative answer to ‘The Onion,’ used to have Trump squarely in its cross hairs. But now it’s less about him and more about the people who can’t stand him.
2020-10-11.snippet: The comedy site, a conservative answer to ‘The Onion,’ used to have Trump squarely in its cross hairs. But now it’s less about him and more about the people who can’t stand him.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, in the heat of the Republican primary, a fledgling satire site jabbed at the party’s leading contender: “Psychopathic Megalomaniac Somehow Garnering Evangelical Vote.” The story proceeded to describe Donald Trump as “a man who would seemingly have no qualms obliterating hundreds of thousands of people for purely egotistical reasons.”
2020-10-11.headline_main: What ‘The Babylon Bee’ Thinks Is So Funny About Liberals

2020-10-11.abstract: Some look to the effects of the disruptions caused by the pandemic, while others find other explanations. But it’s irrefutable teams are scoring more points than in last season.
2020-10-11.snippet: Some look to the effects of the disruptions caused by the pandemic, while others find other explanations. But it’s irrefutable teams are scoring more points than in last season.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Taking place during a global pandemic, the 2020 N.F.L. season always figured to be an outlier, and predictably there have been persistent coronavirus outbreaks, a hastily restructured playing schedule and games contested in stark, empty stadiums.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Why Are N.F.L. Scores So High This Season?

2020-10-11.abstract: Presidential elections are scheduled soon in at least 10 African countries. Many incumbents are changing constitutions and bending rules to ensure they stay in power.
2020-10-11.snippet: Presidential elections are scheduled soon in at least 10 African countries. Many incumbents are changing constitutions and bending rules to ensure they stay in power.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — The president of the West African nation of Guinea is running for a third term on Oct. 18, even though Guinea requires its presidents to step down after two. But because of a constitutional change he initiated, his first two terms don’t count.
2020-10-11.headline_main: With Elections Ahead, Some African Presidents Try Engineering Results

2020-10-11.abstract: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.
2020-10-11.snippet: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2020-10-11.headline_main: Campaign rallies, Trump properties, Hurricane Delta: Your Weekend Briefing

2020-10-11.abstract: Conservatives have raised questions about public decency on the Chinese-owned service, but opposition groups see an effort to stop criticism of the country’s leadership.
2020-10-11.snippet: Conservatives have raised questions about public decency on the Chinese-owned service, but opposition groups see an effort to stop criticism of the country’s leadership.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Pakistan has become the latest country to ban TikTok, the Chinese-owned social media platform, in a move that government critics said stemmed as much from politics as from allegations of immoral content.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Pakistan Bans TikTok, Citing Morals. Others Cite Politics.

2020-10-11.abstract: Rafael Nadal won his 20th Grand Slam men’s singles championship to tie Roger Federer’s record. It was Nadal’s 13th title at the French Open.
2020-10-11.snippet: Rafael Nadal won his 20th Grand Slam men’s singles championship to tie Roger Federer’s record. It was Nadal’s 13th title at the French Open.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Neither Novak Djokovic nor Roger Federer could resist Rafael Nadal on Sunday.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Rafael Nadal Routs Novak Djokovic at French Open to Catch Roger Federer

2020-10-11.abstract: President Trump’s doctor said in a memo released Saturday night that he was “no longer considered a transmission risk to others,” as the president prepared to resume campaign activities this week.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s doctor said in a memo released Saturday night that he was “no longer considered a transmission risk to others,” as the president prepared to resume campaign activities this week.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Offering few details, the White House doctor says Trump is no longer contagious.

2020-10-11.abstract: Remote work during the coronavirus pandemic has given executives with children a taste of a different way to live.
2020-10-11.snippet: Remote work during the coronavirus pandemic has given executives with children a taste of a different way to live.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Before the coronavirus pandemic, John Foley, the chief executive and founder of Peloton, and his wife, Jill, a vice president at Peloton, would leave the house each morning by 7:45 a.m. and not come home until 7:30 p.m. By then, their nanny had already fed and gotten their two children ready for bed.
2020-10-11.headline_main: C.E.O.s Rediscover the Family Dinner Table

2020-10-11.abstract: Though a junior member of the panel, the vice-presidential contender will draw heightened scrutiny as the Senate Judiciary Committee takes up Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination.
2020-10-11.snippet: Though a junior member of the panel, the vice-presidential contender will draw heightened scrutiny as the Senate Judiciary Committee takes up Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s nomination.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just seconds into the Supreme Court confirmation hearing of Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh in 2018, Senator Charles E. Grassley, then the chairman of the Judiciary Committee, was interrupted by a sharp demand to be recognized from far down the Democratic side of the dais.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Supreme Court Hearing Presents a Big Stage, and Big Risks, for Harris

2020-10-11.abstract: A writer’s obsession with the flaws, reproductions and potential collapse of Michelangelo’s masterpiece.
2020-10-11.snippet: A writer’s obsession with the flaws, reproductions and potential collapse of Michelangelo’s masterpiece.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: There are cracks in the ankles of Michelangelo’s David. The weakness was first discovered in the 19th century, but it wasn’t until a paper by Italian geoscientists was published in 2014 that the extent of the statue’s precariousness was fully understood: If the David were to be tilted 15 degrees, his ankles would fail.
2020-10-11.headline_main: The Sunday Read: ‘David’s Ankles’

2020-10-11.abstract: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
2020-10-11.snippet: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Homes That Sold for Around $625,000

2020-10-11.abstract: With President Trump trailing Joseph R. Biden Jr. in Pennsylvania in nearly every poll, his last refuge and perhaps best hope is to maximize the turnout of working-class white voters.
2020-10-11.snippet: With President Trump trailing Joseph R. Biden Jr. in Pennsylvania in nearly every poll, his last refuge and perhaps best hope is to maximize the turnout of working-class white voters.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: OLYPHANT, Pa. — President Trump’s narrowing path to victory in Pennsylvania, and the country, runs through small towns like Olyphant, where Dave Mitchko’s street might be quieter if not for the large sign he put on his front lawn urging supporters of the president to honk when they pass.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Can Trump Squeeze More From His White Base in Pennsylvania and Beyond?

2020-10-11.abstract: In Madison, Wis., thousands of people have gone to parks to deliver their ballots during Saturday voting festivals. In Milwaukee, Facebook feeds are inundated with selfies of Democrats inserting ballots into drop boxes. And along the shores of Lake Superior, voters in Wisconsin’s liberal northwest corner still trust the Postal Service to deliver ballots.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: In Madison, Wis., thousands of people have gone to parks to deliver their ballots during Saturday voting festivals. In Milwaukee, Facebook feeds are inundated with selfies of Democrats inserting ballots into drop boxes. And along the shores of Lake Superior, voters in Wisconsin’s liberal northwest corner still trust the Postal Service to deliver ballots.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Absentee voting in several key states is favoring Democrats.

2020-10-11.abstract: A Washington Post/ABC News poll released Sunday shows Joseph R. Biden Jr. leading President Trump by 12 percentage points, similar both to his margin in a Post/ABC poll last month and to his margins in polls released by several other organizations in the past week.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: A Washington Post/ABC News poll released Sunday shows Joseph R. Biden Jr. leading President Trump by 12 percentage points, similar both to his margin in a Post/ABC poll last month and to his margins in polls released by several other organizations in the past week.
2020-10-11.headline_main: A new poll shows little change in the race since Trump’s coronavirus diagnosis.

2020-10-11.abstract: When President Trump picked someone to conduct his first on-camera interview since testing positive for the coronavirus, he made the safest of choices: Dr. Marc Siegel, a physician and Fox News personality who has criticized Democratic governors for closing down schools and businesses to fight the pandemic.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: When President Trump picked someone to conduct his first on-camera interview since testing positive for the coronavirus, he made the safest of choices: Dr. Marc Siegel, a physician and Fox News personality who has criticized Democratic governors for closing down schools and businesses to fight the pandemic.
2020-10-11.headline_main: After refusing to participate in the second presidential debate, Trump retreats to conservative media safe spaces.

2020-10-11.abstract: President Trump, still recovering from Covid-19, plans to return to the campaign trail on Monday with a rally in Florida.
2020-10-11.snippet: President Trump, still recovering from Covid-19, plans to return to the campaign trail on Monday with a rally in Florida.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: As Election Day draws ever closer, President Trump is leaning into the kind of campaigning he feels most comfortable with. He is set to return to holding rallies on Monday, just over a week after he announced he had contracted the coronavirus and with stimulus negotiations in perilous standing.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Trump, still recovering from Covid, plans a return to campaign rallies.

2020-10-11.abstract: A proposal engineered by Liverpool and Manchester United would yield an 18-team Premier League and hundreds of millions of dollars in payments to lower leagues. But key players are not on board.
2020-10-11.snippet: A proposal engineered by Liverpool and Manchester United would yield an 18-team Premier League and hundreds of millions of dollars in payments to lower leagues. But key players are not on board.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Taken together, the proposals amount to the biggest changes in English soccer in more than a quarter of a century. An 18-team Premier League. Hundreds of millions of dollars in extra payments from Premier League clubs to their poorer rivals. And an end of direct payment to clubs relegated from the top division.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Premier League Reform Plan Seeks to Reshape English Soccer

2020-10-11.abstract: The second presidential debate, originally scheduled for Oct. 15 in Miami, has been canceled by the Commission on Presidential Debates, according to a statement released on Friday by the group.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: The second presidential debate, originally scheduled for Oct. 15 in Miami, has been canceled by the Commission on Presidential Debates, according to a statement released on Friday by the group.
2020-10-11.headline_main: This week’s presidential debate has officially been canceled.

2020-10-11.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr. will continue promoting his economic message to “Build Back Better” in a trip to Ohio on Monday, where he will deliver remarks in Toledo before a visit to Cincinnati. It was a message he pushed over the weekend, swinging through a county in Pennsylvania that voted for Donald Trump in 2016 and Barack Obama in 2012, and making a direct pitch to union and blue-collar workers on Saturday afternoon, in a speech laden with economic populist tones.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr. will continue promoting his economic message to “Build Back Better” in a trip to Ohio on Monday, where he will deliver remarks in Toledo before a visit to Cincinnati. It was a message he pushed over the weekend, swinging through a county in Pennsylvania that voted for Donald Trump in 2016 and Barack Obama in 2012, and making a direct pitch to union and blue-collar workers on Saturday afternoon, in a speech laden with economic populist tones.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Biden will build on his economic populist message in Ohio on Monday.

2020-10-11.abstract: Senate Republicans revolted over the contours of a $1.8 trillion relief proposal that is the Trump administration’s latest and largest offer to House Democrats, further jeopardizing already dim prospects for an agreement on a broad stimulus bill before Election Day.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans revolted over the contours of a $1.8 trillion relief proposal that is the Trump administration’s latest and largest offer to House Democrats, further jeopardizing already dim prospects for an agreement on a broad stimulus bill before Election Day.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Nancy Pelosi merely panned the White House’s $1.8 trillion relief offer, but Republicans revolted against it.

2020-10-11.abstract: The league rescheduled several games in the already crowded calendar as it postponed a Patriots-Broncos matchup.
2020-10-11.snippet: The league rescheduled several games in the already crowded calendar as it postponed a Patriots-Broncos matchup.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. has rescheduled Monday’s game between the Denver Broncos and the New England Patriots to next week, and reshuffled several other games on the league’s cluttered schedule to accommodate a rash of positive tests for the coronavirus.
2020-10-11.headline_main: N.F.L. Reshuffles Schedule After Rash of Coronavirus Cases

2020-10-11.abstract: Dallas beat the winless Giants but lost starting quarterback Dak Prescott, who was carted off the field with what appeared to be a severe injury to his right leg.
2020-10-11.snippet: Dallas beat the winless Giants but lost starting quarterback Dak Prescott, who was carted off the field with what appeared to be a severe injury to his right leg.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: Around the league, as Bill Pennington writes, “Through four weeks of the 2020 season, the average combined score of a game is 51.3 points, an increase of 16 percent over the same period a year ago and a roughly 20 percent increase in the average score of games since 2000.”
2020-10-11.headline_main: N.F.L. Week 5 Results: Cowboys Field Goal Salvages Win Over Giants

2020-10-11.abstract: Amy Coney Barrett lays out her vision of the court in a copy of her opening statement released ahead of her confirmation hearings.
2020-10-11.snippet: Amy Coney Barrett lays out her vision of the court in a copy of her opening statement released ahead of her confirmation hearings.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: In Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s opening statement before the Senate Judiciary Committee this week, as she begins hearings for her nomination to the Supreme Court, she plans to speak of having “humility about the responsibility I have been asked to undertake,” according to a copy of the statement released in advance of the first hearing tomorrow.

2020-10-11.abstract: They’re making it harder for the city to recover. Here’s how to lower them.
2020-10-11.snippet: They’re making it harder for the city to recover. Here’s how to lower them.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: What’s getting in the way of a recovery for New York City’s small businesses? Continued weak demand is surely the main factor. But the fact that commercial rents remain artificially inflated compounds the problem. More businesses could survive, more commercial spaces repurposed for other uses and more new businesses started if commercial rents actually reflected market conditions.
2020-10-11.headline_main: New York’s Commercial Rents Are ‘Too Damn High’

2020-10-11.abstract: Examine her jurisprudence, not her religious practice.
2020-10-11.snippet: Examine her jurisprudence, not her religious practice.
2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: One of the most enduring descriptions of American pluralism was composed by a religious Jew. In 1790, Moses Seixas led the dwindling Jewish community of the Touro Synagogue in Newport, R.I. He had struggled to sustain the religious observances that endowed Jews with a distinct identity: public readings of the Torah, circumcisions of baby boys, and the keeping of kosher dietary laws. Soon Newport’s remaining Jews would depart for other communities as opportunity there dwindled, and Seixas could have easily been forgotten in the annals of American history.
2020-10-11.headline_main: Leave Judge Barrett’s Faith Out of This

2020-10-11.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Joe Hansen is a 2020 addition to the constructor pack; his only other Times puzzle until now was back in April and similarly offbeat. This is an intricate-looking grid that presents a good challenge, mainly because the key to “getting” it isn’t laid out for you in the clues. Even though there is a two-part revealer that provides a hint, you have to do some visual and literal deduction to find your hidden set of theme entries. Some toughies in the fill, and some interesting and creative entries, contribute to the gratification of figuring everything out.

2020-10-12.lead_paragraph: Underneath the expected mélange of funny names, regional dialect, Coen references and knottily orchestrated mayhem, this season of “Fargo” has sought to make a big statement about America. That was clear from the opening sequences in Kansas City, which depict the succession of immigrant groups who turned to criminality as a path to legitimacy. Becoming a true American, the show suggests, involves surviving a cycle of discrimination and conquest — and no single group of people is going to hand power to another willingly.
