2020-10-28.abstract: In cash terms, the fishing industry contributes little to the British economy. So why is it proving such a sticking point in negotiations?
2020-10-28.snippet: In cash terms, the fishing industry contributes little to the British economy. So why is it proving such a sticking point in negotiations?
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In the greater scheme of things, fishing is a tiny industry. Just 12,000 people in Britain fish from 6,000 vessels, contributing less than half of one percent of gross domestic product — less than the upmarket London department store Harrods, according to one analysis. The same holds true for most continental European nations.
2020-10-28.headline_main: The Issue That Might Sink the Brexit Trade Talks: Fishing

2020-10-28.abstract: In his latest movie, the celebrated documentarian explores the ideas and ideals, the faces and spaces of Boston’s City Hall.
2020-10-28.snippet: In his latest movie, the celebrated documentarian explores the ideas and ideals, the faces and spaces of Boston’s City Hall.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: For more than a half-century, Frederick Wiseman has been telling the story of the United States, one documentary and fluorescent-lit room at a time. Since directing his first film, “Titicut Follies” (1967), about a Massachusetts prison for the criminally insane, he has trained his precise, unflinching eye on different dimensions of the country, with a focus on social institutions. Again and again, he has returned to the spaces in which human beings organize their lives, charting the great, bright ebb and flow of people and power in offices, schools, cities — all worlds within worlds.
2020-10-28.headline_main: ‘City Hall’ Review: Frederick Wiseman, for the People

2020-10-28.abstract: To mobilize new or inactive voters this election, adding a personal touch has been key.
2020-10-28.snippet: To mobilize new or inactive voters this election, adding a personal touch has been key.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The hand-addressed envelope stood out to Bria East, next to the sleek fliers featuring smiling politicians promising criminal justice reform or tax cuts. It had been awhile since anyone had written to Ms. East, 26; the letter, signed only “Maria,” evoked her childhood pen pals.
2020-10-28.headline_main: A Cutting-Edge Tactic to Get Out the Vote in 2020: Handwritten Letters

2020-10-28.abstract: Just 26 percent of students have attended any in-person class.
2020-10-28.snippet: Just 26 percent of students have attended any in-person class.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Shortly after this newsletter was published on Monday, Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York dropped two bombshells.
2020-10-28.headline_main: New York’s School Reopening is Not Proceeding as Planned

2020-10-28.abstract: Tens of thousands of people across Poland have defied Covid-19 restrictions to protest against a new court ruling that imposes a near-total ban on abortion.
2020-10-28.snippet: Tens of thousands of people across Poland have defied Covid-19 restrictions to protest against a new court ruling that imposes a near-total ban on abortion.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of people across Poland have defied Covid-19 restrictions to protest against a new court ruling that imposes a near-total ban on abortion.

2020-10-28.abstract: Also this week, what’s at stake in a shake-up at NOAA.
2020-10-28.snippet: Also this week, what’s at stake in a shake-up at NOAA.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the Climate Fwd: newsletter. The New York Times climate team emails readers once a week with stories and insights about climate change. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.
2020-10-28.headline_main: One Thing You Can Do: Vote

2020-10-28.abstract: Pet attendant services take care of everything your furry friend needs (grooming, feedings, walks and more) before, during and after your wedding day.
2020-10-28.snippet: Pet attendant services take care of everything your furry friend needs (grooming, feedings, walks and more) before, during and after your wedding day.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: On her way to the wedding at Holiday Acres Christmas Tree Farm in Manvel, Texas, on Nov. 10, 2018, Madison Logan Edwards picked up Ruger, a nine-month-old golden retriever. “I had to pick him up a little early,” she said. “Because of his personality profile, I knew he’d be hyper. So I took him to the dog park and then brushed him out and got him all ready.”
2020-10-28.headline_main: Prepping Your Pet for a Walk Down the Aisle? Hire a Concierge

2020-10-28.abstract: Anna Kaiser, the founder of AKT, sold her brand to Xponential Fitness before the pandemic. Now she wants it back.
2020-10-28.snippet: Anna Kaiser, the founder of AKT, sold her brand to Xponential Fitness before the pandemic. Now she wants it back.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Anna Kaiser, a celebrity fitness trainer, is known for dispensing advice like “top tips for busy moms who can’t find time to exercise” and for longtime clients like Shakira, whom she trained for the Super Bowl Halftime Show, or Kelly Ripa, whom she guided in a home workout using wine bottles and a dish towel.
2020-10-28.headline_main: So You Think You Can Run a Dance Cardio Business

2020-10-28.abstract: Public health officials believe many cases are going undetected as clinics close during the pandemic and testing supplies are diverted to coronavirus screening.
2020-10-28.snippet: Public health officials believe many cases are going undetected as clinics close during the pandemic and testing supplies are diverted to coronavirus screening.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: For the first time in years, rates of chlamydia, gonorrhea and syphilis, which had been on track in 2020 to hit record highs in the United States, have taken an abrupt downturn.
2020-10-28.headline_main: People Are Still Having Sex. So Why Are S.T.D. Rates Dropping?

2020-10-28.abstract: David Correia was charged with duping investors in a start-up he founded with Lev Parnas, an associate of Rudolph W. Giuliani.
2020-10-28.snippet: David Correia was charged with duping investors in a start-up he founded with Lev Parnas, an associate of Rudolph W. Giuliani.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: A business partner of Lev Parnas, who helped Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trump’s personal lawyer, dig up dirt on the president’s political rivals, is expected to plead guilty on Thursday to defrauding investors in a start-up, according to two people with knowledge of the case.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Business Partner of Giuliani Associate Is Expected to Plead Guilty

2020-10-28.abstract: I was my son’s only parent and our bond was strong. Now, I’m worried my daughter and I won’t have that connection.
2020-10-28.snippet: I was my son’s only parent and our bond was strong. Now, I’m worried my daughter and I won’t have that connection.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: It’s been almost eight months now, and my daughter and I still don’t have our song. Her older brother, Sam, and I have an album’s worth. I crooned a rotating playlist of off-pitch lullabies — “American Girl,” “Sweet Baby James,” “Me and Bobby McGee” — to him every night for the first two years of his life. But when Eve needs extra help drifting off, I can just hand her off to her dad. This is amazing. And it worries me.
2020-10-28.headline_main: It’s Easier to Parent With a Partner in Many Ways, Except This One

2020-10-28.abstract: Democrats have been unified by their desire to oust President Trump. But if that happens, deep divisions on the issue of trade are likely to reappear.
2020-10-28.snippet: Democrats have been unified by their desire to oust President Trump. But if that happens, deep divisions on the issue of trade are likely to reappear.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s presidential campaign has unified the Democratic Party around a shared goal of ousting President Trump from office. But as the campaign nears an end, a deep split between progressives and moderate Democrats on trade policy is once again spilling out into the open.
2020-10-28.headline_main: A Biden Win Could Renew a Democratic Split on Trade

2020-10-28.abstract: In “Nobody Knows,” the jookin star presents a short film that explores his struggles as a Black man and his relationship to dance.
2020-10-28.snippet: In “Nobody Knows,” the jookin star presents a short film that explores his struggles as a Black man and his relationship to dance.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Lil Buck, the willowy dancer who spins on the toes of his sneakers as if they were point shoes, was a little boy — probably around 6 — when a church choir filled him with such spirit that he got up and began to dance.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Lil Buck Feels the Dancing Spirit All Over Again

2020-10-28.abstract: Pennsylvania’s top election on Wednesday urged voters who have not yet mailed back their absentee ballots to deliver them to a drop box or county election office rather than rely on the Postal Service, as a court fight over ballot deadlines looms.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania’s top election on Wednesday urged voters who have not yet mailed back their absentee ballots to deliver them to a drop box or county election office rather than rely on the Postal Service, as a court fight over ballot deadlines looms.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Pennsylvania’s top elections official urges voters to drop off absentee ballots in person.

2020-10-28.abstract: Lawmakers could debate an important law that affects speech on the internet. Or they could yell.
2020-10-28.snippet: Lawmakers could debate an important law that affects speech on the internet. Or they could yell.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.
2020-10-28.headline_main: We Need Policy, Not WrestleMania

2020-10-28.abstract: Law enforcement officials said that Chinese operatives hired private investigators to locate their targets and then stalked, surveilled and threatened them.
2020-10-28.snippet: Law enforcement officials said that Chinese operatives hired private investigators to locate their targets and then stalked, surveilled and threatened them.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department announced charges on Wednesday against eight people accused of conspiring to conduct an aggressive harassment campaign on behalf of China to pressure political dissidents and fugitives in the United States to return home to face trial.
2020-10-28.headline_main: U.S. Charges 8 in Plot to Harass Chinese Dissidents

2020-10-28.abstract: In Steve James’s documentary of the 2019 Chicago election and its aftermath, politics is local, and it’s fascinating.
2020-10-28.snippet: In Steve James’s documentary of the 2019 Chicago election and its aftermath, politics is local, and it’s fascinating.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Midway through the documentary “City So Real,” Christie Hefner, the former chief executive of Playboy, hosts a “salon dinner” for some Chicago luminaries. With a stunning high-rise view as a backdrop, they talk about their town’s future: whether it will become a gleaming “global city” or descend into “chaos.”
2020-10-28.headline_main: ‘City So Real’ Is an Election Story Pulsing With Life

2020-10-28.abstract: While President Trump counted Michigan as one of his most surprising victories in 2016, he is struggling to maintain support among white voters in the state this year.
2020-10-28.snippet: While President Trump counted Michigan as one of his most surprising victories in 2016, he is struggling to maintain support among white voters in the state this year.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr. is leading President Trump by eight percentage points in Michigan, according to a new poll from The New York Times and Siena College on Wednesday, the latest survey to show Mr. Trump’s troubled standing in Midwestern battleground states as white voters without college degrees, his political bulwark, turn away from him.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Biden Holds 8-Point Lead in Michigan as He Tries to Reconstruct the ‘Blue Wall’

2020-10-28.abstract: The story of a marriage saved by the pandemic, “True Love Will Find You in the End” features a live audience but recorded actors.
2020-10-28.snippet: The story of a marriage saved by the pandemic, “True Love Will Find You in the End” features a live audience but recorded actors.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: NEW PALTZ, N.Y. — If you’d never seen a Neil LaBute play before “True Love Will Find You in the End,” which opened recently at the Denizen Theater here, you might be surprised by the huge twist that comes exactly two-thirds of the way through. I, on the other hand, having seen so many, dreaded the twist the whole time, as if watching an atomic clock count down to a cataclysm.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Review: From Neil LaBute, a Case of He Said, She Said, No One Said

2020-10-28.abstract: Last week, a political action committee called the American Principles Project unveiled a new video on Twitter falsely claiming that Democratic presidential nominee Joseph R. Biden Jr. supported sex changes for 8-year-olds.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Last week, a political action committee called the American Principles Project unveiled a new video on Twitter falsely claiming that Democratic presidential nominee Joseph R. Biden Jr. supported sex changes for 8-year-olds.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Disinformation Moves From Social Networks to Texts

2020-10-28.abstract: Our readers suggest a wide range of scenarios that include landslides, pardons, claims of fraud, violence and the courts.
2020-10-28.snippet: Our readers suggest a wide range of scenarios that include landslides, pardons, claims of fraud, violence and the courts.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: We asked readers for their prophecies, not their wishes. Below is a selection from the more than 500 responses.
2020-10-28.headline_main: It’s Biden! No, It’s Trump! Here Are Your Predictions

2020-10-28.abstract: The sound of the singer and songwriter’s third album is sweeping and luxurious: intimacy blown up to cinematic scale.
2020-10-28.snippet: The sound of the singer and songwriter’s third album is sweeping and luxurious: intimacy blown up to cinematic scale.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: “Put your hands in the air if you sometimes ever get sad like me,” Sam Smith urges in “So Serious,” one of the triumphantly forlorn songs on their third studio album, “Love Goes.” (Smith’s preferred pronouns are they/their.) Romance is all that matters in Smith’s musical universe. Love is all-important and all-consuming, even — perhaps especially — when it’s going wrong. Obsession prevails, even more than passion.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Bile and the Beat Fight Heartbreak on Sam Smith’s ‘Love Goes’

2020-10-28.abstract: Halloween is nigh. These screamers are bound to get your blood curdling.
2020-10-28.snippet: Halloween is nigh. These screamers are bound to get your blood curdling.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Netflix has done a fine job in recent years of stockpiling horror films — from established classics to newer pictures discovered at international film festivals. But which are the scariest? It’s a pleasure to watch a smart, artful and culturally relevant fright flick. But it’s even better when it spooks you into leaving the lights on after bedtime. Looking to be thoroughly terrorized this Halloween season? Here are 13 devilish films that will have even the most stoic souls jumping at shadows.
2020-10-28.headline_main: The 13 Scariest Horror Movies on Netflix Right Now

2020-10-28.abstract: A Biden victory could bring economic relief for Palestinians and friendlier relations with Washington, though not a return to 2016. A Trump win? They’d rather not think about it.
2020-10-28.snippet: A Biden victory could bring economic relief for Palestinians and friendlier relations with Washington, though not a return to 2016. A Trump win? They’d rather not think about it.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: RAMALLAH, West Bank — The Palestinians are counting on a Trump defeat next Tuesday. They don’t even want to think about Plan B.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Palestinian Leaders Are Banking on Biden Win Next Week

2020-10-28.abstract: A former Taliban commander was arrested in the November 2008 kidnapping of Mr. Rohde and two others in Afghanistan. He was brought to the United States to face charges.
2020-10-28.snippet: A former Taliban commander was arrested in the November 2008 kidnapping of Mr. Rohde and two others in Afghanistan. He was brought to the United States to face charges.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Twelve years after a New York Times journalist and two others were taken hostage at gunpoint in Afghanistan and held for more than seven months, an Afghan man has been arrested and charged in the kidnapping, federal authorities said on Wednesday.
2020-10-28.headline_main: After 12 Years, Arrest Made in Abduction of Former Times Journalist David Rohde

2020-10-28.abstract: A Lithuanian collector is shutting his espionage museum in Manhattan after less than two years, citing the pandemic.
2020-10-28.snippet: A Lithuanian collector is shutting his espionage museum in Manhattan after less than two years, citing the pandemic.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Julius Urbaitis had a grand plan: Take his collection of K.G.B. memorabilia, acquired over three decades, and create a museum in Downtown Manhattan. People would come from all over the world to admire Cold War relics like a gun masquerading as a tube of lipstick, a replica of an umbrella with a hidden poison needle and a bronze desk lamp that supposedly sat in Joseph Stalin’s villa.
2020-10-28.headline_main: K.G.B. Museum Closes; Lipstick Gun and Other Spy Relics Go on Sale

2020-10-28.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and his wife, Jill, voted by appointment in Delaware on Wednesday, joining more than 70 million Americans who have already cast their ballots.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and his wife, Jill, voted by appointment in Delaware on Wednesday, joining more than 70 million Americans who have already cast their ballots.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Biden vowed to ‘deal honestly with the American people’ on the pandemic, and then went to vote.

2020-10-28.abstract: The family behind ABC Carpet & Home has been enchanting the city with otherworldly finds for over a century.
2020-10-28.snippet: The family behind ABC Carpet & Home has been enchanting the city with otherworldly finds for over a century.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: In this series for T, the author Reggie Nadelson revisits New York institutions that have defined cool for decades, from time-honored restaurants to unsung dives.
2020-10-28.headline_main: The New York Store Where Furniture Is Theater

2020-10-28.abstract: Stocks on Wall Street slid on Wednesday, erasing any remaining gains for October. Traders on Wall Street had already been on edge as the presidential election approaches and lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on what economists say is an essential plan to support businesses and out-of-work Americans.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Stocks on Wall Street slid on Wednesday, erasing any remaining gains for October. Traders on Wall Street had already been on edge as the presidential election approaches and lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on what economists say is an essential plan to support businesses and out-of-work Americans.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Stocks sink as lawmakers fail to reach agreement on stimulus deal, and coronavirus cases surge.

2020-10-28.abstract: After Virginia passed gun laws, conservatives began invoking the state’s colonial-era constitution, which calls for a “well regulated militia.”
2020-10-28.snippet: After Virginia passed gun laws, conservatives began invoking the state’s colonial-era constitution, which calls for a “well regulated militia.”
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: HALIFAX, Va. — The board of supervisors meeting in September opened with the familiar liturgy of local government: the prayer, the Pledge of Allegiance, the roll call. The chairman was recognized for completing a course for public officials. “Constitution Week” was hereby proclaimed.
2020-10-28.headline_main: In Rural Virginia, a Militia Tries to Recruit a New Ally: The County Government

2020-10-28.abstract: A new report found that service cuts could cost the New York metropolitan area 450,000 jobs by 2022, resulting in $50 billion in lost earnings.
2020-10-28.snippet: A new report found that service cuts could cost the New York metropolitan area 450,000 jobs by 2022, resulting in $50 billion in lost earnings.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Since the pandemic plunged the Metropolitan Transportation Authority into its worst financial crisis, the agency has warned of doomsday cuts, including slashing service in half and scrapping much-needed infrastructure improvements, that would cripple the region’s public transit network.
2020-10-28.headline_main: M.T.A. Slashes in Service Could Erase 450,000 Jobs

2020-10-28.abstract: Joe Biden is counting on voters to view him as a safe and steady alternative to a president who regularly dismisses virus precautions. But his measured campaign pace may be scrutinized if he loses.
2020-10-28.snippet: Joe Biden is counting on voters to view him as a safe and steady alternative to a president who regularly dismisses virus precautions. But his measured campaign pace may be scrutinized if he loses.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — On the Friday before Election Day, Joseph R. Biden Jr. will be in the Midwest, campaigning in both Iowa and Wisconsin as he presses his closing argument.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Biden’s Caution: Wise Campaign Tactic or Misguided Gamble?

2020-10-28.abstract: Four museums had delayed the touring exhibition until 2024 because of concerns about works that depict Ku Klux Klansmen.
2020-10-28.snippet: Four museums had delayed the touring exhibition until 2024 because of concerns about works that depict Ku Klux Klansmen.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The much-discussed Philip Guston retrospective will now open in 2022, a spokeswoman for the National Gallery of Art in Washington said on Wednesday, after the announcement last month of a delay until 2024 sparked a backlash in the art world.
2020-10-28.headline_main: After Backlash, Philip Guston Retrospective to Open in 2022

2020-10-28.abstract: The Big Ten football schedule did not leave any room for rescheduling games upended by the coronavirus.
2020-10-28.snippet: The Big Ten football schedule did not leave any room for rescheduling games upended by the coronavirus.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus pandemic, which has ravaged the Midwest in recent weeks, upended a regional rite — the Big Ten Conference football season — on Wednesday, when No. 9 Wisconsin canceled a game and suspended team activities because of an outbreak in its ranks.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Virus-Stricken Wisconsin Cancels Nebraska Game

2020-10-28.abstract: The leader of Poland’s ruling party, Jaroslaw Kaczynski, accused demonstrators of seeking the destruction of the nation and appealed to supporters to “defend Poland.”
2020-10-28.snippet: The leader of Poland’s ruling party, Jaroslaw Kaczynski, accused demonstrators of seeking the destruction of the nation and appealed to supporters to “defend Poland.”
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of women took to the streets in dozens of Polish cities and towns for a nationwide strike on Wednesday to protest a top court’s decision to ban nearly all abortions, even as the nation’s leading politician urged his conservative supporters to “defend Poland.”
2020-10-28.headline_main: Polish Women Lead Strike Over Abortion Ruling Amid Threats of Crackdown

2020-10-28.abstract: Robert Kobayashi’s not-to-be-missed show at Susan Inglett; and Toyin Ojih Odutola’s enigmatic, affecting drawings at Jack Shainman.
2020-10-28.snippet: Robert Kobayashi’s not-to-be-missed show at Susan Inglett; and Toyin Ojih Odutola’s enigmatic, affecting drawings at Jack Shainman.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Robert Kobayashi (1925-2015) — whose work is the subject of the rigorous yet endearing show “Moe’s Meat Market” — was one of New York’s great outlier artists. He had a brief phase as an Abstract Expressionist, but in the early 1960s devised his own folk-artist version of pointillist painting, packing the signature dots of the style so close together that his textured images seemed solid. How solid? Trees resemble broccoli crowns.
2020-10-28.headline_main: 2 Art Gallery Shows to See Right Now

2020-10-28.abstract: In celebrating the Met’s 150th anniversary, Andrew Bolton of the museum’s Costume Institute could not have designed a better show for this strange, complicated moment.
2020-10-28.snippet: In celebrating the Met’s 150th anniversary, Andrew Bolton of the museum’s Costume Institute could not have designed a better show for this strange, complicated moment.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Can you cast your mind back for a moment to spring 2019?
2020-10-28.headline_main: How Memory Maps Fashion’s Future

2020-10-28.abstract: Competing for influence in the region with China, the United States will for the first time have an embassy in the tiny nation of islands off the shore of India.
2020-10-28.snippet: Competing for influence in the region with China, the United States will for the first time have an embassy in the tiny nation of islands off the shore of India.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States will establish an embassy in the Maldives for the first time since the countries opened diplomatic relations in 1966, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday, signifying the archipelago’s growing role in the U.S. strategy to increase America’s presence in the region.
2020-10-28.headline_main: U.S. to Establish Embassy in the Maldives

2020-10-28.abstract: Miles Taylor, the former chief of staff at the Department of Homeland Security who was the anonymous author of the New York Times Op-Ed two years ago, released a statement on Wednesday.
2020-10-28.snippet: Miles Taylor, the former chief of staff at the Department of Homeland Security who was the anonymous author of the New York Times Op-Ed two years ago, released a statement on Wednesday.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Miles Taylor, the former chief of staff at the Department of Homeland Security who was the anonymous author of the New York Times Op-Ed two years ago, released a statement on Wednesday.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Read the Statement by Miles Taylor

2020-10-28.abstract: Mr. Taylor, whose criticisms of President Trump in a New York Times Op-Ed article and subsequent book roiled Washington and infuriated Mr. Trump, resigned from the administration last year and endorsed Joe Biden this summer.
2020-10-28.snippet: Mr. Taylor, whose criticisms of President Trump in a New York Times Op-Ed article and subsequent book roiled Washington and infuriated Mr. Trump, resigned from the administration last year and endorsed Joe Biden this summer.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Miles Taylor, the former chief of staff at the Department of Homeland Security, was the anonymous author of The New York Times Op-Ed article in 2018 whose description of President Trump as “impetuous, adversarial, petty and ineffective” roiled Washington and set off a hunt for his identity, Mr. Taylor confirmed Wednesday.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Miles Taylor, a Former Homeland Security Official, Reveals He Was ‘Anonymous’

2020-10-28.abstract: The city of Tampa will be the center of the presidential election universe on Thursday when President Trump and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. visit the crucial battleground state of Florida.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The city of Tampa will be the center of the presidential election universe on Thursday when President Trump and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. visit the crucial battleground state of Florida.

2020-10-28.abstract: On Wednesday, Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic nominee for president, addressed President Trump’s rally he held in Nebraska that left his supporters standing out in the cold for hours.
2020-10-28.snippet: On Wednesday, Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic nominee for president, addressed President Trump’s rally he held in Nebraska that left his supporters standing out in the cold for hours.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic nominee for president, addressed President Trump’s rally he held in Nebraska that left his supporters standing out in the cold for hours.

2020-10-28.abstract: The Miller family, which has owned at least 50 percent of the team since 1985, has agreed to sell a majority interest to Ryan Smith, a billionaire who co-founded a Utah software company.
2020-10-28.snippet: The Miller family, which has owned at least 50 percent of the team since 1985, has agreed to sell a majority interest to Ryan Smith, a billionaire who co-founded a Utah software company.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Gail Miller, whose family has owned the Utah Jazz for 35 years, has agreed to sell a majority interest in the franchise to Ryan Smith, the co-founder of Qualtrics, a Utah-based software company.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Utah Jazz to Sell Majority Stake to Tech Entrepreneur

2020-10-28.abstract: Republican senators accused the leaders of Twitter, Facebook and Google of censorship. Democrats denounced that as posturing.
2020-10-28.snippet: Republican senators accused the leaders of Twitter, Facebook and Google of censorship. Democrats denounced that as posturing.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Lawmakers hammered the chief executives of Twitter, Facebook, Google and one another at a Senate hearing on Wednesday, with Republicans claiming the companies were suppressing conservative views while Democrats accused their colleagues of holding a “sham” hearing for political gain.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Republicans Blast Social Media C.E.O.s While Democrats Deride Hearing

2020-10-28.abstract: Nature and civilization create our soundtracks.
2020-10-28.snippet: Nature and civilization create our soundtracks.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Welcome. I wrote a few weeks ago about the sounds of pigeons undertaking their vigorous morning drills, their wings slapping against my windows. It’s easy, when we’re caught up in a day’s worth of doing and getting done, to ignore the soundtrack that’s always accompanying us, whether furnished by nature or by civilization.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Listen to Soundscapes from Home

2020-10-28.abstract: When it comes to forbidden love, a “romantic plan isn’t enough.”
2020-10-28.snippet: When it comes to forbidden love, a “romantic plan isn’t enough.”
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: In college, Malcolm Conner penned a rambling email intended for his crush. “You have cow eyes,” he wrote. “I know that sounds like a bad thing but have you ever looked into a cow’s eyes? They are so deep and brown and beautiful.”
2020-10-28.headline_main: Modern Love Podcast: Devoted but Doomed

2020-10-28.abstract: A national lockdown in France.
2020-10-28.snippet: A national lockdown in France.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: President Emmanuel Macron announced on Wednesday that France would go into a second national lockdown starting on Friday and lasting one month. Most schools will remain open and visits in retirement homes will remain possible. Otherwise, people may not leave their homes other than for essential reasons.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Your Thursday Briefing

2020-10-28.abstract: Statin drugs, commonly prescribed for heart health, may prolong survival in some cancer patients.
2020-10-28.snippet: Statin drugs, commonly prescribed for heart health, may prolong survival in some cancer patients.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Cholesterol-lowering statin drugs don’t just lower the risk of heart attacks. They may also help some cancer patients live longer.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Statins May Have Cancer Benefits

2020-10-28.abstract: With her famed Mandarin restaurant in San Francisco, she enticed diners with the dishes she grew up with, leaving the American chop suey and chow mein era far behind.
2020-10-28.snippet: With her famed Mandarin restaurant in San Francisco, she enticed diners with the dishes she grew up with, leaving the American chop suey and chow mein era far behind.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Cecilia Chiang, whose San Francisco restaurant, the Mandarin, introduced American diners in the 1960s to the richness and variety of authentic Chinese cuisine, died on Wednesday at her home in San Francisco. She was 100.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Cecilia Chiang, Who Brought Authentic Chinese Food to America, Dies at 100

2020-10-28.abstract: Ford Motor reported a big jump in profit in the third quarter after a yearslong restructuring and a rebound in sales after the pandemic shut down dealerships and factories for about two months this spring.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Ford Motor reported a big jump in profit in the third quarter after a yearslong restructuring and a rebound in sales after the pandemic shut down dealerships and factories for about two months this spring.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Ford and Fiat Chrysler report strong profits as car sales rebound.

2020-10-28.abstract: A police officer facing charges for his conduct during a social-distancing arrest has retired. The incident caused an uproar over racial disparities in such arrests.
2020-10-28.snippet: A police officer facing charges for his conduct during a social-distancing arrest has retired. The incident caused an uproar over racial disparities in such arrests.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: A New York City police officer facing misconduct charges for kneeling on a bystander’s neck during a social-distancing arrest has retired, according to the victim’s lawyer and the officer’s labor union.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Officer Who Pressed a Knee Into Bystander’s Neck Leaves N.Y.P.D.

2020-10-28.abstract: An evil weave turns a shy character into a serial killer in “Bad Hair,” but the film doesn’t understand that styling locks can be a source of intimacy and communal pride.
2020-10-28.snippet: An evil weave turns a shy character into a serial killer in “Bad Hair,” but the film doesn’t understand that styling locks can be a source of intimacy and communal pride.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Halfway through “Bad Hair,” Justin Simien’s horror-comedy on Hulu, a group of Black women sit in a conference room and debate the merits of changing their hairstyles to conform to the new corporate climate at Culture, the Black music television network where they work.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Black Women’s Hair and Horror Movies: What Could Go Wrong?

2020-10-28.abstract: Tree limbs are breaking under the weight of an unseasonable ice storm, downing power lines and cutting off electricity to nearly 375,000 households and businesses across the state.
2020-10-28.snippet: Tree limbs are breaking under the weight of an unseasonable ice storm, downing power lines and cutting off electricity to nearly 375,000 households and businesses across the state.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands in Oklahoma are still without power on Wednesday after powerful ice storms downed electrical lines across the state on Monday, creating hazardous conditions the day before in-person early voting is set to begin in the state.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Oklahoma Ice Storms Leave Thousands Without Power on Eve of Early Voting

2020-10-28.abstract: He was the only Hispanic to serve on the First Circuit court in Boston. In July he moved to overturn a death sentence in the Boston Marathon bombing.
2020-10-28.snippet: He was the only Hispanic to serve on the First Circuit court in Boston. In July he moved to overturn a death sentence in the Boston Marathon bombing.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Juan R. Torruella, a groundbreaking Hispanic federal judge in New England who championed the rights of his fellow Puerto Ricans and, in a recent case, joined a decision to overturn the death penalty imposed on a Boston Marathon bomber, died on Monday in San Juan. He was 87.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Juan Torruella, Groundbreaking U.S. Appeals Judge, Dies at 87

2020-10-28.abstract: Rallying supporters in Bullhead City, Ariz., the first of two stops in the state on Wednesday, President Trump claimed that a vaccine for the coronavirus would be available “momentarily,” speeding up an already exaggerated timeline in the final days of the presidential race.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Rallying supporters in Bullhead City, Ariz., the first of two stops in the state on Wednesday, President Trump claimed that a vaccine for the coronavirus would be available “momentarily,” speeding up an already exaggerated timeline in the final days of the presidential race.
2020-10-28.headline_main: At Arizona rally, Trump says the country is ‘rounding the turn,’ despite a record number of virus cases.

2020-10-28.abstract: Caught in an Armenian rocket attack, a New York Times reporting team captures the agony of an expanding, dirty war.
2020-10-28.snippet: Caught in an Armenian rocket attack, a New York Times reporting team captures the agony of an expanding, dirty war.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: BARDA, Azerbaijan — The first explosion was loud enough to make us stop the car. It seemed close and sounded like a rocket, so we quickly jumped out and crouched down by a wall.
2020-10-28.headline_main: In Azerbaijan, a String of Explosions, Screams and Then Blood

2020-10-28.abstract: The new steps are the toughest since the spring and follow added restrictions in Spain and Italy aimed at curbing the spread of the virus and easing the strain on hospitals.
2020-10-28.snippet: The new steps are the toughest since the spring and follow added restrictions in Spain and Italy aimed at curbing the spread of the virus and easing the strain on hospitals.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — France announced a second nationwide lockdown and Germany moved to the very edge of one on Wednesday, testing their pandemic-weary populations as they tried to stop a mounting new wave of coronavirus infections from swamping hospitals and undoing hopes of economic recovery.
2020-10-28.headline_main: France and Germany Lock Down as Second Coronavirus Wave Grows

2020-10-28.abstract: President Macron pledged massive financial aid to prevent a wave of bankruptcies and layoffs from hitting the eurozone’s second-largest economy.
2020-10-28.snippet: President Macron pledged massive financial aid to prevent a wave of bankruptcies and layoffs from hitting the eurozone’s second-largest economy.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: France was bracing for a fresh blow to its beleaguered economy as President Emmanuel Macron reimposed a nationwide lockdown through December to prevent an alarming surge of coronavirus cases from spiraling out of control.
2020-10-28.headline_main: France imposes a new nationwide lockdown, and braces for fresh economic pain.

2020-10-28.abstract: Senator Kamala Harris, the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, campaigned in Tucson, Ariz., Wednesday, and criticized the White House’s handling of the coronavirus and pushed back on Republicans saying she is pressing a “socialist” agenda.
2020-10-28.snippet: Senator Kamala Harris, the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, campaigned in Tucson, Ariz., Wednesday, and criticized the White House’s handling of the coronavirus and pushed back on Republicans saying she is pressing a “socialist” agenda.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Senator Kamala Harris, the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, campaigned in Tucson, Ariz., Wednesday, and criticized the White House’s handling of the coronavirus and pushed back on Republicans saying she is pressing a “socialist” agenda.
2020-10-28.headline_main: ‘I Am a Proud Patriotic American,’ Harris Says at Rally

2020-10-28.abstract: For years, Los Angeles’s players have borne the burden of a title drought. The unusual circumstances of their World Series win won’t dim the joy and relief that come with the long-awaited championship.
2020-10-28.snippet: For years, Los Angeles’s players have borne the burden of a title drought. The unusual circumstances of their World Series win won’t dim the joy and relief that come with the long-awaited championship.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Texas — At the very end, 2020 did what it does best, intruding on joy with an unwelcome risk-or-reward calculation. Justin Turner, part of the soul of the Los Angeles Dodgers, learned that he had tested positive for the coronavirus during the World Series clincher on Tuesday night at Globe Life Field. Then he defied orders from Major League Baseball security and celebrated on the field with teammates and family members, at times without wearing a mask.
2020-10-28.headline_main: After a Dampened Celebration, Enduring Glory Still Awaits the Dodgers

2020-10-28.abstract: France and Germany reimposed nationwide lockdowns as cases surge.
2020-10-28.snippet: France and Germany reimposed nationwide lockdowns as cases surge.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Europe has tried for weeks to slow the spread of the virus with targeted restrictions instead of the unpopular nationwide lockdowns that were imposed in the spring. But as a furious second wave pushes hospitalizations, deaths and cases to levels not seen since the beginning of the pandemic, countries have begun to change course.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

2020-10-28.abstract: Voters are turning out in record numbers to cast ballots in the 2020 election. We want to hear what is happening when you go to vote.
2020-10-28.snippet: Voters are turning out in record numbers to cast ballots in the 2020 election. We want to hear what is happening when you go to vote.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Do you have a tip about voting problems? The New York Times is partnering with ProPublica and hundreds of other news organizations to track voting impediments and other challenges to the reliability and integrity of the election. Submit your tips here.
2020-10-28.headline_main: What Are You Seeing at the Polls?

2020-10-28.abstract: She traveled in the circles of Ginsberg and Ferlinghetti, a rare female voice in a male world, and went on to a long, prolific career in poetry.
2020-10-28.snippet: She traveled in the circles of Ginsberg and Ferlinghetti, a rare female voice in a male world, and went on to a long, prolific career in poetry.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Diane di Prima, the most prominent woman among the male-dominated Beat poets, who after being immersed in the bohemian swirl of Greenwich Village in the 1950s moved to the West Coast and continued to publish prolifically in a wide range of forms, died on Sunday in San Francisco. She was 86.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Diane di Prima, Poet of the Beat Era and Beyond, Dies at 86

2020-10-28.abstract: “Nonprofits throughout the country and the millions of Americans who depend on them cannot wait until after the election for relief.” Also: Helping coal miners; how the use of pens can help learning.
2020-10-28.snippet: “Nonprofits throughout the country and the millions of Americans who depend on them cannot wait until after the election for relief.” Also: Helping coal miners; how the use of pens can help learning.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2020-10-28.headline_main: Covid Relief for Nonprofits

2020-10-28.abstract: Republicans in both states opposed the extensions. Justice Amy Coney Barrett, who joined the court on Tuesday, did not participate in either case, saying she had not had time to fully review the briefs.
2020-10-28.snippet: Republicans in both states opposed the extensions. Justice Amy Coney Barrett, who joined the court on Tuesday, did not participate in either case, saying she had not had time to fully review the briefs.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a pair of decisions welcomed by Democrats, the Supreme Court on Wednesday let election officials in two key battleground states, Pennsylvania and North Carolina, accept absentee ballots for several days after Election Day.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Supreme Court Allows Longer Deadlines for Absentee Ballots in Pennsylvania and North Carolina

2020-10-28.abstract: With the help of DNA technology, John Jeffrey Sipos, 75, was arrested in Pennsylvania last weekend in the 1969 murder of Mary Scott, a 23-year-old California woman.
2020-10-28.snippet: With the help of DNA technology, John Jeffrey Sipos, 75, was arrested in Pennsylvania last weekend in the 1969 murder of Mary Scott, a 23-year-old California woman.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Rosalie Sanz was a teenager in 1969 when she looked out the window of her family’s San Diego home on a dark November night and saw two men in suits. She remembers her mother listening quietly to the detectives telling her that her 23-year-old daughter, Mary Scott, had been murdered.
2020-10-28.headline_main: After 50 Years, a Suspect Emerges in a Cold Murder Case

2020-10-28.abstract: The total cost of the races for the White House, the Senate and the House is expected to hit nearly $14 billion.
2020-10-28.snippet: The total cost of the races for the White House, the Senate and the House is expected to hit nearly $14 billion.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The 2020 election has blown past previous records to become the most expensive campaign in American history, with the final tally for the battle for the White House and control of the Senate and the House expected to hit nearly $14 billion, according to new projections made by the Center for Responsive Politics.
2020-10-28.headline_main: The 2020 Campaign Is the Most Expensive Ever (By a Lot)

2020-10-28.abstract: The Supreme Court will allow election officials to accept ballots after Election Day in two key battlegrounds: Pennsylvania and North Carolina.
2020-10-28.snippet: The Supreme Court will allow election officials to accept ballots after Election Day in two key battlegrounds: Pennsylvania and North Carolina.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: In a pair of decisions welcomed by Democrats, the Supreme Court on Wednesday at least temporarily let election officials in two key battleground states, Pennsylvania and North Carolina, accept absentee ballots for several days after Election Day.
2020-10-28.headline_main: The Supreme Court allows longer absentee ballot deadlines in Pennsylvania and North Carolina.

2020-10-28.abstract: The S&P 500 was down 3.5 percent after France and Germany announced new lockdown measures, an unwelcome reminder of the recovery’s fragility.
2020-10-28.snippet: The S&P 500 was down 3.5 percent after France and Germany announced new lockdown measures, an unwelcome reminder of the recovery’s fragility.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Coronavirus flare-ups across the United States and new lockdown measures in major European economies sent stocks sliding to their worst performance in months on Wednesday.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Stocks Post Worst Day in 4 Months as Infections Rise Around the Globe

2020-10-28.abstract: Neal Gabler’s “Catching the Wind” makes clear that Ted Kennedy’s record in the Senate far outshone the legislative accomplishments of his brothers.
2020-10-28.snippet: Neal Gabler’s “Catching the Wind” makes clear that Ted Kennedy’s record in the Senate far outshone the legislative accomplishments of his brothers.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: CATCHING THE WINDEdward Kennedy and the Liberal HourBy Neal Gabler
2020-10-28.headline_main: The Best of the Kennedys?

2020-10-28.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2020-10-28.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Here’s the sign-up.)
2020-10-28.headline_main: Europe, 2020 Election, Dodgers: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

2020-10-28.abstract: Now is our chance to put an end to this presidency.
2020-10-28.snippet: Now is our chance to put an end to this presidency.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: We are now entering the homestretch. Voters will finally have a say in whether Donald Trump’s reign of terror and idiocy continues or ends.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Finally, the Resistance Gets to Vote

2020-10-28.abstract: The people of Illinois, Arizona and California have a chance to make the distribution of state taxation a little more fair.
2020-10-28.snippet: The people of Illinois, Arizona and California have a chance to make the distribution of state taxation a little more fair.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Most Americans accept the common-sense case for progressive taxation: Those who have more ought to contribute more to the society that is the foundation of their prosperity.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Say Yes to Progressive Taxation

2020-10-28.abstract: President Trump claimed the nation was ‘rounding the turn’ on the virus even as cases climbed, as Joe Biden vowed to ‘deal honestly with the American people.’
2020-10-28.snippet: President Trump claimed the nation was ‘rounding the turn’ on the virus even as cases climbed, as Joe Biden vowed to ‘deal honestly with the American people.’
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus pandemic — which has reshaped the presidential race by transforming the conventions, the debates, the way the candidates campaign and how voters cast their ballots — dominated the race on Wednesday as President Trump and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. held fast to the diametrically opposed positions they have staked out.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Trump claims the nation is ‘rounding the turn’ on the virus as cases climb; Biden vows to ‘deal honestly with the American people.’

2020-10-28.abstract: “This kind of blatant disregard for the well-being of others is not only extremely disappointing; it will not be tolerated,” a Long Island official said.
2020-10-28.snippet: “This kind of blatant disregard for the well-being of others is not only extremely disappointing; it will not be tolerated,” a Long Island official said.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Long Island health officials scrambled to contain a coronavirus outbreak in Suffolk County when dozens of people tested positive for the virus after attending a high-end Sweet 16 party in September that violated state restrictions on gatherings.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Wedding and Birthday Party Infect 56, Leaving Nearly 300 in Quarantine

2020-10-28.abstract: The museum was prepared to sell three major works to pay for salary increases and to diversify its collection, but many critics disagreed with the plan.
2020-10-28.snippet: The museum was prepared to sell three major works to pay for salary increases and to diversify its collection, but many critics disagreed with the plan.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The Baltimore Museum of Art is pausing its plan to sell three major paintings from its collection. A Sotheby’s sale of works by Brice Marden, Clyfford Still and Andy Warhol was estimated to bring in $65 million to fund acquisitions of art by people of color and staff-wide salary increases.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Baltimore Museum of Art Cancels Painting Sale that Drew Complaints

2020-10-28.abstract: The moves could severely restrict the flow of remittances from abroad and worsen a profound economic crisis on the island.
2020-10-28.snippet: The moves could severely restrict the flow of remittances from abroad and worsen a profound economic crisis on the island.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — In the face of widening American financial restrictions on Cuba, more than 400 Western Union offices on the island will close, Cuban authorities said, a move that could severely restrict the flow of remittances from abroad and worsen a profound economic crisis that has led to widespread food shortages on the island.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Cuba Says U.S. Restrictions Will Force Western Union Offices to Close

2020-10-28.abstract: The shooting and its aftermath were guaranteed to ratchet up tensions in a country already on edge. Debates about how to improve police accountability have been complicated by looting.
2020-10-28.snippet: The shooting and its aftermath were guaranteed to ratchet up tensions in a country already on edge. Debates about how to improve police accountability have been complicated by looting.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — There is a grim familiarity to it all. In the final days of a bitter election, it is a reprise of the terrible images that the country has come to know all too well this year: The shaky cellphone video, the abrupt death of a Black man at the hands of the police. The howls of grief at the scene. The protests that formed immediately. The looting of stores that lasted late into the night.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Days From Election, Police Killing of Black Man Roils Philadelphia

2020-10-28.abstract: “Turner’s decision to leave isolation and enter the field was wrong and put everyone he came in contact with at risk,” the league said in a statement.
2020-10-28.snippet: “Turner’s decision to leave isolation and enter the field was wrong and put everyone he came in contact with at risk,” the league said in a statement.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: The joy of the Dodgers’ long coveted World Series title was overshadowed on Tuesday night when Justin Turner, the team’s veteran third baseman, joined his teammates in celebration on the field shortly after learning he had tested positive for the coronavirus.
2020-10-28.headline_main: M.L.B. Says Justin Turner Refused to Stay Off Field After Dodgers’ Win

2020-10-28.abstract: You know who really reduced abortion numbers in the U.S.? President Obama, with the Affordable Care Act.
2020-10-28.snippet: You know who really reduced abortion numbers in the U.S.? President Obama, with the Affordable Care Act.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Millions of American Christians are likely to vote for President Trump on Tuesday because they believe it a religious obligation to support a president who will appoint “pro-life” judges.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Er, Can I Ask a Few Questions About Abortion?

2020-10-28.abstract: The president has continued to downplay the severity of the coronavirus and declare before largely maskless crowds that it is vanishing. The surge in new cases across the country says: Not so.
2020-10-28.snippet: The president has continued to downplay the severity of the coronavirus and declare before largely maskless crowds that it is vanishing. The surge in new cases across the country says: Not so.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: As an immense new surge in coronavirus cases sweeps the country, President Trump is closing his re-election campaign by pleading with voters to ignore the evidence of a calamity unfolding before their eyes and trust his word that the disease is already disappearing as a threat to their personal health and economic well being.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Trump’s Closing Argument on Virus Clashes With Science, and Voters’ Lives

2020-10-28.abstract: At this point, I’m thinking less about polling averages and more about a few key variables that we can’t predict.
2020-10-28.snippet: At this point, I’m thinking less about polling averages and more about a few key variables that we can’t predict.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Into the Unknown

2020-10-28.headline_main: Court Rejects Appeal of Guantánamo Convict Who Rejoined Al Qaeda

2020-10-28.abstract: A lifelong Republican and a former top official at the Department of Homeland Security, Mr. Taylor took a leave of absence from his job at Google this summer to campaign for Joseph R. Biden Jr.
2020-10-28.snippet: A lifelong Republican and a former top official at the Department of Homeland Security, Mr. Taylor took a leave of absence from his job at Google this summer to campaign for Joseph R. Biden Jr.
2020-10-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Miles Taylor, who revealed on Wednesday that he was the anonymous author of a New York Times Op-Ed article in 2018 that was critical of President Trump, is a lifelong Republican whose service as a senior homeland security official in the Trump administration led him to endorse former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic nominee, for president this year.
2020-10-28.headline_main: Who Is Miles Taylor?

2020-10-29.abstract: An update to California’s groundbreaking privacy law falls short.
2020-10-29.snippet: An update to California’s groundbreaking privacy law falls short.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: In 2018, California lawmakers passed a data privacy bill that gave consumers back some control over the reams of personal information they share with tech firms. The legislation became a model for the rest of the country.
2020-10-29.headline_main: A Privacy Measure That’s Hard to Like

2020-10-29.abstract: Officials announced that 60 people had been charged in the scheme, in which federal prosecutors said deceptive tactics were used to sell magazine subscriptions to more than 150,000 older and vulnerable people.
2020-10-29.snippet: Officials announced that 60 people had been charged in the scheme, in which federal prosecutors said deceptive tactics were used to sell magazine subscriptions to more than 150,000 older and vulnerable people.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Sixty people have been indicted in a nationwide telemarketing scheme in which federal prosecutors say people were tricked into signing up for expensive magazine subscriptions they could not afford, did not want and often did not receive, and in which over 150,000 people were defrauded of more than $300 million.

2020-10-29.snippet: ‘The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue’ took 10 years to write. The fantasy author describes the process as a ‘very, very long labor of love.’
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: SHED DREAD Ten years ago, at the suggestion of a friend who is no longer a friend, the fantasy author V.E. Schwab relocated from Nashville to Liverpool, England, where she paid 200 pounds per month to live in an unheated garden shed furnished with a single bed and a metal bar for hanging clothes. There was no plumbing. Her landlord was a former prison warden who also owned a neighboring house that was “benignly haunted” by a man who had lived there for 40 years. Schwab says, “You could literally hear his footsteps moving through the halls and down the stairs a few times a day.”
2020-10-29.headline_main: Getting Lost Helped V.E. Schwab Find the Idea for Her 20th Book

Lawmakers are interrogating tech C.E.O.s on Capitol Hill while the Justice Department pursues a landmark antitrust case against Google. For decades, tech giants have avoided such scrutiny — hiding behind the idea that their products are free, beneficial, even beloved.
2020-10-29.headline_main: She’s Bursting Big Tech’s Bubble

2020-10-29.abstract: A poem that reminds us of the intricate linkages of everyday life.
2020-10-29.snippet: A poem that reminds us of the intricate linkages of everyday life.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: This is what we have had to do, amid pandemic, grief, political chaos, fires, human rights disasters: continue on with our lives. Doing chores … taking walks … teaching kids … trying to stay steady. In his brilliant forthcoming book, “Tethered to Stars,” Fady Joudah writes about the mysterious cosmos swirling with intricate linkages — as his phone is pinging. Ah, yes, Jerusalem, the Holy City! Right now, let’s call all our cities holy. Let’s hope our trees continue to communicate, whatever humans can or can’t accomplish.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Poem: Gemini

2020-10-29.abstract: Does a pharmaceutical company have a moral obligation to acknowledge my participation with an ongoing supply of the product that I helped test?
2020-10-29.snippet: Does a pharmaceutical company have a moral obligation to acknowledge my participation with an ongoing supply of the product that I helped test?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: When I learned this summer that the clinical trial of the cancer drug that seems to be keeping me alive had unexpectedly shut down, I discovered the murky rules governing drug trials and the stressful confusion they breed in participants.
2020-10-29.headline_main: The Stressful Conclusion of a Clinical Trial

2020-10-29.snippet: Singles are putting their political affiliations front and center on the apps.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Rebecca Cibbarelli, 23, was texting with a man on Hinge while Senator Kamala Harris and Vice President Mike Pence debated on her TV screen in early October. When she told her match what she was watching, he said he didn’t know who either of the people in the debate were, or which political office they were running for.
2020-10-29.headline_main: It’s Election Day. Do You Know How Your Matches Are Voting?

2020-10-29.abstract: Here’s what teenagers can do to equip themselves to move forward during this difficult and frustrating time.
2020-10-29.snippet: Here’s what teenagers can do to equip themselves to move forward during this difficult and frustrating time.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The school year is still young, yet parents and students alike may have noticed that academic motivation is already low. No surprise there. Whether school is remote, in-person or hybrid, many students have come to feel that, if this year were a meal, it would be all vegetables and no dessert. Gone, or hamstrung by screens, masks and plexiglass, are the encouraging company of classmates and teachers, the camaraderie of tackling tedious work alongside friends and the school day boost of exchanging a few words with one’s crush. Still here is the steady stream of assignments, assessments and lectures.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How to Do School When Motivation Has Gone Missing

2020-10-29.abstract: It has become impossible for democracies to believe it is in their interest to take Trump’s America seriously.
2020-10-29.snippet: It has become impossible for democracies to believe it is in their interest to take Trump’s America seriously.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Tuesday’s election will be seen globally as a referendum on the durability of democracy. If American democracy, long a beacon, cannot self-correct, then all democracies are at risk. European nations have watched with alarm as President Trump has set about undermining American democracy while attacking the very foundations — the European Union and NATO — that allowed war-torn Europe to become whole, democratic and free.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How Trump Lowered America’s Standing in the World

2020-10-29.abstract: I spent months agonizing over my lack of a partner or high-powered career. But it was my depression that almost upended my dream of motherhood.
2020-10-29.snippet: I spent months agonizing over my lack of a partner or high-powered career. But it was my depression that almost upended my dream of motherhood.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Motherhood was a dream of love planted in my heart before I was born, always a “when,” never an “if.” Even after I divorced at 34, childless, I still assumed my future would follow the date-marry-procreate blueprint I’d always imagined. But four years, dozens of dates and not a single serious boyfriend later, it seemed that a husband’s second coming was unlikely in my immediate future.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Are There Any Mothers Out There Like Me?

2020-10-29.abstract: As their communities’ needs shifted amid the pandemic, these neighbors offered help.
2020-10-29.snippet: As their communities’ needs shifted amid the pandemic, these neighbors offered help.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: On a blustery day in May, Vanessa Fransen rolled her wagon up to a house in Makoti, N.D. She deposited a bundle on the doormat, rang the doorbell and sprinted away. But this wasn’t your typical ding-dong-ditch: When her neighbors opened their door, they found a bag full of books.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Where Covid Left Holes, Volunteers Stepped In

2020-10-29.abstract: Keith Raniere, the founder of Nxivm, had abusive sexual relationships with three sisters who joined his organization, the family said. Their father still supports him.
2020-10-29.snippet: Keith Raniere, the founder of Nxivm, had abusive sexual relationships with three sisters who joined his organization, the family said. Their father still supports him.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: She walked into a hushed courtroom on Tuesday, turning to face the man who had sexually abused her as a 15-year-old and slept with her older sisters as well, sometimes at the same time. He had ensnared her entire family with his pseudophilosophy of self-fulfillment and pitted them against one another.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How the Nxivm Sex Cult Leader Tore One Family Apart

2020-10-29.abstract: The United States should threaten to retaliate — and I’m not talking about economic sanctions or legal indictments.
2020-10-29.snippet: The United States should threaten to retaliate — and I’m not talking about economic sanctions or legal indictments.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Put yourself in the shoes of Russian or Iranian leadership for a moment. Why not interfere with the voting in the U.S. presidential election? What could be more advantageous than catalyzing a bitter and protracted battle over the results of the election, with a chance of igniting civil unrest throughout the country? Sure, it might not work — but with little to lose and so much to gain, why not try?
2020-10-29.headline_main: So, Russia, You Want to Mess With Our Voting Machines?

2020-10-29.abstract: The country let some of the worst fears of the founders come true.
2020-10-29.snippet: The country let some of the worst fears of the founders come true.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: How could we have been so blind? How could we have been so naïve? How did we not believe that the worst was possible until we plummeted into it?
2020-10-29.headline_main: America Shocked Itself and the World

2020-10-29.abstract: A victory by the Democrats would herald the arrival of a formidable multiracial coalition in the country’s largest red state.
2020-10-29.snippet: A victory by the Democrats would herald the arrival of a formidable multiracial coalition in the country’s largest red state.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: BROWNSVILLE, Texas — When Senator Ted Cruz of Texas spoke with President Trump on the phone last week, he congratulated the president on his debate performance, nudged him to keep driving policy-oriented attacks against his opponent, Joseph R. Biden Jr., and relayed one more message.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Texas Is a Tossup. So Why Won’t Trump or Biden Campaign There?

2020-10-29.abstract: The storm’s strong winds caused widespread power outages in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and the Carolinas.
2020-10-29.snippet: The storm’s strong winds caused widespread power outages in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and the Carolinas.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Hurricane Zeta barraged the South with powerful winds on Thursday, shredding homes and businesses, knocking down trees and leaving about two million electricity customers without power.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Zeta Knocks Out Power to 2 Million

2020-10-29.abstract: And it won’t come back even if and when he’s gone.
2020-10-29.snippet: And it won’t come back even if and when he’s gone.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: There are, I suppose, some people who still imagine that if and when Donald Trump leaves office we’ll see a rebirth of civility and cooperation in U.S. politics. They are, of course, hopelessly naïve. America in the 2020s will remain a deeply polarized nation, rife with crazy conspiracy theories and, quite possibly, plagued by right-wing terrorism.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Trump Killed the Pax Americana

2020-10-29.abstract: How one researcher arrived at a figure of more than a million and a half.
2020-10-29.snippet: How one researcher arrived at a figure of more than a million and a half.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The pandemic has been a continuing nightmare for parents.
2020-10-29.headline_main: The Mystery of How Many Mothers Have Left Work Because of School Closings

2020-10-29.abstract: What I lost in the Trump years was a kind of innocence.
2020-10-29.snippet: What I lost in the Trump years was a kind of innocence.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: It’s always assumed that those of us who felt certain of Hillary Clinton’s victory in 2016 were putting too much trust in polls.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How Will I Ever Look at America the Same Way Again?

2020-10-29.abstract: How could I capture, remotely, intimate portraits of the actor from my New Jersey home? By recruiting two sweet, capable assistants.
