2020-10-29.headline_main: Smile, Dad: In a Photo Session With Matthew McConaughey, His Kids Did the Shooting

2020-10-29.abstract: How this president invaded our brains and destroyed American culture.
2020-10-29.snippet: How this president invaded our brains and destroyed American culture.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: It’s very hard to catalog all the things we’ve lost under the presidency of Donald Trump.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Four Wasted Years Thinking About Donald Trump

2020-10-29.abstract: There’s a new political fashion statement in town, just in time for the election. Should you wear it?
2020-10-29.snippet: There’s a new political fashion statement in town, just in time for the election. Should you wear it?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Around this time four years ago, a grass-roots movement began on Facebook urging women to adopt a specific uniform as they went to the polls. And though #wearwhitetovote and #pantsuitnation were superficially about fashion, they were really about symbolism and female solidarity, about the precedent-changing candidacy of Hillary Clinton and the long line of feminists and suffragists that stretched out behind her.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Why Celebrities Are Wearing Hot Pink Suits

2020-10-29.abstract: With business travel all but stopped, city hotels and tourist organizations have made a full-court press to attract local and nearby leisure travelers with bottom-barrel rates and extra perks.
2020-10-29.snippet: With business travel all but stopped, city hotels and tourist organizations have made a full-court press to attract local and nearby leisure travelers with bottom-barrel rates and extra perks.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The pandemic has decimated urban tourism as Americans, if they choose to travel, have fled populated areas to spread out in rural and wilderness destinations where social distancing comes easier.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How to Staycation in 6 American Cities

2020-10-29.abstract: New details of the Justice Department’s handling of the accusations against Halkbank reveal how Turkey’s leader pressured the president, prompting concern from top White House aides.
2020-10-29.snippet: New details of the Justice Department’s handling of the accusations against Halkbank reveal how Turkey’s leader pressured the president, prompting concern from top White House aides.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — ​Geoffrey S. Berman was outraged.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Turkish Bank Case Showed Erdogan’s Influence With Trump

2020-10-29.abstract: Remoras — known for hitching rides on whales and sharks — swim surprisingly freely over the surfaces formed by their hosts.
2020-10-29.snippet: Remoras — known for hitching rides on whales and sharks — swim surprisingly freely over the surfaces formed by their hosts.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: In 2014, Jeremy Goldbogen, a marine biologist at Stanford University, stuck video cameras on the backs of blue whales, hoping to learn more about their feeding habits. When he retrieved the footage, he realized he had been photobombed. Dozens of Remora australis were treating his research subjects like dance floors, skimming and twisting across them — even as the whales swam at high speeds.
2020-10-29.headline_main: How Suckerfish Surf Across Blue Whales Without Falling Off

2020-10-29.abstract: Awash in new firearms, cities are drawing connections between the stresses of the coronavirus and a surge in homicides.
2020-10-29.snippet: Awash in new firearms, cities are drawing connections between the stresses of the coronavirus and a surge in homicides.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Family and friends of Aaron Pryor say they may never know exactly why the 16-year-old star football player, a lightning-fast running back, was killed in broad daylight on a Sunday in September in a driveway near his Oakland home. Video of the shooting viewed by family members shows an assailant, who has not been arrested, confronting the baby-faced teenager before firing more than a dozen rounds.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Police Pin a Rise in Murders on an Unusual Suspect: Covid

2020-10-29.abstract: Trailing in the polls, President Trump and his campaign are pursuing a three-pronged strategy that would effectively suppress the mail-in vote in the critical state of Pennsylvania.
2020-10-29.snippet: Trailing in the polls, President Trump and his campaign are pursuing a three-pronged strategy that would effectively suppress the mail-in vote in the critical state of Pennsylvania.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — President Trump’s campaign in the crucial battleground of Pennsylvania is pursuing a three-pronged strategy that would effectively suppress mail-in votes in the state, moving to stop the processing of absentee votes before Election Day, pushing to limit how late mail-in ballots can be accepted and intimidating Pennsylvanians trying to vote early.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Facing Gap in Pennsylvania, Trump Camp Tries to Make Voting Harder

2020-10-29.abstract: Survival rates have improved with medical advances and less crowded hospitals, studies say. But the latest record-breaking surge in infections could reverse the gains.
2020-10-29.snippet: Survival rates have improved with medical advances and less crowded hospitals, studies say. But the latest record-breaking surge in infections could reverse the gains.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus struck the United States earlier this year with devastating force. In April, it killed more than 10,000 people in New York City. By early May, nearly 50,000 nursing home residents and their caregivers across the country had died.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Death Rates Have Dropped for Seriously Ill Covid Patients

2020-10-29.abstract: What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.
2020-10-29.snippet: What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Ashley Peldon gets paid to scream.
2020-10-29.headline_main: They Scream! We Scream!

2020-10-29.abstract: The pandemic has staggered the industry and left independent operations like the Park Plaza Cinema in Hilton Head Island, S.C., fighting to stay afloat.
2020-10-29.snippet: The pandemic has staggered the industry and left independent operations like the Park Plaza Cinema in Hilton Head Island, S.C., fighting to stay afloat.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: On a rainy day last week, 72 moviegoers visited the Park Plaza Cinema in Hilton Head Island, S.C., to see Liam Neeson in “Honest Thief.” It was the largest single-day attendance the independently owned five-screen theater had seen since reopening in August after a five-month shutdown. The feeling of celebration was short-lived. The next day, only 22 people showed.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘It’s Going Away’: A Small Movie Theater Struggles to Survive

2020-10-29.abstract: From Philadelphia to Sonoma County, Calif., election officials said they were working marathon hours to fight a flood of falsehoods.
2020-10-29.snippet: From Philadelphia to Sonoma County, Calif., election officials said they were working marathon hours to fight a flood of falsehoods.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The morning after last month’s presidential debate, the phones inside the Philadelphia election offices that Al Schmidt helps oversee rang off the hook.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Tsunamis of Misinformation’ Overwhelm Local Election Officials

2020-10-29.abstract: Barack Obama’s memoir is landing. So is a biography of Adrienne Rich and buzzy fiction from Jo Nesbo, Nicole Krauss and Susie Yang.
2020-10-29.snippet: Barack Obama’s memoir is landing. So is a biography of Adrienne Rich and buzzy fiction from Jo Nesbo, Nicole Krauss and Susie Yang.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Though details are scant, this is shaping up to be the biggest book of the year. We know it’s the first of a projected two-volume project and encompasses the former president’s campaign and early years in the White House. Crown is printing 3 million copies, and booksellers are hoping the book will offset a string of difficult months since the pandemic hit.
2020-10-29.headline_main: 16 New Books to Watch For in November

2020-10-29.abstract: They came to work when death counts were horrific and the risks enormous. Now they fear for their jobs. At one home, they agreed to speak out.
2020-10-29.snippet: They came to work when death counts were horrific and the risks enormous. Now they fear for their jobs. At one home, they agreed to speak out.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: On a recent morning in Staten Island, the quiet at Clove Lakes Health Care and Rehabilitation Center was unsettling. Employees in sanitary gowns and face masks moved through a brightly decorated front area devoid of residents or chatter.
2020-10-29.headline_main: 40 Dead, Now 40 Laid Off: Inside a Nursing Home in Crisis

2020-10-29.abstract: In a letter to Alex M. Azar II, the health secretary, House Democrats detailed how a $265 million public relations campaign tried to bolster President Trump.
2020-10-29.snippet: In a letter to Alex M. Azar II, the health secretary, House Democrats detailed how a $265 million public relations campaign tried to bolster President Trump.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A $265 million public campaign to “defeat despair” around the coronavirus was planned partly around the politically tinged theme that “helping the president will help the country,” according to documents released on Thursday by House investigators.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Celebrity Vetting and ‘Helping the President’ to Defeat Coronavirus Despair

2020-10-29.abstract: Should your wife have poured ketchup into your shared leftovers?
2020-10-29.snippet: Should your wife have poured ketchup into your shared leftovers?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Jake writes: My wife puts ketchup on her macaroni and cheese. I disagree with this, but I don’t mind. Today, however, she dumped ketchup right into a container of leftovers with three servings left. She sees nothing wrong. I see a monster.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on Leftovers Etiquette

2020-10-29.abstract: Why spiders and snakes and things that crawl fill so many of us with dread.
2020-10-29.snippet: Why spiders and snakes and things that crawl fill so many of us with dread.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The fear of snakes has plagued Sydney Masters as long as she can remember. Ms. Masters, a New York public relations executive, experiences an overwhelming panic-attack type of fear — shortness of breath, rapid heartbeat — whenever she’s near anything that slithers.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Have a Creepy, Crawly Halloween

2020-10-29.abstract: “Truth Seekers,” the comedy duo’s first TV collaboration in two decades, is rooted in their own ghost hunting exploits.
2020-10-29.snippet: “Truth Seekers,” the comedy duo’s first TV collaboration in two decades, is rooted in their own ghost hunting exploits.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Simon Pegg and Nick Frost know it’s been a while. Despite being best friends and an acclaimed comic double act in films like “Hot Fuzz” and “Shaun of the Dead,” they have seldom crossed paths, creatively speaking, since 2013’s “The World’s End.” It’s been even longer since they worked together in television — they haven’t co-starred in a series since the British sitcom “Spaced” aired over 20 years ago.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Simon Pegg and Nick Frost Are Back With a British ‘X-Files’

2020-10-29.abstract: The president isn’t a throwback to old-school masculinity. He’s a he-man specifically engineered for our image-based, sensation-saturated times.
2020-10-29.snippet: The president isn’t a throwback to old-school masculinity. He’s a he-man specifically engineered for our image-based, sensation-saturated times.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Remarkably, in these fractious times, President Trump has managed to forge a singular area of consensus among liberals and conservatives, Republicans and Democrats: Nearly everyone seems to agree that he represents a throwback to a vintage version of manhood.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Trump’s Thoroughly Modern Masculinity

2020-10-29.abstract: When Senator Ted Cruz of Texas spoke with President Trump on the phone last week, he congratulated him on his debate performance, nudged him to keep driving policy-oriented attacks against his opponent, Joseph R. Biden Jr., and relayed one more message.

2020-10-29.snippet: They have long prided themselves on an efficient government, some say to the point of smugness. Ranking high in the rate of daily infections is forcing a reckoning.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: AMSTERDAM — As coronavirus cases have shot through the roof, waiting times for tests and results have grown so lengthy that the health authorities have considered sending samples to labs in Abu Dhabi. Contact tracing, divided among 25 competing contractors, has never gotten off the ground.
2020-10-29.headline_main: As Coronavirus Surges, Chastened Dutch Wonder, ‘What Happened to Us?’

2020-10-29.abstract: A man with a knife killed three people at a church in Nice, in an assault that bore similarities to the recent killing of a schoolteacher, which has shaken the country.
2020-10-29.snippet: A man with a knife killed three people at a church in Nice, in an assault that bore similarities to the recent killing of a schoolteacher, which has shaken the country.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: NICE, France — A terror attack that killed three people in Nice on Thursday left France increasingly embattled at home and abroad, as the government called for toughening measures against Islamist extremism, amid rising tensions with Muslim nations.

2020-10-29.headline_main: Where the virus is less bad: Canada and Germany.

2020-10-29.abstract: Kelly Dodd is one of the stars of “The Real Housewives of Orange County,” a show in its 15th season that follows the travails of six women in Southern California.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Kelly Dodd is one of the stars of “The Real Housewives of Orange County,” a show in its 15th season that follows the travails of six women in Southern California.
2020-10-29.headline_main: The connection between ‘Real Housewives’ and public health behavior.

2020-10-29.abstract: Rodrigo Sorogoyen’s feature about a mother in Spain whose son disappears is a compelling and unsettling character study.
2020-10-29.snippet: Rodrigo Sorogoyen’s feature about a mother in Spain whose son disappears is a compelling and unsettling character study.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: A parent’s worst nightmare, unfolding in real time, opens this Spanish drama. Elena (the superb Marta Nieto) gets a call from her young son, Iván. He’s vacationing in France with his father, from whom Elena is estranged. Iván’s dad went to their camper to fetch something, supposedly, and the 6-year-old boy is alone on a deserted beach. The bars on his cellphone are going down, he says. And so is the sun.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Madre’ Review: A Tense Depiction of a Mother Undone

2020-10-29.abstract: Omari Hardwick plays a lawyer who gets trapped in the superstition-laden enclave of Appalachia where he was raised.
2020-10-29.snippet: Omari Hardwick plays a lawyer who gets trapped in the superstition-laden enclave of Appalachia where he was raised.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: In “Spell,” Omari Hardwick plays a tenacious, wealthy lawyer named Marquis T. Woods; his boss calls him a “gladiator.” But the boss is also worried that Marquis might go easy on class-action plaintiffs who, like Marquis, are Black. Marquis doesn’t seem to have any misgivings. Then he gets a call: His abusive father has died, compelling him to return with his wife and children to a remote pocket of Appalachia he was thrilled to escape. Superstition rules the area. Even an airstrip gas station sells gear for warding off conjurers.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Spell’ Review: Occult Reprogramming

2020-10-29.abstract: In Jacob Chase’s film, a monster from another realm invades ours through phone screens and tablets.
2020-10-29.snippet: In Jacob Chase’s film, a monster from another realm invades ours through phone screens and tablets.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The Babadook goes paperless in “Come Play,” a thriller in which a spindly creature from another realm torments a child and his family through phone screens and tablets.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Come Play’ Review: Alexa, Find Me a Derivative Thriller

2020-10-29.abstract: This documentary traces the mercurial journey of a Cambodian refugee who became a doughnut mogul in California.
2020-10-29.snippet: This documentary traces the mercurial journey of a Cambodian refugee who became a doughnut mogul in California.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: In 1975, Ted Ngoy fled the war in Cambodia with his wife and three kids and arrived in America as a penniless refugee. Within a decade, he had become a multimillionaire with a lakeside mansion, fancy European cars and a doughnut empire in Southern California that even Dunkin’ couldn’t rival there.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘The Donut King’ Review: Sweet Dreams

2020-10-29.abstract: Oliver Laxe gives us the story of humans and nature in crisis in Galicia, with nonactors playing the roles.
2020-10-29.snippet: Oliver Laxe gives us the story of humans and nature in crisis in Galicia, with nonactors playing the roles.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: There’s not too much story in “Fire Will Come,” but once the title promise comes to fruition, the viewer has come to care about its characters and how they will weather a devastating forest blaze.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Fire Will Come’ Review: An Arsonist Returns Home to the Forest

2020-10-29.abstract: “Damnation,” an atmospheric tale of erotic obsession, is the movie with which the Hungarian filmmaker Bela Tarr came into his own as a stylist.
2020-10-29.snippet: “Damnation,” an atmospheric tale of erotic obsession, is the movie with which the Hungarian filmmaker Bela Tarr came into his own as a stylist.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Made in 1988 but virtually unknown in the United States, “Damnation” is the movie with which the great Hungarian filmmaker Bela Tarr fully became “Bela Tarr.”
2020-10-29.headline_main: Welcome to His World: Bela Tarr’s First Meteorological Event

2020-10-29.abstract: This documentary by Kim A. Snyder asks difficult questions about what it means to grow up in an America where gun violence is far too common.
2020-10-29.snippet: This documentary by Kim A. Snyder asks difficult questions about what it means to grow up in an America where gun violence is far too common.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Columbine. Sandy Hook. Parkland. Before the pandemic, school shootings had become so commonplace in the United States that they warranted distressingly detailed charts. “Us Kids,” a documentary directed by Kim A. Snyder (“Newtown”), uses the 2018 shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla., to ask difficult questions about what it means to grow up in an America habituated to gun violence.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Us Kids’ Review: They’re Not All Right

2020-10-29.abstract: This recently restored film by King Hu is a spectacular, exhilarating entertainment.
2020-10-29.snippet: This recently restored film by King Hu is a spectacular, exhilarating entertainment.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: From the mid-60s to the end of the ’70s, the Hong Kong director King Hu (who died in 1997) made some of the most distinctive, daring and enjoyable wuxia (literally, “martial heroes”) films ever. “Raining in the Mountain,” from 1979, is the latest Hu to benefit from a restoration and it’s a treat.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Raining in the Mountain’ Review: A Martial Arts Gem From 1979

2020-10-29.abstract: In New York, trick-or-treating has been curtailed, and parades called off. But there are plenty of ways to please and spook the little ones.
2020-10-29.snippet: In New York, trick-or-treating has been curtailed, and parades called off. But there are plenty of ways to please and spook the little ones.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: If you have children, then Halloween will see a lot more trick than treat this year. Here in New York, cruising neighborhoods for candy has been discouraged, parades are canceled and bobbing for apples is the kind of innocent party game that makes virologists cry. It might seem that not even a pillowcase full of mini Kit Kats can improve the situation.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Halloween for Kids: Different This Year, but Still Delightful

2020-10-29.abstract: The president leans into denial for his closing argument: This is your morning tip sheet.
2020-10-29.snippet: The president leans into denial for his closing argument: This is your morning tip sheet.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Trump continues to insist that a vaccine is coming, while the Supreme Court let stand decisions in two battleground states allowing more absentee ballots to be counted. It’s Thursday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.
2020-10-29.headline_main: What Turn Are We Really Rounding on the Virus?

2020-10-29.abstract: A 13-year-old boy, his body covered in hair, searches for the mother he never knew.
2020-10-29.snippet: A 13-year-old boy, his body covered in hair, searches for the mother he never knew.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Paul (Jaeden Martell), the titular 13-year-old of “The True Adventures of Wolfboy,” has a condition that causes his body to be covered in hair; if he tries shaving, the hair grows back thicker. Bullies ridicule him for his appearance and don’t even spare his single father (Chris Messina).
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘The True Adventures of Wolfboy’ Review: A Hirsute Teen Drama

2020-10-29.abstract: Echoes of the past are spooking investors.
2020-10-29.snippet: Echoes of the past are spooking investors.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: On Nov. 17 and 18, DealBook is holding our first Online Summit. Join us as we welcome the most consequential newsmakers in business, policy and culture to explore the pivotal questions of the moment — and the future. Watch from anywhere in the world, free of charge. Register now.
2020-10-29.headline_main: For Stock Markets, ‘an Unwelcome Déjà Vu Feeling’

2020-10-29.abstract: China’s leader emerged from a key Communist Party meeting newly emboldened, outlining a road map for the country for years to come. Some have warned of overreach.
2020-10-29.snippet: China’s leader emerged from a key Communist Party meeting newly emboldened, outlining a road map for the country for years to come. Some have warned of overreach.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The United States is embroiled in a bitter presidential race and a surge in coronavirus infections. Europe is locking down again. In Beijing, by contrast, Xi Jinping is exuding confidence that he and China can emerge from the pandemic stronger and unbowed.
2020-10-29.headline_main: As the West Stumbles, ‘Helmsman’ Xi Pushes an Ambitious Plan for China

2020-10-29.abstract: The pandemic didn’t just shrink the U.S. economy. It also reshaped it, at least temporarily — shutting down some industries almost entirely, while leading to a rise in demand in others.

2020-10-29.abstract: A reader feels that Scarlett O’Hara-style period dress may be seen as whitewashing the antebellum South.
2020-10-29.snippet: A reader feels that Scarlett O’Hara-style period dress may be seen as whitewashing the antebellum South.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: A new friend in the Midwest was invited to an outdoor Halloween party where mask-wearing was requested. We went shopping for an art-inspired costume for her. But I saw that she was gravitating toward period costumes. After the party, she posted pictures online. I was stunned! She wore a full-blown Scarlett O’Hara-type gown — to a mansion, no less! If I’d known, I would have tried to talk her out if it. This year’s widespread Black Lives Matter protests, along with the traditional whitewashing of the antebellum South, make her choice seem insensitive. I’ll be seeing her soon, and I already feel awkward. I know she’ll share details of the party, and I feel obligated to enlighten her. Any advice?
2020-10-29.headline_main: Can I Tell My Friend Her Halloween Costume Is Problematic?

2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Like so many other things on the internet, the viral video “Sassy Justice” seemed too good to be true when it started showing up on television and then on the internet earlier this week. Presented as a local news broadcast from a station in Cheyenne, Wyo., the video is hosted by a reporter named Fred Sassy, who appears to be a dead ringer for President Trump — if he wore a cheap suit and a white wig and spoke with a campy accent.

2020-10-29.headline_main: The Wine World’s Most Elite Circle Has a Sexual Harassment Problem

2020-10-29.abstract: Just outside San Miguel de Allende, this modernist retreat reflects natural beauty in more ways than one.
2020-10-29.snippet: Just outside San Miguel de Allende, this modernist retreat reflects natural beauty in more ways than one.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: At dusk, the house appears as a phosphorescent box, its mirrored panels reflecting the light of the sky and the ocher hues of the mountainside that, as if a mirage, will soon vanish as night falls. Casa Etérea — perched above San Miguel de Allende on the rugged slopes of the extinct Palo Huérfano volcano, part of the greater Los Picachos mountain range of Central Mexico — is both an architectural showpiece and a site-specific art installation, one built to inspire a sense of awe. A feat of sustainable engineering that uses solar energy and collected rainwater, the 800-square-foot dwelling has a glass exterior (with a striped UV-reflective coating) that is bird-friendly — even as it creates the effect of a seemingly infinite landscape.
2020-10-29.headline_main: A Glass House in the Mexican Desert

2020-10-29.abstract: Research on fossil canine genomes is expanding and producing some surprises about the lives of dogs and humans in prehistoric times.
2020-10-29.snippet: Research on fossil canine genomes is expanding and producing some surprises about the lives of dogs and humans in prehistoric times.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The most extensive study of ancient dog DNA to date has shown how rapidly dogs spread across the world after domestication, and pins their likely origin to a group of extinct wolves.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Ancient Dog DNA Shows Early Spread Around the Globe

2020-10-29.abstract: A five-disc archival collection traces the beginnings of one of the most daring trajectories in popular music.
2020-10-29.snippet: A five-disc archival collection traces the beginnings of one of the most daring trajectories in popular music.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The story of why Joni Mitchell quit piano lessons is also the story of how Joni Mitchell wrote her first song. She was around 7, and the tune was called “Robin Walk” — “it was real bouncy,” she remembers in a spirited interview with Cameron Crowe for the liner notes of her new archival collection, “Joni Mitchell Archives — Vol. 1: The Early Years (1963-1967).”
2020-10-29.headline_main: Remarkable Records of Joni Mitchell’s Changes

2020-10-29.abstract: Living for 27 years with Lou Gehrig’s disease (and beating the odds), he started Ride for Life, an annual trek that has raised millions for A.L.S. research.
2020-10-29.snippet: Living for 27 years with Lou Gehrig’s disease (and beating the odds), he started Ride for Life, an annual trek that has raised millions for A.L.S. research.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Chris Pendergast, a Long Island teacher who defied the odds by surviving 27 years with Lou Gehrig’s disease, leading marathon “rides for life” for hundreds of miles from his motorized wheelchair to publicize the plight of fellow patients and raise $10 million for research, died on Oct. 14 at his home in Miller Place, N.Y. He was 71.

2020-10-29.abstract: The morning after Hurricane Zeta’s forceful winds downed power lines, toppled trees and caused road closures across the state of Georgia, widespread outages left more than 600,000 Georgians without electricity and took some of the state’s advanced voting locations offline Thursday — the penultimate day for early, in-person voting.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: The morning after Hurricane Zeta’s forceful winds downed power lines, toppled trees and caused road closures across the state of Georgia, widespread outages left more than 600,000 Georgians without electricity and took some of the state’s advanced voting locations offline Thursday — the penultimate day for early, in-person voting.

2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: IVRY-SUR-SEINE, France — At age 42, Mehdy Belabbas embodied the French republican promise of upward social mobility: the son of a Muslim construction worker of Algerian descent, he was the first in his family to attend graduate school and served for 12 years as the deputy mayor of the working-class city where he grew up.

2020-10-29.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2020-10-29.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: To a horror fan, “Halloween vs. Covid-19” sounds almost as promising as “Godzilla vs. Kong.” But in the end it’s been no real contest — not in my neighborhood, anyway, where health officials are reminding people that parties are a bad idea this year and recommending that children forgo the usual trick-or-treating. That’s ironic, maybe, for a holiday meant to show that we’re not afraid of death. But there you have it. We’re afraid of death.
2020-10-29.headline_main: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week

2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Growing up, Zoe Lister-Jones, the actress and filmmaker, was not into frights. Not a horror person. “I never did the Ouija board, Bloody Mary, light-as-a-feather slumber-party vibe,” she said. “It was Brooklyn in the ’90s, and I think that my life felt scary enough.”

2020-10-29.abstract: Baseball strategy has changed rapidly since La Russa last managed, in 2011. After being hired by the White Sox on Thursday, he said he would use both his own baseball experience and advanced analytics.
2020-10-29.snippet: Baseball strategy has changed rapidly since La Russa last managed, in 2011. After being hired by the White Sox on Thursday, he said he would use both his own baseball experience and advanced analytics.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Tony La Russa has a permanent home along the top row of the back wall in the Hall of Fame’s plaque gallery in Cooperstown, N.Y., between Bobby Cox and Frank Thomas. That is where visitors will find La Russa: in profile, lips creased, eyes focused, a strategist in bronze. The first sentence of the text below his image cites his 2,728 victories, the third most for a manager.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Tony La Russa Returns at 76, Ready to Combine Old Wisdom and New Data

2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: Before a speech this month in Durham, N.C., Joseph R. Biden Jr. made his way around a circle of participants, chatting with each of them before posing for a group photograph. In Chester, Pa., a week later, he kibitzed with supporters, playfully punching one in the arm. And on a recent trip to Florida, his private schedule for the day included time for a photo line.

2020-10-29.abstract: Europe’s latest wave of restrictions to stop the spread of coronavirus have largely avoided closing schools. We take a look at why and how they are being kept open.
2020-10-29.snippet: Europe’s latest wave of restrictions to stop the spread of coronavirus have largely avoided closing schools. We take a look at why and how they are being kept open.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — When Chancellor Angela Merkel announced the latest round of restrictions on public life, she named bars, restaurants, theaters, concert halls, gyms and tattoo parlors as institutions that would be forced to close. But missing from the list released on Wednesday were schools and day care centers — among the first to be shuttered in the spring lockdown.
2020-10-29.headline_main: Why Is Europe Keeping Its Schools Open, Despite New Lockdowns?

2020-10-29.snippet: Do we have enough bread crumbs to get to the truth?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: With a monumental election on the horizon, we want to bring up a few recent events that reveal some sort of truth amid the confusion. From the N.B.A. bubble to the fly in Mike Pence’s debate-night hair to the HBO series “Lovecraft Country,” these are the moments that point us beyond the present, to be our best and greatest selves.
2020-10-29.headline_main: ‘Waiter, There’s a Fly in Our Bubble’

2020-10-29.abstract: What lessons about family have you learned during the pandemic?
2020-10-29.snippet: What lessons about family have you learned during the pandemic?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: “Three Families. Nine Weeks. ‘Things Are Getting Annoying.’” profiles three families, seven parents and nine kids who filmed themselves and share what it has been like to work, parent, school, eat, sleep and hang out all jammed under one roof for three months straight during quarantine. This eight-minute film touches on themes of family, love, conflict and perseverance and offers many practical and often humorous lessons on parenting in a pandemic like “Trust your kids to do their work,” “Don’t force mindfulness” and “Don’t forget to follow your own rules.”
2020-10-29.headline_main: Film Club: ‘Three Families. Nine Weeks. ‘Things Are Getting Annoying.’’

2020-10-29.abstract: In the last year, Bolivia’s democracy suffered as partisan clashes filled its streets and mistrust in government grew. And yet it pulled off a calm, uncontested election. What can it teach other democracies under siege?
2020-10-29.snippet: In the last year, Bolivia’s democracy suffered as partisan clashes filled its streets and mistrust in government grew. And yet it pulled off a calm, uncontested election. What can it teach other democracies under siege?
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia — As nationalism, misinformation and the pandemic have emerged as threats to democracy — and a presidential election has roiled the United States — the relatively small nation of Bolivia, in political upheaval for most its 195-year history, managed a free and fair vote.
2020-10-29.headline_main: From Bolivia, Lessons for a Successful Election

2020-10-29.abstract: Another pandemic holiday means another impossible decision between my health and my children’s happiness.
2020-10-29.snippet: Another pandemic holiday means another impossible decision between my health and my children’s happiness.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: I always know when my older daughter is about to cry. She’s 9 now, but her voice still gives her away, a slight squeak settling into her words. When she doesn’t speak, her cheeks show me, a blush spreading out from their centers. It was this way one night in late August as she pulled pajamas from her drawers.

2020-10-29.snippet: How to find constellations, planets and stories in the sky.
2020-10-29.lead_paragraph: As a little girl growing up in Portugal, Raquel Nuno made birthday wishes upon shooting stars. She was born near the peak of the Perseids meteor shower, one of the most prolific annual cosmic light shows. Every year her father whisked her and her family away to the beach to celebrate under the celestial fireworks. There, she gazed up at the dazzling display amid a backdrop of stars as countless as the grains of sand at her feet.
2020-10-29.headline_main: An Astronomer’s Guide to Stargazing with Your Space-Obsessed Kid

2020-10-30.abstract: Ballpark and Tex-Mex nachos are both ubiquitous in the United States. But the original version is deeply rooted in the borderlands and Mexican home cooking.
2020-10-30.snippet: Ballpark and Tex-Mex nachos are both ubiquitous in the United States. But the original version is deeply rooted in the borderlands and Mexican home cooking.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: The biggest claim to fame for the border city of Piedras Negras, in Coahuila, Mexico, is that it was the birthplace of nachos, one of America’s most popular snacks. Yet that fact is not widely known beyond the region, something that has long frustrated the people of Piedras, as locals call their hometown. They’re so proud of their invention that they started the International Nacho Festival there in 1995.

2020-10-30.snippet: After an awkward fall 11 seconds into his first Boston University game left him a quadriplegic, he dedicated his life to advocacy for similarly disabled people.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Travis Roy, who suffered a paralyzing injury just 11 seconds into his first hockey game for Boston University in 1995 and, as a philanthropist and motivational speaker, was revered by the sports world as an example of determination and courage, died on Thursday in a hospital outside Burlington, Vt. He was 45.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Travis Roy, Who Inspired Millions After a Hockey Tragedy, Dies at 45

2020-10-30.snippet: What it feels like to leave New York and land in a parallel universe of calm politics and good health.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Roughly three weeks ago, I stepped off a plane and into a parallel universe. Here in New Zealand, coronavirus lurks far from the limelight, the recent election was orderly and uncontroversial, and the national mood — for the most part — approximates relief and even elation.
2020-10-30.headline_main: New Zealand’s Advance Preview of a Post-Virus World

2020-10-30.abstract: Delayed from the summer, France’s biggest stage celebration was further curtailed as restrictions again hit the country. That made the moments of grace that were possible all the more powerful.
2020-10-30.snippet: Delayed from the summer, France’s biggest stage celebration was further curtailed as restrictions again hit the country. That made the moments of grace that were possible all the more powerful.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: AVIGNON, France — Festivalgoers who cross the medieval ramparts of Avignon are used to being greeted with a riot of activity. Every July, thousands of posters cover the city’s walls to advertise stage productions as the official Avignon Festival and its Fringe compete for attention. Seemingly every street corner brings hopeful performers ready to pitch their work to passers-by, day and night.
2020-10-30.headline_main: In Avignon, Snatching Theater From the Jaws of New Lockdowns

The new French film “Rogue City” tramples it, positing that corruption is pervasive and we live in a hopeless, brutal world from which there is no escape. It’s a bleak vision that makes Olivier Marchal’s movie radical in its nihilism.

2020-10-30.abstract: Canada’s oil patch has nearly 100,000 suspended wells, neither active nor capped, and they’re a worrying source of planet-warming methane.
2020-10-30.snippet: Canada’s oil patch has nearly 100,000 suspended wells, neither active nor capped, and they’re a worrying source of planet-warming methane.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: REDWATER, Alberta — William Romaniuk stopped his tractor at the edge of his field and sniffed. A breeze came off the North Saskatchewan River, rippling across rows of ripe wheat, but a caustic scent flooded his nose. An oil well between his crops and the river was leaking, and enough gas was flowing out of a pipe below the rusty pump jack that the farmer could smell gas and see it swirling in the air.
2020-10-30.headline_main: These Zombies Threaten the Whole Planet

2020-10-30.abstract: Senator Perdue of Georgia cancels his final debate with Jon Ossoff after Ossoff calls him a ‘crook.’
2020-10-30.snippet: Senator Perdue of Georgia cancels his final debate with Jon Ossoff after Ossoff calls him a ‘crook.’
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: The Republican Georgia Senator David Perdue withdrew on Thursday from the final debate in his tight re-election race a day after his Democratic challenger, Jon Ossoff, called him a “crook” and accused him of trying to profit from the coronavirus.
2020-10-30.headline_main: After Jon Ossoff calls him a ‘crook’ during a Georgia Senate debate, David Perdue cancels final one.

2020-10-30.abstract: Proponents of legalizing cannabis voiced anger at Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who revealed only after the referendum that she supported it.
2020-10-30.snippet: Proponents of legalizing cannabis voiced anger at Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who revealed only after the referendum that she supported it.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: New Zealand will join a small number of countries that have legalized euthanasia after its citizens voted overwhelmingly in favor of it in a referendum this month.
2020-10-30.headline_main: New Zealand Voters Approve Euthanasia but Reject Recreational Marijuana

2020-10-30.abstract: With over 9 million U.S. coronavirus cases, outbreaks in swing states could shape the election.
2020-10-30.snippet: With over 9 million U.S. coronavirus cases, outbreaks in swing states could shape the election.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Voters in several swing states are casting their ballots even as the coronavirus reaches new peaks in their communities, creating more uncertainty about how they will vote — and for whom.
2020-10-30.headline_main: As virus cases surge to new records, outbreaks in swing states could shape the election.

2020-10-30.headline_main: ‘Wagner’s Music is Bombastic and Boring’ and Other Letters to the Editor

2020-10-30.snippet: All 15 of our columnists explain what the past four years have cost America, and what’s at stake in this election.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: All 15 of our columnists explain what the past four years have cost America, and what’s at stake in this election.
2020-10-30.headline_main: What Have We Lost?

2020-10-30.abstract: Do you ever listen to songs with lyrics that are explicit, suggestive or violent? Do your parents have rules about what you can and can’t listen to?
2020-10-30.snippet: Do you ever listen to songs with lyrics that are explicit, suggestive or violent? Do your parents have rules about what you can and can’t listen to?
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: What kind of music do you listen to? Do you ever listen to songs with lyrics that are explicit, suggestive or violent? Do you prefer the clean versions of these songs or the unedited ones? Why?
2020-10-30.headline_main: How Do You Feel About Censored Music?

2020-10-30.abstract: Priscilla Page and Glenn Siegel met while organizing a concert at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. They later founded a jazz series in Western Massachusetts.
2020-10-30.snippet: Priscilla Page and Glenn Siegel met while organizing a concert at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. They later founded a jazz series in Western Massachusetts.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: In early October, Priscilla Maria Page and Glenn Steven Siegel watched the jazz saxophonist Charlie Kohlhase lead a band outdoors, where the musicians’ notes cut through fall air. The location of the concert, by a creek outside the Institute for the Musical Arts in Goshen, Mass., was one that Ms. Page and Mr. Siegel had selected: The performance was the latest in a long line of jazz shows that the couple has organized in the region. So it’s natural that when, during the concert, Ms. Page and Mr. Siegel noticed a pair of gnarled apple tree stumps sitting a modest stage length’s apart from each other, they couldn’t help but do a little location scouting.
2020-10-30.headline_main: A Nice Riff on Love

2020-10-30.abstract: Pain, both physical and emotional, is not something to be feared; it’s something to learn to manage, no matter your age, health or time left to live.
2020-10-30.snippet: Pain, both physical and emotional, is not something to be feared; it’s something to learn to manage, no matter your age, health or time left to live.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: “There’s pain, and then there’s stepping on a Lego in the middle of the night,” my father often repeated with a laugh when his grandkids visited. They took over his living room, dining table, bedroom floors and bedside tables with messes of plastic blocks haphazardly assembled to resemble something magical and grand, excavated from the depths of their imaginations.
2020-10-30.headline_main: What Losing My Father Taught Me About Parenting, Planets and Pain

2020-10-30.abstract: Stephanie Hains and Christian Nilsson met up for a Tinder date never expecting to see one another again. Instead, they began a long-distance relationship.
2020-10-30.snippet: Stephanie Hains and Christian Nilsson met up for a Tinder date never expecting to see one another again. Instead, they began a long-distance relationship.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: As rain pelted the London streets, Stephanie Hains and Christian Nilsson were scaling an iron gate at 2 a.m. The two, who met on Tinder and were enjoying a first date, had found themselves locked into Hyde Park.
2020-10-30.headline_main: From Melbourne to New York, Oceans Couldn’t Keep Them Apart

2020-10-30.abstract: Sarah Koatz and Stuart Winchester once rode in a yellow cab with a driver who told them they would get married someday.
2020-10-30.snippet: Sarah Koatz and Stuart Winchester once rode in a yellow cab with a driver who told them they would get married someday.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Sarah Beverly Koatz and Stuart Hopkins Winchester had no idea where their relationship was going in March 2013, but the “Cupid Cabbie” did. By the end of their yellow taxi ride one evening from Union Square to the Upper East Side in New York, he told them they would get married someday.
2020-10-30.headline_main: On-Again, Off-Again, but a Cabdriver Knew They’d Get Married

2020-10-30.abstract: It’s full of tricks and optical illusions.
2020-10-30.snippet: It’s full of tricks and optical illusions.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: It’s full of tricks and optical illusions.
2020-10-30.headline_main: This Election Map Will Be Everywhere. Don’t Let It Fool You.

2020-10-30.abstract: We need a better system of transferring patients to ensure the best care during the next phase of the pandemic.
2020-10-30.snippet: We need a better system of transferring patients to ensure the best care during the next phase of the pandemic.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich. — As hospitals in much of the country face a surge in patients with Covid-19 and the threat of influenza this fall and winter, we must be on guard against attempts to restrict patient admissions or limit intensive-care capacity. The incentives will certainly be there for hospitals to do so.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Do Hospitals Value Everyone? This Winter, They Have a Chance to Prove It

2020-10-30.abstract: David Rhoades and Nicole Weiss have been a couple since high school. A diagnosis brought them even closer together.
2020-10-30.snippet: David Rhoades and Nicole Weiss have been a couple since high school. A diagnosis brought them even closer together.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: David Rhoades skipped a lot of school in the mid-2000s as a student at Sturgis Brown High School in Sturgis, S.D. Not much held his attention, besides a girl a year younger who was good at painting and drawing.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Friends Since Eighth Grade, Married With a New Urgency

2020-10-30.snippet: With just days left until Election Day, Michelle Goldberg and Ross Douthat are joined by the Time magazine columnist and senior editor of The Dispatch, David French.

2020-10-30.headline_main: What if America Gets a Divorce? And Other Final Election Predictions

2020-10-30.abstract: His corrosiveness has caused friends to lose trust.
2020-10-30.snippet: His corrosiveness has caused friends to lose trust.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Many of my oldest friends are voting for President Trump on Tuesday.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Friendships Trump Pulled Apart

2020-10-30.abstract: Nathan Hartman and Christopher Sipes each had been in a relationship when they met. Eventually both became single and saw each other through more romantic eyes.
2020-10-30.snippet: Nathan Hartman and Christopher Sipes each had been in a relationship when they met. Eventually both became single and saw each other through more romantic eyes.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Nathan Hartman and Christopher Sipes first met in March 2011 when they were introduced by mutual friends at a dinner in Atlanta, where they both lived.
2020-10-30.headline_main: These Two Were Otherwise Engaged. A Decade Later, They’re Wed.

2020-10-30.abstract: America has become just as cynically transactional in its foreign dealings as Russia and China.
2020-10-30.snippet: America has become just as cynically transactional in its foreign dealings as Russia and China.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: There is no escaping it: America is on the ballot on Tuesday — the stability and quality of our governing institutions, our alliances, how we treat one another, our basic commitment to scientific principles and the minimum decency that we expect from our leaders. The whole ball of wax is on the ballot.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Trump Has Made the Whole World Darker

2020-10-30.abstract: Trump may have beaten Hillary Clinton, but the story doesn’t end there.
2020-10-30.snippet: Trump may have beaten Hillary Clinton, but the story doesn’t end there.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: One of my clearest memories of election night in 2016 is running into women who were going to watch the results with their daughters, so they’d get to share the experience of seeing Hillary Clinton elected president — the moment when the political glass ceiling in America would be shattered forever.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Woman President Who Wasn’t

2020-10-30.abstract: Under Trump, the politics of resentment now govern the Republican Party.
2020-10-30.snippet: Under Trump, the politics of resentment now govern the Republican Party.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: If Amy Coney Barrett’s confirmation to the Supreme Court turns out to be the last major act of a one-term Trump presidency, it will be a fitting finale. Republicans, like the Federalist Party of yore, will consolidate power in the judiciary. Apart from that, they will have spent the past four years squandering their reputation, forsaking their principles, and trashing the kind of political culture they once claimed to hold dear.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Goodbye Principled Conservatism

2020-10-30.abstract: Samyukta Mullangi and Mohit Agrawal connected on the dating app the League. He disappeared for two months, but when he re-emerged, they had a six-hour first date.
2020-10-30.snippet: Samyukta Mullangi and Mohit Agrawal connected on the dating app the League. He disappeared for two months, but when he re-emerged, they had a six-hour first date.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: In July 2018, Dr. Samyukta Mullangi, now 31 and a first-year hematology-oncology fellow at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York, met Mohit Agrawal, also 31 and the deputy policy director to Gov. Ned Lamont, Democrat of Connecticut, on the dating app the League.
2020-10-30.headline_main: At First He Ghosted, Then They Became a Couple

2020-10-30.abstract: She is a planner and he is not, and she lived in New York City while he lives in California’s East Bay. Nonetheless, they made it work.
2020-10-30.snippet: She is a planner and he is not, and she lived in New York City while he lives in California’s East Bay. Nonetheless, they made it work.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: A few matters might have stood in the way of a relationship between Mallika Pereira and Dr. Kennedy Cosgrove. She is a committed planner and he said his best friend in medical school referred to him as “Mr. TBD.” She lived in New York. He lives in Lafayette, Calif.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Don’t Write Off the Persistent Man From California

2020-10-30.abstract: Elaine Joseph and Sean Casey, both Oklahomans, met when they were working in the Senate.
2020-10-30.snippet: Elaine Joseph and Sean Casey, both Oklahomans, met when they were working in the Senate.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: More than three years after they met, Sean Christian Casey finally asked Elaine Gabrielle Joseph on a first date.
2020-10-30.headline_main: A West Wing First Date

2020-10-30.abstract: Latino communities haven’t forgotten Obama’s promise.
2020-10-30.snippet: Latino communities haven’t forgotten Obama’s promise.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Latinos know that Democrats are great at making promises. Now Democrats have to prove that they’re also great at keeping them.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Biden Can Fix Latinos’ Disappointment With Democrats

2020-10-30.abstract: The 2016 election should have forced change on all our factions. With Trump’s help, they’ve all reverted back to type.
2020-10-30.snippet: The 2016 election should have forced change on all our factions. With Trump’s help, they’ve all reverted back to type.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: In the original Greek the term “apocalypse” refers to an unveiling, the gray rain clouds of the everyday world torn away and something long hidden finally revealed. The political apocalypse of 2016, when Donald Trump improbably vanquished the establishment of both parties, fits this ancient definition perfectly: It was a moment when all kinds of uncomfortable truths about American life were suddenly exposed, when the hidden realities of our country and our coalitions were suddenly dragged up into the light, when the failures in both parties and every faction were laid bare.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Have We Learned Nothing After Four Years of Trump?

2020-10-30.abstract: Many of the worst things the president has said and done were said and done by his predecessors.
2020-10-30.snippet: Many of the worst things the president has said and done were said and done by his predecessors.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: For many millions of Americans, the presidency of Donald Trump has been a kind of transgression, an endless assault on dignity, decency and decorum. They experience everything — the casual insults, the vulgar tweets, the open racism, the lying, the tacit support for dangerous extremists and admiration of foreign strongmen — as an attack on the fabric of American society itself. And they see the worst of this administration, like separating children from their families at the border, as an unparalleled offense against the values of American democracy.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Don’t Fool Yourself. Trump Is Not an Aberration.

2020-10-30.abstract: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi makes Hindus more equal than religious minorities, Muslims seek equality from the secular Constitution, not Shariah.
2020-10-30.snippet: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi makes Hindus more equal than religious minorities, Muslims seek equality from the secular Constitution, not Shariah.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: By now, the world knows that Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India and his Hindu supremacist Bharatiya Janata Party (B.J.P.) have eroded the liberal principles of the Indian Constitution and are turning the country into an increasingly illiberal democracy. It is common knowledge that Mr. Modi thrives on the grievances and bigotries that pit privileged majorities against minorities living in fear.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Why India’s Muslims Reach for Liberalism

2020-10-30.abstract: Some New Yorkers are trying to find a way to celebrate Halloween despite concerns about the spread of the coronavirus.
2020-10-30.snippet: Some New Yorkers are trying to find a way to celebrate Halloween despite concerns about the spread of the coronavirus.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Each Halloween, Holly Bonner and her two daughters would spend up to three hours trick-or-treating at houses and businesses before returning home on Staten Island to pass out candy themselves.
2020-10-30.headline_main: When Trick-or-Treating Is Scary, for Real

2020-10-30.abstract: A rising young player with a lot of passion for tennis and rapping.
2020-10-30.snippet: A rising young player with a lot of passion for tennis and rapping.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: With a lefty forehand that crackles like a campfire, a stunning one-hand backhand and a backward baseball cap that dips to just above his eyebrows, Denis Shapovalov is a stirring reminder of the swaggering, swashbuckling days of Andre Agassi.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Swagger of Denis Shapovalov

2020-10-30.abstract: “You know you’re going to be my boyfriend, right?” Jaime Oliva asked Edward Williams, long before they began dating. Mr. Williams brushed him off at first but eventually had a change of heart.
2020-10-30.snippet: “You know you’re going to be my boyfriend, right?” Jaime Oliva asked Edward Williams, long before they began dating. Mr. Williams brushed him off at first but eventually had a change of heart.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Jaime Oliva stepped out of an Uber and into harm’s way. Mr. Oliva, 30, a senior adviser for strategic management at the Department of Health and Human Services, was returning to his Washington office and looking razor sharp after visiting his barber in July 2017.
2020-10-30.headline_main: They Crossed Paths at Howard but Caught Feelings in a Hurricane

2020-10-30.abstract: The Democratic nominee is seeking to balance experience and diversity in preparing a team for a potential administration if he wins in November.
2020-10-30.snippet: The Democratic nominee is seeking to balance experience and diversity in preparing a team for a potential administration if he wins in November.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If he wins the presidency, Joseph R. Biden Jr. will inherit an economy struggling to recover from its steepest plunge in decades. His economic team will need to help workers and businesses survive a pandemic winter, while developing policies to address the racial and income inequalities the crisis has exacerbated in the labor market.
2020-10-30.headline_main: In Building Economic Team, Biden Faces Tug From Left and Center

2020-10-30.abstract: Riders and revenues are way down at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. Its bonds look risky, but some investors are tempted.
2020-10-30.snippet: Riders and revenues are way down at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. Its bonds look risky, but some investors are tempted.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: You can make a lot of money betting on government bailouts.
2020-10-30.headline_main: New York Subway’s Pain Could Bring Riches for Bond Investors

2020-10-30.abstract: Trump unleashed our inner Scrooge.
2020-10-30.snippet: Trump unleashed our inner Scrooge.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Back in the early 2000s, an academic named Robert Sampson did one of the better-known studies in urban sociology of the past 20 years, discreetly dropping thousands of stamped and addressed letters all over the streets of Chicago. What he was looking for, essentially, was to see which neighborhoods would be most diligent about dropping those letters in mailboxes rather than allowing them to collect footprints on the sidewalk and turn to pulp.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The President Has Made Selfishness Our National Credo

2020-10-30.abstract: Many Americans have lost the comfortable bliss of not paying attention to politics.
2020-10-30.snippet: Many Americans have lost the comfortable bliss of not paying attention to politics.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: What did we talk about before Donald Trump? What will we talk about after Donald Trump? Will there even be an after? And was there ever really a before?
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Fury Against Trump Has Begun a Great Democratic Awakening

2020-10-30.abstract: In Pennsylvania and other battlegrounds, both parties are succeeding in coaxing infrequent voters off the sidelines. The all-important question is who does it better.
2020-10-30.snippet: In Pennsylvania and other battlegrounds, both parties are succeeding in coaxing infrequent voters off the sidelines. The all-important question is who does it better.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]
2020-10-30.headline_main: 2016 Nonvoters, a Key Prize for Biden and Trump, Turn Out in Droves

2020-10-30.abstract: At a shipyard in Turkey, the boats, including some from Carnival’s Fantasy fleet, are being turned into scrap, even as the industry hopes to find a way to start sailing.
2020-10-30.snippet: At a shipyard in Turkey, the boats, including some from Carnival’s Fantasy fleet, are being turned into scrap, even as the industry hopes to find a way to start sailing.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Along the meandering industrial peninsula of Aliaga on Turkey’s Aegean coast, the contents of gutted vessels lay strewn on the dusty roadside, scattered among clusters of orange lifeboats that tower so high they obscure the dramatic scene unfolding in the shipyard below.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Where Cruise Ships Are Sent to Die

2020-10-30.abstract: Coronavirus tests are free, yet data show some wealthy neighborhoods are testing at nearly four times the rate of poor neighborhoods. Why?
2020-10-30.snippet: Coronavirus tests are free, yet data show some wealthy neighborhoods are testing at nearly four times the rate of poor neighborhoods. Why?
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: This week, in an anxious nation where nearly any encounter with a screen has become triggering, Kim Kardashian West took a shot with all her firepower, announcing plans for her 40th birthday. To the undoing of Twitter, she noted that she had flown friends and family to a private island to pretend “things were normal just for a brief moment.” The pandemic at the heart of the current peculiarities was easily circumvented by quarantine and “2 weeks of multiple health screens.”
2020-10-30.headline_main: Some Areas of N.Y.C. Are Getting a Lot More Testing. Guess Which Ones.

2020-10-30.abstract: A Justice Department guide notes that voter intimidation is “amorphous and largely subjective in nature.”
2020-10-30.snippet: A Justice Department guide notes that voter intimidation is “amorphous and largely subjective in nature.”
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Some voter intimidation is blatant, like the time when off-duty sheriff’s deputies and police officers in New Jersey patrolled predominantly Black and Latino polling places on Election Day while wearing armbands with a made-up name, the National Ballot Security Task Force.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Armed Observers, Chants of ‘4 More Years’ at Polls: Is That Legal?

2020-10-30.abstract: The different mix of jobs is a big driver, but there are other factors, too.
2020-10-30.snippet: The different mix of jobs is a big driver, but there are other factors, too.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus recession has been more severe in Democratic-leaning places than in Republican-leaning ones. Blue states like Massachusetts and California have had steeper job losses, higher unemployment and bigger drops in job postings than red states like Utah and Missouri.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Why Blue Places Have Been Hit Harder Economically Than Red Ones

2020-10-30.abstract: Spirits may be low around the country, but don’t expect them to be raised in the White House after the election; neither President Trump nor Joseph R. Biden Jr. partakes in alcohol.
2020-10-30.snippet: Spirits may be low around the country, but don’t expect them to be raised in the White House after the election; neither President Trump nor Joseph R. Biden Jr. partakes in alcohol.

2020-10-30.abstract: Current and former Trump administration officials are worried about what might happen on Nov. 4.
2020-10-30.snippet: Current and former Trump administration officials are worried about what might happen on Nov. 4.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: There will of course be an Election Day — and it could be one of tumult, banners colliding, incidents at the polls and attempted hacks galore. More likely than not, it will end without a winner named or at least generally accepted.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Day After Election Day

2020-10-30.abstract: Oakland County, Mich., a Republican stronghold 12 years ago that is now solidly Democratic, is a prime example of the political evolution taking place in many of the nation’s suburbs.
2020-10-30.snippet: Oakland County, Mich., a Republican stronghold 12 years ago that is now solidly Democratic, is a prime example of the political evolution taking place in many of the nation’s suburbs.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: WATERFORD, Mich. — President Trump campaigned on Friday at an airport hangar in Waterford, a city in Oakland County northwest of Detroit, and a place that has very much changed from the last time he visited there for a rally five weeks before the 2016 election.
2020-10-30.headline_main: In Michigan, a Suburban County That Flipped Blue Isn’t Looking Back

2020-10-30.abstract: Nick Hoefly tends to bees among the tombs of Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn. Happy Halloween.
2020-10-30.snippet: Nick Hoefly tends to bees among the tombs of Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn. Happy Halloween.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, Nick Hoefly picked up his first queen bee in Pennsylvania, and drove her, along with 12,000 of her buzzing subjects, to their new home — his home — in Queens.
2020-10-30.headline_main: How an Urban Beekeeper Spends His Sundays

2020-10-30.abstract: With a typewriter and a mailbox, a sidewalk project explores the art of consoling those who need good news.
2020-10-30.snippet: With a typewriter and a mailbox, a sidewalk project explores the art of consoling those who need good news.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: On a recent foggy morning, Brandon Woolf was sitting on a foldable chair, in front of a foldable table, next to a Brooklyn mailbox, writing letters on a 1940s-vintage portable Royal typewriter. He was dressed in a navy blue T-shirt emblazoned with the U.S. Postal Service logo. A chalkboard sign in front of him explained the project to passers-by: “Free Letters for Friends Feeling Blue.”
2020-10-30.headline_main: Why This Professor Is Writing Letters for People Feeling Blue

2020-10-30.abstract: The old William Ulmer Brewery in Bushwick is trying to push its way into the present day.
2020-10-30.snippet: The old William Ulmer Brewery in Bushwick is trying to push its way into the present day.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: The old William Ulmer Brewery in Bushwick is trying to push its way into the present day.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Storied History of a Brewery in Brooklyn

2020-10-30.abstract: Remnants of 19th-century Bushwick still exist at the William Ulmer Brewery. A castle-like, two-story office is on the market as residences, while other plans have been stalled by the pandemic.
2020-10-30.snippet: Remnants of 19th-century Bushwick still exist at the William Ulmer Brewery. A castle-like, two-story office is on the market as residences, while other plans have been stalled by the pandemic.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: In 1985, while living on a friend’s couch after being thrown out of a studio in Long Island City, Jay Swift, a young sculptor, spent months scouring the city for a place where he could live and make art for the long haul. While prowling grungy, postindustrial Bushwick on his old Dawes bicycle, he turned the corner onto a one-block street called Belvidere and found himself gawking at what looked like an intimate little castle made of fiery orange-red brick and terra cotta.
2020-10-30.headline_main: In Brooklyn, a Ghost of Breweries Past

2020-10-30.abstract: Test your knowledge of this week’s health quiz.
2020-10-30.snippet: Test your knowledge of this week’s health quiz.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Test your knowledge of this week’s health quiz.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Weekly Health Quiz: Marijuana, Lullabies and Coronavirus

2020-10-30.abstract: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2020-10-30.snippet: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: ALL BLOOD RUNS RED: The Legendary Life of Eugene Bullard — Boxer, Pilot, Soldier, Spy, by Phil Keith with Tom Clavin. (Hanover Square, 352 pp., $17.99.) This “absorbing” biography of the first Black American fighter pilot “reads like a picaresque novel,” our reviewer, Thomas E. Ricks, noted. Bullard fled the Jim Crow South as a boy by stowing away on a freighter to Europe, where he fought for the French Foreign Legion and ran a Paris nightclub, among other exploits.
2020-10-30.headline_main: New in Paperback: ‘All Blood Runs Red’ and ‘Frankissstein’

2020-10-30.abstract: Donald Trump has made America exceptional all right — exceptionally off track.

2020-10-30.abstract: The band’s 2010 debut alienated as many listeners as it inspired before Salem dropped out of sight. Its new “Fires in Heaven” arrives in a different landscape.
2020-10-30.snippet: The band’s 2010 debut alienated as many listeners as it inspired before Salem dropped out of sight. Its new “Fires in Heaven” arrives in a different landscape.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: A decade ago, it felt practically mandatory for a certain kind of in-the-know music fan to have an opinion on Salem, and it wasn’t likely to be a neutral one. The Midwestern trio of Jack Donoghue, John Holland and Heather Marlatt had been anointed the godparents of a heady strain of nihilistic electronic music that seemed to alienate as many listeners as it bewitched.
2020-10-30.headline_main: A Decade Later, Salem Returns to an Even Darker World

2020-10-30.abstract: It may be tempting, one economist says, to think that if your side wins, the economy will be all right. But no matter who wins, it may not be as good or as bad as you think.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: In September 2011, some of the nation’s biggest banks were about to sign a $4 billion legal settlement with regulators for improperly foreclosing on homeowners. But Kamala Harris, the attorney general of California, felt it didn’t do nearly enough to help her constituents. She told lawyers for JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America that if the banks didn’t raise their offer, she would walk. And when they balked, she did.

Or should I be shielding them from my worries so that they feel safe and grounded?

2020-10-30.abstract: Many of Wisconsin’s swing voters live in and south of Green Bay, a region of old mill towns and farms burning with coronavirus infections and personality-driven politics.
2020-10-30.snippet: Many of Wisconsin’s swing voters live in and south of Green Bay, a region of old mill towns and farms burning with coronavirus infections and personality-driven politics.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: LITTLE CHUTE, Wis. — The 12,000 residents of this village 24 miles south of Green Bay backed Barack Obama in 2012 and Donald Trump in 2016. But in 2018 they made a narrow split decision — a 461-vote margin for Gov. Scott Walker, a conservative Republican, and a 132-vote advantage for Senator Tammy Baldwin, a liberal Democrat.

Taylor’s first exhibition with Hauser & Wirth will open at the gallery’s space in Somerset, England, in February.

Skakel, a neighbor and a cousin of the Kennedys, was ultimately charged and found guilty of murder, but his conviction was overturned by the state’s highest court.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: It’s all Byron’s fault. Before James Dean and Gary Cooper and Heathcliff and Rochester — all the real and fictional men lounging at the center of the Venn diagram of “bad boys” and “sad boys” — Byron made such a career of drinking, lusting and gallivanting that he became a type. The Byronic hero: temperamental, hedonistic and romantic. “I am such a strange mélange of good and evil,” the poet once wrote of himself, “that it would be difficult to describe me.” Save it for your Tinder profile, bro.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Review: ‘Touch of the Poet’ is a Powerful Study in Toxic Pride

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Here at Daily Distortions, we try to debunk false and misleading information that has gone viral. We also want to give you a sense of how popular that misinformation is, in the overall context of what is being discussed on social media. Each Friday, we feature a list of the 10 most-engaged stories of the week in the United States, as ranked by NewsWhip, a firm that compiles social media performance data. (NewsWhip tracks the number of reactions, shares and comments each story receives on Facebook, along with shares on Pinterest and by a group of influential users on Twitter.) This week’s data runs from 9:01 a.m. on Friday, Oct. 23, until 9 a.m. on Friday, Oct. 30.

2020-10-30.abstract: Hospitalizations have been slowly but steadily rising in New York City, eliciting painful memories of the surge of infections in the spring that killed more than 20,000 people. But this time is different: Patients with serious cases are spending less time in the hospital on average and are less likely to be put on ventilators. And fewer patients are dying.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: As a veteran television journalist, Sally-Ann Roberts knows how to tame an unsteady landscape and will it into submission. She survived 40 years reporting and anchoring the news for WWL-TV in New Orleans, covering 10 races for mayor and in 2005, Hurricane Katrina, a storm that submerged four-fifths of the city in water and left her rebuilding her home for nearly two unforgiving years. But as far as grandparenting during the coronavirus pandemic, she says she’s met her match.

2020-10-30.abstract: The first episode of Season 2, released on Friday, suggests that the Disney+ space western probably won’t move far, far away from what worked last year.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Almost a year ago, the “Star Wars” spinoff series “The Mandalorian” debuted on Disney+ with a first episode that had been kept mostly under wraps — unseen by the critics and largely unspoiled by advertising. That secrecy preserved what turned out to be a wonderful surprise: the introduction a fun new character, called “the Child” on the show but immediately dubbed “Baby Yoda” by the fans. This tiny, adorable, superpowered creature became TV’s breakout star last fall, raising the question of what Jon Favreau, the creator of “The Mandalorian,” might possibly spring on the audience in the second season.
2020-10-30.headline_main: ‘The Mandalorian’ Season Premiere Recap: Back in the Saddle With Baby Yoda

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — On paper the European economy is snapping back smartly from the pandemic, growing more in the third quarter than it ever had. But images from Paris, Madrid and Frankfurt tell a different story. Cafes are rolling up their awnings, theaters are canceling performances, and it’s starting to look like March again on city streets.

2020-10-30.abstract: Falling back, for better or worse.
2020-10-30.snippet: Falling back, for better or worse.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Welcome. Daylight saving time ends this weekend, clocks “falling back” one hour to standard time on Sunday. Depending on where you live, this may mean earlier morning light and sunsets that strike in the afternoon. Larks and owls have been having it out over the utility of changing the clocks since the practice was instituted in the United States during World War I to conserve energy. “What do the men around here do with their extra hour?,” one “ruralite” was reported to have asked of Marcus M. Marks, a Manhattan borough president who advocated for daylight saving time. “They spend it in the dance halls and then the trouble begins,” he claimed.
2020-10-30.headline_main: What Will You Do With the ‘Extra Hour’?

2020-10-30.abstract: The Baltimore Museum of Art and the Brooklyn Museum both planned on selling works last Wednesday at auction, but Baltimore paused the sale after much criticism.

2020-10-30.abstract: About one in 10 voters could still be considered “volatile,” half the number as at this point in 2016, but this time around, most of them have an unfavorable opinion of Donald J. Trump.

In mid-October he told a New York Times/Siena College poll he wasn’t yet won over by either President Trump or Joseph R. Biden Jr.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Undecided Voters Could Still Decide the Election. They Tend to Dislike Trump.

2020-10-30.abstract: A defensive star in Green Bay — he ran back seven interceptions for touchdowns — he played on five championship teams under Vince Lombardi and one in Dallas.
2020-10-30.snippet: A defensive star in Green Bay — he ran back seven interceptions for touchdowns — he played on five championship teams under Vince Lombardi and one in Dallas.

He was 81.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Herb Adderley, a Packers Hall of Fame Cornerback, Dies at 81

2020-10-30.abstract: Join us on a sonic journey back through the presidential campaign in preparation for Election Day.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: The 2020 campaign — like much of the year — has been filled with convulsions and unexpected turns. And The Daily team, along with our guest reporters, have been there for it all. Over the last few months, we have drilled down on what the candidates truly stand for and traveled into towns and cities across the country to document the hopes and anxieties among voters.
2020-10-30.headline_main: The Daily: An Audio Guide to the Election

2020-10-30.abstract: It’s a familiar line in Texas political circles: The last time Democrats carried the state in a presidential race was when Jimmy Carter won in 1976. Now, at 96, the man who accomplished that feat is lending his name to a fund-raising appeal to help his party possibly flip as many as 10 congressional seats in the Lone Star State.

2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — More than 99,000 coronavirus infections were reported across the United States on Friday, setting the single-day record for cases as the nation’s outbreak spiraled further out of control. The previous record had been set only a day earlier, providing a sense of how quickly the current surge is mounting.
2020-10-30.headline_main: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Set New Record as Infections Soar
