2020-10-30.headline_main: Cruise Ships Can Sail Again, With Strict Rules. Here’s What to Know.

2020-10-30.abstract: Once denounced by French leaders, the images are now defended across the political spectrum, widening a divide with Muslim nations and leaving many French Muslims alienated.
2020-10-30.snippet: Once denounced by French leaders, the images are now defended across the political spectrum, widening a divide with Muslim nations and leaving many French Muslims alienated.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: NICE, France — When the satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo republished caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad in early September, it triggered a chain of events that included two stabbings, protests in Muslim nations, the boycott of French goods and criticism from allies. Tensions rose higher when one young Islamist extremist beheaded a teacher near Paris this month, and another slit the throats of two people and fatally stabbed another inside a church in the southern city of Nice this week.
2020-10-30.headline_main: France’s Hardening Defense of Cartoons of Muhammad Could Lead to ‘a Trap’

2020-10-30.abstract: There are many parallels between 1860 and 2020. Let’s hope there aren’t too many.
2020-10-30.snippet: There are many parallels between 1860 and 2020. Let’s hope there aren’t too many.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Long before Covid-19, Alexis de Tocqueville described a presidential election as a form of sickness in which the body politic became dangerously “feverish” before returning to normal. Emotions ran too hot, and the fragile forms of consensus that were essential for democracy — what Tocqueville called our “habits of the heart” — evaporated, as party hacks exhausted themselves in vitriolic attacks on one another and the system.
2020-10-30.headline_main: How Lincoln Survived the Worst Election Ever

2020-10-30.abstract: Toxic ideas can be turned into literal demons — and defeated.
2020-10-30.snippet: Toxic ideas can be turned into literal demons — and defeated.
2020-10-30.lead_paragraph: Political satire seems virtually impossible these days. How do you make fun of leaders and institutions when some of them are so bonkers that it feels like Borat is going to pop out at any minute and tell us we’re on camera? But satire is still healthy, if you’re willing to look in the right place: horror stories.
2020-10-30.headline_main: Political Satire Isn’t Dead. It’s Been Turned Into Horror Stories.

In another nursing home, Susan’s toenails grew so long that she could not squeeze into her shoes. Ida lost 37 pounds and stopped speaking. Minnie cried and asked God to just take her.

There are loads of odd interesting entries, none faddish, many charmingly retro (like these guys, from 1994). Also, note how lovingly Ms. Zawistowski clues her little fill, all those short entries that we need to solve in order to chip away at the tough stuff.

A tiny two-pump gas station is the town’s only commercial building, along with a Bureau of Land Management bunkhouse, a shed-like post office, a small schoolhouse and a church.

She compared it to when she and four friends escaped to a woodsy cabin in Maryland and tried cannabis edibles. “Time stopped,” Ms. Baer, 35, said. “And this is how time feels in this pandemic. Fluid and very confusing.”

2020-10-31.abstract: On an empty lot near Phoenix, perhaps the most auto-addicted city in America, a start-up is betting $170 million on a more walkable future.
2020-10-31.snippet: On an empty lot near Phoenix, perhaps the most auto-addicted city in America, a start-up is betting $170 million on a more walkable future.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Phoenix, that featureless and ever-spreading tundra of concrete, has been called “the world’s least sustainable city.” It has been characterized as a “sprawling, suburbanite wasteland” and “a monument to man’s arrogance.” The Onion has darkly predicted that by 2050, “most of Earth’s landmass” will be swallowed by the encroaching Phoenix exurbs. The Walk Score index ranks the place as the second-worst big city in America for pedestrians, and traversing it has been described as “a slog through a desert, plus the occasional McDonald’s.”
2020-10-31.headline_main: The Capital of Sprawl Gets a Radically Car-Free Neighborhood

2020-10-31.abstract: To legions of fans who have watched a parade of actors play Agent 007, none played the part as magnetically or as indelibly as Mr. Connery.
2020-10-31.snippet: To legions of fans who have watched a parade of actors play Agent 007, none played the part as magnetically or as indelibly as Mr. Connery.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Sean Connery, the irascible Scot from the slums of Edinburgh who found international fame as Hollywood’s original James Bond, dismayed his fans by walking away from the Bond franchise and went on to have a long and fruitful career as a respected actor and an always bankable star, has died in Nassau, the Bahamas. He was 90.
2020-10-31.headline_main: Sean Connery, Who Embodied James Bond and More, Dies at 90

2020-10-31.abstract: Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s cabinet proposed the move on Saturday as medical experts warned that the virus would soon overwhelm hospitals if the government did not take draconian action.
2020-10-31.snippet: Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s cabinet proposed the move on Saturday as medical experts warned that the virus would soon overwhelm hospitals if the government did not take draconian action.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced plans on Saturday to shut down pubs, restaurants and most retail shops throughout England, a stark reversal in the face of grim projections that the country could face a deadly winter from the coronavirus unless it takes draconian action.
2020-10-31.headline_main: England to Shut Pubs, Restaurants and Most Shops as Virus Surges

2020-10-31.headline_main: As Tanzania’s President Wins a Second Term, Opposition Calls for Protests

2020-10-31.headline_main: Did This Building Grow a Beard? Nope. Those Are Legs.

2020-10-31.abstract: Co-op shareholders are responsible for keeping the building financially stable. But what happens when they don’t want to pay a new fee?
2020-10-31.snippet: Co-op shareholders are responsible for keeping the building financially stable. But what happens when they don’t want to pay a new fee?
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Q: I live in a Manhattan co-op. Our building plans to levy an assessment on shareholders because it is no longer receiving rent from commercial tenants due to Covid-19. We’ve already been paying an assessment for two years for other reasons. That fee was supposed to end soon, now it might increase. Do I have a legal right to fight this?
2020-10-31.headline_main: My Co-op Is Losing Revenue in the Pandemic. Do I Have to Pay?

2020-10-31.abstract: The sudden increase of time with their children has reminded some low-income parents of what they have been missing. “It’s an odd silver lining, but it’s there,” says Jane Waldfogel, a professor at the Columbia School of Social Work.
2020-10-31.snippet: The sudden increase of time with their children has reminded some low-income parents of what they have been missing. “It’s an odd silver lining, but it’s there,” says Jane Waldfogel, a professor at the Columbia School of Social Work.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: In six months without steady work, Gregory Pike, a single father in Las Vegas, has fallen behind on his rent and utilities, borrowed money he cannot repay, turned to food stamps and charity, and fretted that his setbacks may cloud his daughter’s future.
2020-10-31.headline_main: When Parents Lose Their Jobs, Their Children Also Suffer. But Sometimes There’s a Consolation.

2020-10-31.abstract: After chafing against their isolation for so long, Australians these days are finding island life a privilege when pestilence lies beyond.
2020-10-31.snippet: After chafing against their isolation for so long, Australians these days are finding island life a privilege when pestilence lies beyond.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — They used to call it “the tyranny of distance.” Australia’s remoteness was something to escape, and for generations, the country that hates being referred to as “down under” has been rushing toward the world. Trade and immigration made Australians richer than the Swiss, creating a culture where life can be complete only with overseas trips and imported purchases.
2020-10-31.headline_main: Cut Off From the World Again, Australia Now Finds Silver Linings

2020-10-31.abstract: Hearty and consoling dishes.

2020-10-31.headline_main: Comfort Food Forever

2020-10-31.abstract: Whether as James Bond or Indiana Jones’s father, the Scottish star played the man’s man with an earthy sexiness, as these performances prove.
2020-10-31.snippet: Whether as James Bond or Indiana Jones’s father, the Scottish star played the man’s man with an earthy sexiness, as these performances prove.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Sean Connery died Saturday at the age of 90. Best known for originating the role of James Bond in movies, the Scottish actor had a career that lasted nearly 60 years, most of which he spent playing a variety of “man’s man” roles — from suave spies to violent brutes. At a time when most popular British thespians were known as Shakespearean-trained aesthetes, Connery became an international star with a screen presence that was earthier and sexier. His musical highland burr and awe-inspiring physicality immediately drew eyes and ears, even when he was playing opposite some of the most accomplished and attractive performers of his generation.
2020-10-31.headline_main: 15 Sean Connery Movies to Stream

2020-10-31.abstract: Florida’s 26th Congressional District seemed like the rare pickup opportunity for Republicans. But the campaign has been complicated by the coronavirus and the presidential election.
2020-10-31.snippet: Florida’s 26th Congressional District seemed like the rare pickup opportunity for Republicans. But the campaign has been complicated by the coronavirus and the presidential election.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — It felt like 100 degrees on a recent Saturday when Carlos A. Gimenez, the Republican candidate in Florida’s most competitive congressional race, stood on a busy street corner in the Miami suburbs with a gaggle of masked relatives and campaign volunteers, waving signs at the honking cars.
2020-10-31.headline_main: The Race for Miami’s Perennial Tossup Seat Starts Leaning Democratic

2020-10-31.snippet: Over the past four years, The New York Times has independently obtained and published information on several decades of Donald J. Trump’s taxes.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Over the last several weeks, The New York Times has published the findings of its investigation into more than 20 years of President Trump’s federal income tax records — information that he has fought to keep hidden in defiance of presidential tradition.

2020-10-31.snippet: John Forbes returns with a proper cryptic challenge.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: CRYPTIC CROSSWORD — I’m getting down to the nitty-gritty this week — quick explainers and links to spoilers. By my reckoning, we have solved one John Forbes cryptic in these environs, but Mr. Forbes is a longtime cryptic “setter” and you can find plenty more of his puzzles for future solves.

2020-10-31.abstract: “Mr. Trump presented himself as a class traitor who would bring the billionaires to heel,” but did the opposite, a reader says.
2020-10-31.snippet: “Mr. Trump presented himself as a class traitor who would bring the billionaires to heel,” but did the opposite, a reader says.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

2020-10-31.abstract: New outbreaks used to be traced back to crowded factories and rowdy bars. But now, the virus is so widespread not even health officials are able to keep up.
2020-10-31.snippet: New outbreaks used to be traced back to crowded factories and rowdy bars. But now, the virus is so widespread not even health officials are able to keep up.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: When the coronavirus first erupted in Sioux Falls, S.D., in the spring, Mayor Paul TenHaken arrived at work each morning with a clear mission: Stop the outbreak at the pork plant. Hundreds of employees, chopping meat shoulder to shoulder, had gotten sick in what was then the largest virus cluster in the United States.
2020-10-31.headline_main: How Are Americans Catching the Virus? Increasingly, ‘They Have No Idea’

2020-10-31.abstract: As President Trump urges supporters to watch for fraud at polling places, people inside the polls already are keeping watch — and usually not finding much.
2020-10-31.snippet: As President Trump urges supporters to watch for fraud at polling places, people inside the polls already are keeping watch — and usually not finding much.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Amid the clamor of President Trump’s continuing demands for his supporters to look out for fraud at polling places, it is easy to overlook the fact that in many polling places, someone already is keeping watch.
2020-10-31.headline_main: Poll Watchers Endure, Minus the Partisan Drama

2020-10-31.abstract: Obama will head to South Florida and Atlanta on Monday, Biden campaign announces.
2020-10-31.snippet: Obama will head to South Florida and Atlanta on Monday, Biden campaign announces.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Former President Barack Obama will travel to to Atlanta and South Florida on Monday, the Biden campaign announced Saturday afternoon, a move aimed at boosting turnout in closely contested states where victories for the former vice president would open multiple paths to the White House.

2020-10-31.abstract: An unknown assailant fired twice at the priest before fleeing the scene, authorities said. The attack came amid heightened tensions in France after an Islamist terrorist attack in Nice that left three dead.

2020-10-31.abstract: Immigration was a defining issue for President Trump in 2016. It’s less dominant in 2020, and it is motivating his critics as well as his supporters.
2020-10-31.snippet: Immigration was a defining issue for President Trump in 2016. It’s less dominant in 2020, and it is motivating his critics as well as his supporters.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: YUMA, Ariz. — It might be seen as a monument to the massive changes the Trump administration has brought to the country’s immigration system. Or it could be seen as a reason people are fighting fiercely to vote him out.
2020-10-31.headline_main: The ‘Wall’ Is Still Motivating Voters. But This Time Is It Against Trump?

2020-10-31.abstract: Its name was Observation Post Rock. The outpost is the backdrop for a ghost story, and is known for strange voices, radio static and the creeping fear of being watched.
2020-10-31.snippet: Its name was Observation Post Rock. The outpost is the backdrop for a ghost story, and is known for strange voices, radio static and the creeping fear of being watched.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — It seemed the perfect vantage point for the Marines: a 30-foot-high dirt pile overlooking the low-lying poppy fields of Helmand Province. What they could not explain were the strange lights at night, the whispers in the darkness, the mysterious radio static, the sudden chill in a summer breeze and the recurring whiff of corpses.
2020-10-31.headline_main: An Ancient Hill and Forgotten Dead: Afghanistan’s Haunted Outpost

2020-10-31.abstract: Her mother watched her heartbreaking decline over three swift weeks, starting in mid-September, when Elvia began experiencing headaches.

2020-10-31.abstract: Prosecutors in Connecticut said they did not have enough evidence to pursue a second trial against Michael C. Skakel, who was convicted of killing Martha Moxley in 1975 when they were both 15.
2020-10-31.snippet: Prosecutors in Connecticut said they did not have enough evidence to pursue a second trial against Michael C. Skakel, who was convicted of killing Martha Moxley in 1975 when they were both 15.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors in Connecticut said on Friday that they would not retry Michael C. Skakel for the murder of his 15-year-old neighbor 45 years ago, ending a case that transfixed much of the country and went all the way up to the United States Supreme Court.
2020-10-31.headline_main: How the Skakel-Moxley Murder Case Unfolded Over Four Decades

2020-10-31.abstract: Julian Lim’s Sunday puzzle tilts us slightly in another direction.
2020-10-31.snippet: Julian Lim’s Sunday puzzle tilts us slightly in another direction.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Weekend solvers are familiar with Julian Lim; he’s constructed 11 themeless Fridays and Saturdays for the Times over the last several years. This might strike you as logical, if you’re noticing (like I did) a high degree of difficulty in the fill. This is only Mr. Lim’s second Sunday; its theme is straightforward and low-key brilliant, in my opinion, when viewed as a whole.
2020-10-31.headline_main: West-Southwest

2020-10-31.abstract: With sustained winds of up to 135 miles an hour at landfall, the storm barreled across Luzon, the country’s most populous island, but mostly missed the capital. At least 16 people were killed.
2020-10-31.snippet: With sustained winds of up to 135 miles an hour at landfall, the storm barreled across Luzon, the country’s most populous island, but mostly missed the capital. At least 16 people were killed.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Typhoon Goni, which made landfall in the Philippines with intense winds early on Sunday morning, by the end of the day appeared to have spared the area in and around the capital Manila, with its 13 million residents.
2020-10-31.headline_main: Typhoon Goni Leaves Philippines After Only Grazing Manila

2020-10-31.snippet: The Trump campaign is now automatically checking a box to create recurring weekly donations from supporters until mid-December.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s campaign is raising money for a prolonged political and legal fight long after Nov. 3 and recently began automatically checking a box to withdraw additional weekly contributions from online donors through mid-December — nearly six weeks after Election Day.

2020-10-31.abstract: At a moment when the United States has pulled back from its allies, the former secretary of state lamented the Trump administration’s allergy to international accords.
2020-10-31.snippet: At a moment when the United States has pulled back from its allies, the former secretary of state lamented the Trump administration’s allergy to international accords.
2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the final years of the Cold War, Secretary of State George P. Shultz negotiated the first arms-control treaty in history to eliminate an entire class of nuclear weapons, a crowning achievement of President Ronald Reagan’s tenure and the start of a new era of nuclear de-escalation.
2020-10-31.headline_main: George Shultz Speaks Out for Renewing U.S. Leadership Overseas

2020-10-31.abstract: Police officers and sheriff’s deputies in Graham, N.C., deployed a chemical spray and arrested eight people at a get-out-the-vote march and rally on Saturday, according to the police and participants.

2020-10-31.lead_paragraph: Police officers and sheriff’s deputies in Graham, N.C., deployed a chemical spray and arrested eight people at a march and rally on Saturday that were intended to honor George Floyd and encourage people to vote, according to the police and participants.
